original: de'ang 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi shas las byung bas na rdzas su med kyi btags par yod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'ang 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi shas las byung bas na rdzas su med kyi btags par yod par rig par bya'o //
translated: Since it arises from the predominance of attachment, hostility, and confusion, it should be understood as not existing as a substance but as existing as a designation.

original: de la 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dus gcig tu mi 'byung ba'i phyir yang na ni 'dod chags dang gti mug gi dbang gis g-yeng ba 'byung /
analyzed: de la 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dus gcig tu mi 'byung ba'i phyir yang na ni 'dod chags dang gti mug gi dbang gis g-yeng ba 'byung /
translated: Since attachment and hostility do not occur simultaneously, distraction arises either through the power of attachment and confusion,

original: yang na ni zhe sdang dang gti mug gis g-yeng ba 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na ni zhe sdang dang gti mug gis g-yeng ba 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: or it arises through the power of hostility and confusion.

original: 'di'i las kyang 'dod chags dang bral ba la bar du gcod pa'i las can te /
analyzed: 'di'i las kyang 'dod chags dang bral ba la bar du gcod pa'i las can te /
translated: Its action is to obstruct freedom from attachment.

original: 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan la sems la sems g-yengs par gyur pa rnams la khams gsum gyi 'dod chags spang bar bya ba la bar du gcod cing bgegs byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan la sems la sems g-yengs par gyur pa rnams la khams gsum gyi 'dod chags spang bar bya ba la bar du gcod cing bgegs byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it obstructs and hinders the abandonment of attachment to the three realms in those whose minds are distracted by the five sense pleasures.

original: mdo dag las ni g-yeng ba rnam pa drug tu bshad do //
analyzed: mdo dag las ni g-yeng ba rnam pa drug tu bshad do //
translated: Six types of distraction are explained in the sutras.

original: g-yeng ba rnam pa drug ni rang bzhin gyis g-yeng ba dang / phyi rol du g-yeng ba dang / nang du g-yeng ba dang / mtshan ma'i g-yeng ba dang / @76a * //
analyzed: g-yeng ba rnam pa drug ni rang bzhin gyis g-yeng ba dang / phyi rol du g-yeng ba dang / nang du g-yeng ba dang / mtshan ma'i g-yeng ba dang / @76a * //
translated: The six kinds of distraction are: natural distraction, distraction concerning external objects, distraction concerning internal objects, distraction concerning signs,üîΩdistraction concerning bad tendencies, and distraction concerning mental attention.

original: gnas ngan len gyi g-yeng ba dang / yid la byed pa'i g-yeng ba dang / de la mig gi rnam par shes pa nas lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du rnam par shes pa lnga'i tshogs la ni rang bzhin gyis g-yeng ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyi g-yeng ba dang / yid la byed pa'i g-yeng ba dang / de la mig gi rnam par shes pa nas lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du rnam par shes pa lnga'i tshogs la ni rang bzhin gyis g-yeng ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The five collections of consciousness, from the visual consciousness to the tactile consciousness, are called natural distraction,

original: rnam par shes pa lnga po de dag ni rang bzhin gyis nang du rtse gcig par 'jog mi nus pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa lnga po de dag ni rang bzhin gyis nang du rtse gcig par 'jog mi nus pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because those five consciousnesses are by nature unable to remain inwardly fixed on a single object.

original: dge ba'i chos la zhugs pa'i tshe 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan la sems 'phros pa ni phyi rol du g-yeng ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos la zhugs pa'i tshe 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan la sems 'phros pa ni phyi rol du g-yeng ba zhes bya'o //
translated: When one is engaged in the wholesome dharmas, the scattering of the mind to the five sense objects is called distraction concerning external objects.

original: ting nge 'dzin du zhugs pa'i tshe sems rmugs pa dang rgod pa'i dbang du btang ba ni nang du g-yeng ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin du zhugs pa'i tshe sems rmugs pa dang rgod pa'i dbang du btang ba ni nang du g-yeng ba zhes bya'o //
translated: When one enters into concentration, to be carried away by mental torpor or excitement is called ‚Äúinternal distraction.‚Äù

original: ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa dge ba bsgoms na gzhan dag gis bdag la yon tan can yin no snyam du 'dzin pa'i dbang du byas nas dge ba la zhugs pa ni mtshan ma'i g-yeng ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa dge ba bsgoms na gzhan dag gis bdag la yon tan can yin no snyam du 'dzin pa'i dbang du byas nas dge ba la zhugs pa ni mtshan ma'i g-yeng ba zhes bya'o //
translated: When one is engaged in virtue, such as cultivating concentration, to be carried away by the thought that others consider one to be virtuous is called ‚Äúdistraction by signs.‚Äù

original: ting nge 'dzin bsgoms pa'i tshe bdag dang bdag gir rtog pa 'byung ba ni gnas ngan len gyi g-yeng ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin bsgoms pa'i tshe bdag dang bdag gir rtog pa 'byung ba ni gnas ngan len gyi g-yeng ba zhes bya'o //
translated: When one cultivates concentration, the occurrence of the notions of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine‚Äù is called ‚Äúdistraction by the assumption of bad states.‚Äù

original: sngar ting nge 'dzin gcig bsgoms bsgoms pa las de'i 'og tu ting nge 'dzin gzhan sgom par byed pa ni yid la byed pa'i g-yeng ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sngar ting nge 'dzin gcig bsgoms bsgoms pa las de'i 'og tu ting nge 'dzin gzhan sgom par byed pa ni yid la byed pa'i g-yeng ba zhes bya'o //
translated: When one cultivates one concentration after another, having previously cultivated one, this is called ‚Äúdistraction by attention.‚Äù

original: 'dir g-yeng ba drug las phyi rol gyi g-yeng ba 'ba' zhig bshad mod kyi /
analyzed: 'dir g-yeng ba drug las phyi rol gyi g-yeng ba 'ba' zhig bshad mod kyi /
translated: Here, although only external distraction is mentioned among the six kinds of distraction,

original: g-yeng ba gzhan dag kyang rnam par g-yeng ba'i mtshan nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: g-yeng ba gzhan dag kyang rnam par g-yeng ba'i mtshan nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Other distractions should be understood as having the characteristic of distraction.

original: shes bzhin med pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shes bzhin med pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the nature of lack of awareness,

original: shes bzhin med pa gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: shes bzhin med pa gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: he asks, ‚ÄúWhat is lack of awareness?‚Äù

original: shes bzhin med pa'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: shes bzhin med pa'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the question is, ‚ÄúWhat is the nature and characteristic of lack of awareness?‚Äù

original: de'i lan du /
analyzed: de'i lan du /
translated: In response to that,

original: nyon mongs pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i shes rab ste lus dang ngag dang yid kyi rgyu ba rnams la dbang med par spyod pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i shes rab ste lus dang ngag dang yid kyi rgyu ba rnams la dbang med par spyod pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúIt is the wisdom that is associated with the afflictions, and it is the engagement of body, speech, and mind that is not under control.‚Äù

original: shes rab gang 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang bcas shing nyon mongs pa'i dbang du gyur cing nyon mongs pa dang 'dres pa'i shes rab la nyon mongs pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i shes rab ces bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab gang 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang bcas shing nyon mongs pa'i dbang du gyur cing nyon mongs pa dang 'dres pa'i shes rab la nyon mongs pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i shes rab ces bya'o //
translated: Wisdom that is associated with desire, hatred, and so on, that is under the power of the afflictions, and that is mixed with the afflictions is called ‚Äúthe wisdom that is associated with the afflictions.‚Äù

original: de ltar shes rab nyon mongs pa'i dbang du gyur bas lus kyi spyod pa 'gro 'dug ldang nyal dang / ngag gi spyod pa smra ba dang mi smra bar bya ba dang / yid kyi spyod pa bsam pa dang mi bsam par bya ba rnams la bdag da ltar 'di byed cing 'dug go zhes mi shes pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar shes rab nyon mongs pa'i dbang du gyur bas lus kyi spyod pa 'gro 'dug ldang nyal dang / ngag gi spyod pa smra ba dang mi smra bar bya ba dang / yid kyi spyod pa bsam pa dang mi bsam par bya ba rnams la bdag da ltar 'di byed cing 'dug go zhes mi shes pa dang /
translated: Thus, because wisdom is under the control of the defilements, one does not know that one is sitting, standing, lying down, or walking, that one is speaking or not speaking, or that one is thinking or not thinking.

original: bya ba dang mi bya ba'i dmigs mi shes pan shes bzhin med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bya ba dang mi bya ba'i dmigs mi shes pan shes bzhin med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called ‚Äúabsence of vigilance‚Äù because one does not know what should be done and what should not be done.

original: 'di yang gti mug gi shas las byung bas na rdzas su med kyi btags par @76b yod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di yang gti mug gi shas las byung bas na rdzas su med kyi btags par @76b yod par rig par bya'o //
translated: Since this is produced from a part of delusion, it should be understood as not existing as a substance but as existing as a designation.

original: 'di'i las kyang nyes pa 'byung ba'i rten byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'di'i las kyang nyes pa 'byung ba'i rten byed pa ste /
translated: Its action is to support the arising of faults,

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi sgo nas bya ba dang mi bya ba mi shes bas rtag tu skyon dang ltung ba sha stag 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi sgo nas bya ba dang mi bya ba mi shes bas rtag tu skyon dang ltung ba sha stag 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because one always commits faults and downfalls by not knowing what should be done and what should not be done through body, speech, and mind.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams bshad zin to //
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams bshad zin to //
translated: The secondary defilements have been explained.

original: bzhi ni gzhan du yang bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: bzhi ni gzhan du yang bshad par bya ste /
translated: Four will be explained later.

original: de yang 'gyod pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang 'gyod pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To explain the nature of regret,

original: 'gyod pa gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: 'gyod pa gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: it is asked, ‚ÄúWhat is regret?‚Äù

original: 'gyod pa'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'gyod pa'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: What is the nature and characteristic of regret?

original: de'i lan du yid la gcags pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩsrog gcod pa la sogs pa'i mi dge ba byas pa mtshar byas she'am /üîΩma legs pa zhes byas so zhes phyis yid la gdung zhing yid la gcags pa dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba byas pa mtshar byas so zhe'am /
analyzed: de'i lan du yid la gcags pa'o zhes bya ba smos te / srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i mi dge ba byas pa mtshar byas she'am / ma legs pa zhes byas so zhes phyis yid la gdung zhing yid la gcags pa dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba byas pa mtshar byas so zhe'am /
translated: The answer is ‚Äúmental remorse.‚ÄùüîΩHaving done nonvirtuous actions such as killing, one later thinks, ‚ÄúI have done something terrible‚Äù or ‚ÄúI have done something wrong,‚Äù and one‚Äôs mind is tormented and remorseful.

original: ma legs pa ni byas so zhes phyis mi dga' zhing yid la gcags pa'am /
analyzed: ma legs pa ni byas so zhes phyis mi dga' zhing yid la gcags pa'am /
translated: Having done virtuous actions such as generosity, one later thinks, ‚ÄúI have done something terrible‚Äù or ‚ÄúI have done something wrong,‚Äù and one‚Äôs mind is tormented and remorseful.

original: btsem drub la sogs pa'i las byas pa mtshar byas she'am ma byas pa mtshar byas so zhes phyis yid la gdung zhing yid la gcags pa la 'gyod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: btsem drub la sogs pa'i las byas pa mtshar byas she'am ma byas pa mtshar byas so zhes phyis yid la gdung zhing yid la gcags pa la 'gyod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Having done actions such as weaving, one later thinks, ‚ÄúI have done something terrible‚Äù or ‚ÄúI have not done something,‚Äù and one‚Äôs mind is tormented and remorseful. This is called regret.

original: 'gyod pa de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'gyod pa de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Regret is also of three types:

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'o //üîΩde la sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba byas pa la dge ba byas pa ma yin pa zhig byas so zhe'am /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'o // de la sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba byas pa la dge ba byas pa ma yin pa zhig byas so zhe'am /
translated: virtuous, nonvirtuous, and indeterminate.

original: nyes pa zhig byas zhes 'gyod pa ni 'gyod pa mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: nyes pa zhig byas zhes 'gyod pa ni 'gyod pa mi dge ba'o //
translated: Among them, regret that thinks, ‚ÄúI have done what is not virtuous, such as generosity and so on,‚Äù or ‚ÄúI have done what is faulty‚Äù is nonvirtuous regret.

original: yang na srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i mi dge ba ma byas par ma legs pa zhig byas so zhes 'gyod pa ni 'gyod pa mi dge ba'o //üîΩsrog gcod pa la sogs pa mi dge ba'i las byas pa nyes pa zhig byas so zhe'am /
analyzed: yang na srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i mi dge ba ma byas par ma legs pa zhig byas so zhes 'gyod pa ni 'gyod pa mi dge ba'o // srog gcod pa la sogs pa mi dge ba'i las byas pa nyes pa zhig byas so zhe'am /
translated: Or, regret that thinks, ‚ÄúI have done what is faulty by not doing nonvirtuous actions such as taking life‚Äù or ‚ÄúI have done what is faulty by not doing what is virtuous‚Äù is nonvirtuous regret.

original: ma legs pa zhig byas so zhes 'gyod pa ni 'gyod pa dge ba'o ;
analyzed: ma legs pa zhig byas so zhes 'gyod pa ni 'gyod pa dge ba'o ;
translated: Or, regret that thinks, ‚ÄúI have done what is faulty by doing nonvirtuous actions such as taking life‚Äù or ‚ÄúI have done what is faulty by doing what is virtuous‚Äù is virtuous regret.

original: / yang na sbyin pa la sogs pa dge ba ma byas pa ma legs pa zhig byas so zhes 'gyod pa de dag ni 'gyod pa dge ba'o //
analyzed: / yang na sbyin pa la sogs pa dge ba ma byas pa ma legs pa zhig byas so zhes 'gyod pa de dag ni 'gyod pa dge ba'o //
translated: Or, regret that thinks, ‚ÄúI have done what is faulty by not doing virtuous actions such as generosity‚Äù or ‚ÄúI have done what is faulty by not doing what is nonvirtuous‚Äù is virtuous regret.

original: btsem drub la sogs pa'i las ma byas pa mtshar byas she'am de dag byas pa nyes pa zhig byas so zhes 'gyod pa ni 'gyod pa lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: btsem drub la sogs pa'i las ma byas pa mtshar byas she'am de dag byas pa nyes pa zhig byas so zhes 'gyod pa ni 'gyod pa lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: Regret that is neither virtuous nor nonvirtuous is neutral regret.

original: 'gyod pa gsum las 'gyod pa mi dge ba dang / 'gyod pa lung du ma bstan pa gnyis ni gti mug gi shas las byung ba 'gyod pa de dag ni gti mug med pa'i shas las byung bas na rdzas su med kyi btags par yod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'gyod pa gsum las 'gyod pa mi dge ba dang / 'gyod pa lung du ma bstan pa gnyis ni gti mug gi shas las byung ba 'gyod pa de dag ni gti mug med pa'i shas las byung bas na rdzas su med kyi btags par yod par rig par bya'o //
translated: Among the three types of regret, nonvirtuous regret and neutral regret arise from the aspect of delusion. Since those two types of regret arise from the aspect of nondelusion, they should be understood to exist nominally, not substantially.

original: de'i las ni sems bde bar gnas pa dang / mi mthun par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de'i las ni sems bde bar gnas pa dang / mi mthun par byed pa ste /
translated: Its function is to create an obstacle to the mind remaining in a state of mental bliss.

original: sems @77a * //
analyzed: sems @77a * //
translated: When the mind is

original: la 'gyod pa'am /
analyzed: la 'gyod pa'am /
translated: agitated or

original: gdung ba skye bar 'gyur na sems ting nge 'dzin du rtse gcig tu gnas pa'i bar chad byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gdung ba skye bar 'gyur na sems ting nge 'dzin du rtse gcig tu gnas pa'i bar chad byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: tormented by regret, it is an obstacle to the mind remaining in a state of single-pointed concentration.

original: gnyid kyi rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnyid kyi rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To explain the nature of sleep,

original: gnyid gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: gnyid gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: the root text asks, ‚ÄúWhat is sleep?‚Äù

original: gnyid kyi rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: gnyid kyi rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: What is the nature and characteristic of sleep?

original: de'i lan du /
analyzed: de'i lan du /
translated: The answer is:

original: rang dbang med par 'jug pa sems mngon par sdud pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rang dbang med par 'jug pa sems mngon par sdud pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The mind is withdrawn, not operating freely.

original: 'jug pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i yul la sems zhugs shing dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i yul la sems zhugs shing dmigs pa'o //
translated: Operating means that the mind engages and focuses on objects such as form.

original: gnyid kyi dbang du song nas sems phyi rol gyi yul la 'jug pa'i dbang med pas ni rang dbang med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gnyid kyi dbang du song nas sems phyi rol gyi yul la 'jug pa'i dbang med pas ni rang dbang med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: When one is under the influence of sleep, the mind is unable to engage in external objects, so it is said to not operate freely.

original: sems yul la 'jug pa'i rang dbang med pa dang sems kyis lus 'dzin par mi nus par gyur bas na lus sa la 'gyel bar 'gyur ba la gnyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: sems yul la 'jug pa'i rang dbang med pa dang sems kyis lus 'dzin par mi nus par gyur bas na lus sa la 'gyel bar 'gyur ba la gnyid ces bya'o //
translated: Since the mind lacks the freedom to engage objects and is unable to maintain the body, the body falls to the ground. This is called sleep.

original: sems rang dbang med par byed pa ni gnyid 'ba' zhig tu yang ma zad kyi gzhan yang yod de /
analyzed: sems rang dbang med par byed pa ni gnyid 'ba' zhig tu yang ma zad kyi gzhan yang yod de /
translated: Not only sleep causes the mind to lack freedom.

original: dbyig pa la sogs pas phog ste brgyal ba na yang sems phyi rol tu 'jug pa'i dbang med la lus 'dzin kyang mi nus pas brgyal ba la gnyid ces bya'o snyam du 'dzin pa dgag pa'i phyir sems mngon par sdud pa'o zhes bya ba'i tshig smos te /üîΩsems mngon par sdud ces bya bas ni sems mig la sogs pa dbang po'i sgo nas phyi rol gyi yul la mi 'jug gi sems nang du bsdus pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dbyig pa la sogs pas phog ste brgyal ba na yang sems phyi rol tu 'jug pa'i dbang med la lus 'dzin kyang mi nus pas brgyal ba la gnyid ces bya'o snyam du 'dzin pa dgag pa'i phyir sems mngon par sdud pa'o zhes bya ba'i tshig smos te / sems mngon par sdud ces bya bas ni sems mig la sogs pa dbang po'i sgo nas phyi rol gyi yul la mi 'jug gi sems nang du bsdus pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: When one is struck by a club and so on and faints, the mind has no power to engage externally and one cannot even hold the body. Therefore, sleep is said to be the complete withdrawal of the mind.üîΩThe phrase complete withdrawal of the mind refutes the idea that sleep is the mere absence of mind, since it means that the mind is withdrawn inward and does not engage external objects through the doors of the sense faculties such as the eyes.

original: sems nang du sdud pa ni gnyid 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi 'gog pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i dus na yang sems nang du sdud par byed pas 'gog pa dang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la yang gnyid ces bya'o snyam du 'dzin pa dgag pa'i phyir rang dbang med ces bya ba'i tshig smos te /
analyzed: sems nang du sdud pa ni gnyid 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi 'gog pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i dus na yang sems nang du sdud par byed pas 'gog pa dang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la yang gnyid ces bya'o snyam du 'dzin pa dgag pa'i phyir rang dbang med ces bya ba'i tshig smos te /
translated: Sleep is not just the withdrawal of the mind inward, since the mind is also withdrawn inward at the time of the meditative attainment of cessation and the meditative attainment of nonperception. Therefore, to refute the idea that the meditative attainment of cessation and the meditative attainment of nonperception are sleep, the phrase without independent thought is stated.

original: gang sems rang dbang med par yang byed la sems nang du sdud par yang byed pa de la gnyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang sems rang dbang med par yang byed la sems nang du sdud par yang byed pa de la gnyid ces bya'o //
translated: Sleep is that which makes the mind powerless and draws it inward.

original: gnyid de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: gnyid de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Sleep is of three kinds:

original: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: virtuous, nonvirtuous, and indeterminate.

original: de la dge ba la sogs pa byed pa rmi lam du rmi ba ni gnyid dge ba'o //üîΩsrog gcod pa la sogs pa mi dge ba rmi lam du rmi ba ni gnyid mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: de la dge ba la sogs pa byed pa rmi lam du rmi ba ni gnyid dge ba'o // srog gcod pa la sogs pa mi dge ba rmi lam du rmi ba ni gnyid mi dge ba'o //
translated: If one dreams of doing virtuous actions such as giving, then the sleep is virtuous.üîΩIf one dreams of doing nonvirtuous actions such as killing, then the sleep is nonvirtuous.

original: btsem drub la sogs pa'i las byed par rmi lam du rmi na ni gnyid lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: btsem drub la sogs pa'i las byed par rmi lam du rmi na ni gnyid lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: If one dreams of doing such actions as weaving, then the sleep is indeterminate.

original: yang na sbyin pa la sogs pa dge ba yid la byed pa las ni gnyid log pa ni gnyid @77b dge ba'o ;
analyzed: yang na sbyin pa la sogs pa dge ba yid la byed pa las ni gnyid log pa ni gnyid @77b dge ba'o ;
translated: Or, if one falls asleep while bringing to mind virtuous actions such as giving, then the sleep is virtuous.

original: / srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i las yid la byed byed pa las gnyid kyis log na ni gnyid mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: / srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i las yid la byed byed pa las gnyid kyis log na ni gnyid mi dge ba'o //
translated: If one falls asleep while bringing to mind nonvirtuous actions such as killing, then the sleep is nonvirtuous.

original: btsem drub la sogs pa'i las yid la byed pa las gnyid kyis log pa ni gnyid lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: btsem drub la sogs pa'i las yid la byed pa las gnyid kyis log pa ni gnyid lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: When one falls asleep while thinking of work such as weaving, etc., sleep is indeterminate.

original: yang na dge ba'i las yid la byed pa las sems de gnyid kyis non na gnyid mi dge ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na dge ba'i las yid la byed pa las sems de gnyid kyis non na gnyid mi dge ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Or else, when the mind is overcome by sleep while thinking of wholesome action, sleep is unwholesome.

original: mi dge ba yid la byed pa las sems de gnyid kyis non na gnyid dge ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba yid la byed pa las sems de gnyid kyis non na gnyid dge ba zhes bya'o //
translated: When the mind is overcome by sleep while thinking of unwholesome action, sleep is wholesome.

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i las yid la byed pa las sems de gnyid kyis non na gnyid de lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i las yid la byed pa las sems de gnyid kyis non na gnyid de lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When the mind is overcome by sleep while thinking of indeterminate action, sleep is indeterminate.

original: gnyid kyi rgyu ni rid de nyam chung ba dang / lus ngal bar gyur pa dang / dpyid kyi dus la bab pa dang / kha zas kyis 'grangs te lus lci bar gyur ba dang / mun pa'i 'du shes yid la byas pa las gnyid skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyid kyi rgyu ni rid de nyam chung ba dang / lus ngal bar gyur pa dang / dpyid kyi dus la bab pa dang / kha zas kyis 'grangs te lus lci bar gyur ba dang / mun pa'i 'du shes yid la byas pa las gnyid skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Sleep arises from causes such as fatigue, weakness, physical exhaustion, the onset of spring, overeating, heaviness of the body, and the mental attention of the idea of darkness.

original: 'di yang gti mug gi shas las byung bas na rdzas su med kyi btags par yod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di yang gti mug gi shas las byung bas na rdzas su med kyi btags par yod par rig par bya'o //
translated: Since sleep also arises from the predominance of delusion, it should be understood as not existing as a substance but as a designation.

original: kha cig na re mi dge ba'i gnyid dang lung du ma bstan pa'i gnyid ni gti mug gi shas las byung gi dge ba'i gnyid ni gti mug gi shas las byung ba ma yin no zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: kha cig na re mi dge ba'i gnyid dang lung du ma bstan pa'i gnyid ni gti mug gi shas las byung gi dge ba'i gnyid ni gti mug gi shas las byung ba ma yin no zhes 'chad do //
translated: Some say: Nonvirtuous sleep and neutral sleep arise from the part of delusion, but virtuous sleep does not arise from the part of delusion.

original: 'di'i las ni bya ba mi 'grub pa'i rten byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'di'i las ni bya ba mi 'grub pa'i rten byed pa ste /
translated: Its function is to support the nonaccomplishment of action,

original: gnyid kyis log nas las su bya ba thams cad mi 'grub cing nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro ;üîΩ/ rtog pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir rtog pa gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: gnyid kyis log nas las su bya ba thams cad mi 'grub cing nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro ; / rtog pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir rtog pa gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: because when one falls asleep, all actions are not accomplished and are lost.üîΩTo explain the nature of conception, the Abhidharmakosa asks, What is conception?

original: rtog pa'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //üîΩde'i lan du tshol ba yid kyis brjod pa ste /
analyzed: rtog pa'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to // de'i lan du tshol ba yid kyis brjod pa ste /
translated: What is the nature and definition of conception?üîΩThe answer is, It is mental expression that seeks.

original: sems pa dang shes rab kyi bye brag gang sems rtsing ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sems pa dang shes rab kyi bye brag gang sems rtsing ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is the specific mental factor that is coarse and is a type of intention and wisdom.

original: de la 'di go rdza ma zhig yin nam snam bu zhig yin nam ci zhig yin zhes spyi tsam rtog pa'i rnam bar zhugs pa la tshol ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'di go rdza ma zhig yin nam snam bu zhig yin nam ci zhig yin zhes spyi tsam rtog pa'i rnam bar zhugs pa la tshol ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The investigation is the entry of the aspect of the mere concept What is this? into the object, whether it be a pot or a cloth.

original: tshol ba de yang yid kyis brjod pa ste /
analyzed: tshol ba de yang yid kyis brjod pa ste /
translated: This investigation is mental expression.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi rtog pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi rtog pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is a concept, which is to say, a mental consciousness.

original: de la yid kyis brjod pa zhes bya ba ni yid la smra bar byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la yid kyis brjod pa zhes bya ba ni yid la smra bar byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Mental expression is the mental speaking.

original: dper na tshig gis 'di ni snam bu 'di ni bum pa zhes don smra bar byed pa de bzhin du yid kyi rnam par shes pas 'di ni snam bu 'di ni bum pa'o zhes yid la smra zhing yid kyis rtog pa ni yid kyis brjod pa zhes bya'o
analyzed: dper na tshig gis 'di ni snam bu 'di ni bum pa zhes don smra bar byed pa de bzhin du yid kyi rnam par shes pas 'di ni snam bu 'di ni bum pa'o zhes yid la smra zhing yid kyis rtog pa ni yid kyis brjod pa zhes bya'o
translated: For example, just as words speak of the object, saying, This is a cloth, or This is a pot, in the same way, the mental consciousness speaks to the mind, saying, This is a cloth, or This is a pot, and the mental concept is called mental expression.

original: // 'dis ni rtog pa'i las bstan to //
analyzed: // 'dis ni rtog pa'i las bstan to //
translated: This shows the action of the concept.

original: rtog pa de yang gang gi pha las byung zhe na /
analyzed: rtog pa de yang gang gi pha las byung zhe na /
translated: And from what cause does this concept arise?üîΩTherefore it says:

original: de'i phyir sems @78a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems @78a * //
translated: from the mind.

original: pa dang shes rab kyi bye brag ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: pa dang shes rab kyi bye brag ces bya ba smos te /
translated: It is called the specific of intention and wisdom.

original: sems pa ni sems g-yo zhing 'gul bar byed pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: sems pa ni sems g-yo zhing 'gul bar byed pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
translated: Intention has the nature of moving and stirring the mind.

original: shes rab ni 'di ni yon tan can /
analyzed: shes rab ni 'di ni yon tan can /
translated: Wisdom has the nature of discerning, ‚ÄúThis is virtuous.üîΩThis is nonvirtuous.‚Äù

original: 'di ni nyes pa can zhes rnam par 'byed pa'i rang bzhin can yin pas sems kyi rtog pa yang de gnyis kyi dbang gis 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ni nyes pa can zhes rnam par 'byed pa'i rang bzhin can yin pas sems kyi rtog pa yang de gnyis kyi dbang gis 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: Since mental conception occurs due to the power of both intention and wisdom,

original: sems pa dang / shes rab gnyis kyis bye brag las rtog pa gdags pas na rtog pa 'di yang rdzas su med kyi btags par yod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems pa dang / shes rab gnyis kyis bye brag las rtog pa gdags pas na rtog pa 'di yang rdzas su med kyi btags par yod par rig par bya'o //
translated: since conception is designated from the specific of intention and wisdom, this conception should be understood as imputedly existent, not substantially existent.

original: de la bar bar ni sems dang sems pa gnyis la rtog pa gdags te /
analyzed: de la bar bar ni sems dang sems pa gnyis la rtog pa gdags te /
translated: Conception is imputed to both the mind and intention at some times.

original: nam rtog pa de mi rtog pa'i tshul du gnas pa'i dus na'o ;
analyzed: nam rtog pa de mi rtog pa'i tshul du gnas pa'i dus na'o ;
translated: It is the time when conception abides in a nonconceptual manner.

original: / bar bar ni shes rab dang sems gnyis la rtog pa gdags te /
analyzed: / bar bar ni shes rab dang sems gnyis la rtog pa gdags te /
translated: Conception is imputed to both wisdom and the mind at some times.

original: nam rtog pa de rnam par rtog pa'i tshul du zhugs pa'i dus na'o //
analyzed: nam rtog pa de rnam par rtog pa'i tshul du zhugs pa'i dus na'o //
translated: It is the time when conception engages in a conceptual manner.

original: yang na sems pa dang shes rab gnyis po nyid la rtog pa zhes gdags te /
analyzed: yang na sems pa dang shes rab gnyis po nyid la rtog pa zhes gdags te /
translated: Or else, thought and discernment are designated as discursive thought.

original: de gnyis kyi dbang gis 'di ni bum pa 'di ni snam bu zhes zhib tu rtog pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de gnyis kyi dbang gis 'di ni bum pa 'di ni snam bu zhes zhib tu rtog pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because of the power of these two, discursive thought arises in detail, such as, ‚ÄúThis is a pot,‚Äù ‚ÄúThis is cloth.‚Äù

original: / yang na sems 'ba' zhig la rtog pa gdags te /
analyzed: / yang na sems 'ba' zhig la rtog pa gdags te /
translated: Or else, only mind is designated as discursive thought.

original: nam rtog pa de mi rtog pa'i tshul du gnas pa'i dus na'o //
analyzed: nam rtog pa de mi rtog pa'i tshul du gnas pa'i dus na'o //
translated: When that discursive thought is in a state of nondiscursive thought.

original: yang na shes rab 'ba' zhig la rtog pa gdags te /
analyzed: yang na shes rab 'ba' zhig la rtog pa gdags te /
translated: Or else, only discernment is designated as discursive thought.

original: nam rtog pa de rtog pa'i tshul du zhugs pa'i tshe na'o //
analyzed: nam rtog pa de rtog pa'i tshul du zhugs pa'i tshe na'o //
translated: When that discursive thought is in a state of discursive thought.

original: gang sems rtsing ba'o zhes bya ba ni bum pa'i nang na dmar po zhe'am legs pa zhe'am ma legs pa zhes zhib tu mi 'jug pa'i 'di ni bum pa 'di ni snam bu zhes spyi tsam du rtog pas na sems rtsing ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang sems rtsing ba'o zhes bya ba ni bum pa'i nang na dmar po zhe'am legs pa zhe'am ma legs pa zhes zhib tu mi 'jug pa'i 'di ni bum pa 'di ni snam bu zhes spyi tsam du rtog pas na sems rtsing ba zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is coarse mind is the discursive thought that does not investigate in detail, such as, ‚ÄúThis is red,‚Äù ‚ÄúThis is good,‚Äù or ‚ÄúThis is not good,‚Äù but is a mere general investigation, such as, ‚ÄúThis is a pot,‚Äù ‚ÄúThis is cloth.‚Äù Thus it is called coarse mind.

original: 'dis ni rtog pa'i rang bzhin bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni rtog pa'i rang bzhin bstan to //
translated: This teaches the nature of discursive thought.

original: rtog pa de la 'ang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rtog pa de la 'ang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: And that discursive thought is of three kinds:

original: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: Virtue, nonvirtue, and indeterminate.

original: de la khams gsum nas 'byung bar byed pa'i chos la rtog par byed pa ni rtog pa dge ba'o //
analyzed: de la khams gsum nas 'byung bar byed pa'i chos la rtog par byed pa ni rtog pa dge ba'o //
translated: Among them, the investigation of phenomena that causes one to emerge from the three realms is virtuous investigation.

original: 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan la rtog pa mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan la rtog pa mi dge ba'o //
translated: The investigation of the five sense pleasures is nonvirtuous investigation.

original: bzo'i gnas rnam pa sna tshogs la rtog pa ni rtog pa lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bzo'i gnas rnam pa sna tshogs la rtog pa ni rtog pa lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: The investigation of the various arts and crafts is indeterminate investigation.

original: yang na 'di'i las kyang rnam pa gnyis byed de /
analyzed: yang na 'di'i las kyang rnam pa gnyis byed de /
translated: Moreover, its action is also twofold.

original: bde ba dang mi bde bar gnas pa'i rten byed pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang mi bde bar gnas pa'i rten byed pa'o //
translated: It acts as the basis for abiding in pleasure and abiding in pain.

original: de la khams gsum las byung ba'i chos la rtog pa ni dge ba bde ba'i rgyur 'gyur bas na bde bar gnas pa'i rten byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la khams gsum las byung ba'i chos la rtog pa ni dge ba bde ba'i rgyur 'gyur bas na bde bar gnas pa'i rten byed pa'o //
translated: Among them, the investigation of phenomena that causes one to emerge from the three realms is the basis for abiding in pleasure because it is the cause of pleasure.

original: 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan la rtog pa ni mi dge ba'i rgyur 'gyur bas na mi bde bar gnas pa'i rten byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan la rtog pa ni mi dge ba'i rgyur 'gyur bas na mi bde bar gnas pa'i rten byed pa'o //
translated: The investigation of the five sense pleasures is the basis for abiding in pain because it is the cause of nonvirtue.

original: dpyod pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir @78b dpyod pa gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: dpyod pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir @78b dpyod pa gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: In order to teach the nature of analysis, he asks, ‚ÄúWhat is analysis?‚Äù

original: dpyod pa'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'o don to //
analyzed: dpyod pa'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'o don to //
translated: What is the nature and characteristic of investigation?

original: de'i lan du so sor rtog pa yid kyis brjod pa ste /
analyzed: de'i lan du so sor rtog pa yid kyis brjod pa ste /
translated: The answer is: Discernment is mental expression.

original: de bzhin du gang sems zhib pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gang sems zhib pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Similarly, it is also the mind‚Äôs subtlety.

original: sngar rtog pas 'di ni bum pa /
analyzed: sngar rtog pas 'di ni bum pa /
translated: Having previously investigated with thought, ‚ÄúThis is a pot,‚Äù

original: 'di ni snam bu zhes brtags pa las phyis bum pa'i nang na yang dmar po zhig ce'am /
analyzed: 'di ni snam bu zhes brtags pa las phyis bum pa'i nang na yang dmar po zhig ce'am /
translated: ‚ÄúThis is a cloth,‚Äù one later analyzes in detail, ‚ÄúIn this pot there is a red one,‚Äù

original: nag po zhig ce'am /
analyzed: nag po zhig ce'am /
translated: ‚ÄúThere is a black one,‚Äù

original: bum pa ngos 'di ni dmar ro zhe'am /
analyzed: bum pa ngos 'di ni dmar ro zhe'am /
translated: ‚ÄúThis side of the pot is red,‚Äù

original: bum pa 'di ni legs /
analyzed: bum pa 'di ni legs /
translated: ‚ÄúThis pot is good,‚Äù

original: 'di ni ma legs zhes zhib tu dpyod par byed pa la so sor rtog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni ma legs zhes zhib tu dpyod par byed pa la so sor rtog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis one is not good.‚Äù This is called discernment.

original: so sor rtog pa de yang yid kyis brjod pa ste /
analyzed: so sor rtog pa de yang yid kyis brjod pa ste /
translated: Moreover, this discernment is mental expression.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pas zhib tu rnam par rtog par byed pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pas zhib tu rnam par rtog par byed pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It has the nature of the mental consciousness analyzing in detail. This is the meaning.

original: yid kyis brjod ces bya ba ni yid la zhib tu smra zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yid kyis brjod ces bya ba ni yid la zhib tu smra zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúMental expression‚Äù means speaking in detail with the mind.

original: dper na tshig gis don gyi dngos po smra ba bzhin du yid kyis kyang bum pa 'di ni legs /
analyzed: dper na tshig gis don gyi dngos po smra ba bzhin du yid kyis kyang bum pa 'di ni legs /
translated: Just as words express the substance of an object, so too does the mind express the substance of an object.

original: 'di ni ma legs zhes zhib tu smra zhing rtog par byed pas yid kyis brjod pa zhes bya ste de'i las bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ni ma legs zhes zhib tu smra zhing rtog par byed pas yid kyis brjod pa zhes bya ste de'i las bstan to //
translated: The mind also expresses the substance of an object by saying, ‚ÄúThis pot is good,‚Äù or ‚ÄúThis pot is not good,‚Äù because it thoroughly expresses and conceives of an object.

original: dpyod pa de yang ci la gdags she na /
analyzed: dpyod pa de yang ci la gdags she na /
translated: What is the basis of that investigation?

original: de'i phyir de bzhin du zhes bya ba'i tshig smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin du zhes bya ba'i tshig smos te /
translated: Therefore, the text says, ‚ÄúIn the same way.‚Äù

original: ji ltar rtog pa sems pa dang / shes rab kyi bye brag la gdags pa bzhin du dpyod pa 'di yang sems pa dang shes rab kyi bye brag las gdags te /
analyzed: ji ltar rtog pa sems pa dang / shes rab kyi bye brag la gdags pa bzhin du dpyod pa 'di yang sems pa dang shes rab kyi bye brag las gdags te /
translated: Just as conception is designated in relation to the distinctions of thought and wisdom, so too is investigation designated in relation to the distinctions of thought and wisdom.

original: de nyid kyi shas las 'byung bas na 'di yang rdzas su med kyi btags par yod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi shas las 'byung bas na 'di yang rdzas su med kyi btags par yod par rig par bya'o //
translated: Since it arises from the predominance of those two, it should be understood that investigation also does not exist as a substance but exists as a designation.

original: de la bar bar ni sems dang sems pa la dpyod pa gdags te /
analyzed: de la bar bar ni sems dang sems pa la dpyod pa gdags te /
translated: Conception is designated in relation to the distinctions of thought and conception.

original: nam dpyod pa de mi dpyod pa'i dus su gnas pa'i tshe na'o //
analyzed: nam dpyod pa de mi dpyod pa'i dus su gnas pa'i tshe na'o //
translated: When investigation is not investigating, it is designated as abiding.

original: bar bar ni sems dang shes rab gnyis la dpyod pa gdags te /
analyzed: bar bar ni sems dang shes rab gnyis la dpyod pa gdags te /
translated: Investigation is designated in relation to the distinctions of thought and wisdom.

original: nam dpyod pa de bzhin du dpyod pa'i tshul du zhugs pa'i tshe na'o//
analyzed: nam dpyod pa de bzhin du dpyod pa'i tshul du zhugs pa'i tshe na'o//
translated: When one engages in analysis in the same way that one previously engaged in investigation.

original: yang na sems 'ba' zhig la dpyod pa gdags te nam dpyod pa de mi dpyod pa'i tshul du zhugs pa'i tshe na'o //
analyzed: yang na sems 'ba' zhig la dpyod pa gdags te nam dpyod pa de mi dpyod pa'i tshul du zhugs pa'i tshe na'o //
translated: Or else, investigation is ascribed to the mind alone, when one engages in analysis in the way that one previously engaged in investigation.

original: yang na shes rab 'ba' zhig la dpyod pa gdags te /
analyzed: yang na shes rab 'ba' zhig la dpyod pa gdags te /
translated: Or else, investigation is ascribed to wisdom alone,

original: nam dpyod pa de zhib tu dpyod pa'i tshul du zhugs pa'i tshe na'o //üîΩgang sems zhib pa'o zhes bya ba ni sngar rtog pas bum pa tsam zhig tu brtags pa'i 'og tu dpyod pa 'di ni bum pa'i nang na legs pa zhig yin /
analyzed: nam dpyod pa de zhib tu dpyod pa'i tshul du zhugs pa'i tshe na'o // gang sems zhib pa'o zhes bya ba ni sngar rtog pas bum pa tsam zhig tu brtags pa'i 'og tu dpyod pa 'di ni bum pa'i nang na legs pa zhig yin /
translated: when one engages in analysis in the way that one previously engaged in investigation.üîΩThat which is subtle is the mind.üîΩHaving previously investigated a mere pot with investigation, this is the analysis that thinks, ‚ÄúA pot is good in this way, but not good in that way.‚Äù

original: 'di ni ma legs pa zhig yin zhes phrar rtog par byed pas na sems zhib pa zhes bya ste des ni rang bzhin bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ni ma legs pa zhig yin zhes phrar rtog par byed pas na sems zhib pa zhes bya ste des ni rang bzhin bstan to //
translated: It is called ‚Äúsubtle mind‚Äù because it thinks in a subtle way. This indicates its nature.

original: dpyod pa la yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: dpyod pa la yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three types of analysis:

original: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: virtuous, nonvirtuous, and indeterminate.

original: @79a * // de la sems can gzhan la phan gdags na thabs 'di dang 'dis phan gdags so zhes gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'i rnam pa sna tshogs la rtog par byed pa ni dpyod pa dge ba'o //
analyzed: @79a * // de la sems can gzhan la phan gdags na thabs 'di dang 'dis phan gdags so zhes gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'i rnam pa sna tshogs la rtog par byed pa ni dpyod pa dge ba'o //
translated: In this regard, the wholesome investigation is the investigation of the various aspects of benefiting others, such as, ‚ÄúI will benefit other sentient beings by this and that means.‚Äù

original: gzhan la gnod par bya ba'i thabs sna tshogs la rtog pa ni dpyod pa mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan la gnod par bya ba'i thabs sna tshogs la rtog pa ni dpyod pa mi dge ba'o //
translated: The unwholesome investigation is the investigation of the various means of harming others.

original: btsem drub la sogs pa bzo'i gnas rnams zhib tu rtog pa ni dpyod pa lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: btsem drub la sogs pa bzo'i gnas rnams zhib tu rtog pa ni dpyod pa lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: The indeterminate investigation is the investigation of the various arts, such as weaving and so on.

original: yang na 'di'i las kyang bde ba dang mi bde bar gnas pa'i rten byed pa ste /
analyzed: yang na 'di'i las kyang bde ba dang mi bde bar gnas pa'i rten byed pa ste /
translated: Or, its action is to serve as the basis for abiding in pleasure and pain.

original: gzhan la phan gdags pa'i thabs rnam pa sna tshogs la dpyod pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan la phan gdags pa'i thabs rnam pa sna tshogs la dpyod pa ni /
translated: The investigation of the various means of benefiting others

original: bde ba'i rgyur 'gyur bas na bde bar gnas pa'i rten byed pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba'i rgyur 'gyur bas na bde bar gnas pa'i rten byed pa'o //
translated: serves as the basis for abiding in pleasure because it is the cause of pleasure.üîΩThe investigation of the various means of harming others

original: gzhan la gnod par bya ba'i thabs la dpyod pa ni mi bde ba'i rgyur 'gyur bas na mi bde bar gnas pa'i rten byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la gnod par bya ba'i thabs la dpyod pa ni mi bde ba'i rgyur 'gyur bas na mi bde bar gnas pa'i rten byed pa'o //
translated: serves as the basis for abiding in pain because it is the cause of pain.

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa gnyis sems pa dang / shes rab kyi bye brag la gdags par 'dra na khyad par ci yod /
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa gnyis sems pa dang / shes rab kyi bye brag la gdags par 'dra na khyad par ci yod /
translated: If both applied to a specific type of intention and wisdom, what is the difference between them?

original: smras pa / de gnyis la khyad par yod de /
analyzed: smras pa / de gnyis la khyad par yod de /
translated: They are different because

original: de gnyi ga sems pa dang / shes rab kyi bye brag la gdags par 'dra na yang rtog pa ni sems rtsing ba'i rang bzhin dpyod pa ni sems zhib pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyi ga sems pa dang / shes rab kyi bye brag la gdags par 'dra na yang rtog pa ni sems rtsing ba'i rang bzhin dpyod pa ni sems zhib pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: although both are applied to a specific type of intention and wisdom, investigation is the coarse nature of mind and analysis is the subtle nature of mind.

original: bzhi gzhan du yang bshad zin to //
analyzed: bzhi gzhan du yang bshad zin to //
translated: The other four have already been explained.

original: gong du 'du byed kyi phung po bshad pa'i skabs su 'du byed rnams gang zhe na zhes dris nas /
analyzed: gong du 'du byed kyi phung po bshad pa'i skabs su 'du byed rnams gang zhe na zhes dris nas /
translated: In the above section on the aggregate of formation, the root text asks, ‚ÄúWhat are formations?‚ÄùüîΩand then replies, ‚ÄúThe nature of mental factors other than feeling and discernment and the nature of nonassociated compositional factors.‚Äù

original: lan du tshor ba dang 'du shes las gzhan pa sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyi bdag nyid dang / sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams kyi bdag nyid do zhes glengs pa las 'du byed sems las byung ba rnams ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: lan du tshor ba dang 'du shes las gzhan pa sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyi bdag nyid dang / sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams kyi bdag nyid do zhes glengs pa las 'du byed sems las byung ba rnams ni bshad zin to //
translated: The mental factors have already been explained.

original: da ni sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams bshad dgos te /
analyzed: da ni sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams bshad dgos te /
translated: Now, the formations dissociated from the mind should be explained.

original: de'i phyir sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams gang zhe na zhes dris so //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams gang zhe na zhes dris so //
translated: Therefore, it asks, ‚ÄúWhat are the formations dissociated from the mind?‚Äù

original: gnas pa dang / dmigs pa dang / rnam pa dang / dus dang / rdzas mnyam pas sems dang mnyam du skye zhing sems kyi rjes su 'brang ba med pa'i phyir sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed ces bya'o //
analyzed: gnas pa dang / dmigs pa dang / rnam pa dang / dus dang / rdzas mnyam pas sems dang mnyam du skye zhing sems kyi rjes su 'brang ba med pa'i phyir sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed ces bya'o //
translated: They are called formations dissociated from the mind because they arise simultaneously with the mind and do not accompany the mind due to the sameness of basis, object, aspect, time, and substance.

original: nyan thos rnam par smra ba pa rnams ni sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed thams cad re re nas rdzas su yod par 'dod kyang /
analyzed: nyan thos rnam par smra ba pa rnams ni sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed thams cad re re nas rdzas su yod par 'dod kyang /
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ika ≈õrƒÅvakas assert that all formations dissociated from the mind exist as substances, one by one.

original: rnam par rig pa tsam du lta ba'i tshul gyis de dag btags pa tsam du yod par zad kyi rdzas su yod pa ma yin par bstan cing /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam du lta ba'i tshul gyis de dag btags pa tsam du yod par zad kyi rdzas su yod pa ma yin par bstan cing /
translated: However, they are taught to be imputed existences, not substantial existences, by the method of viewing them as mere cognition.

original: de dag btags pa tsam du yod par yang ji la gdags pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag btags pa tsam du yod par yang ji la gdags pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach how they exist as mere imputations, it asks,üîΩ‚ÄúWhat are they?‚Äù

original: gang dag @79b gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba'i dus su gdags pa ste /
analyzed: gang dag @79b gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba'i dus su gdags pa ste /
translated: Those that are designated at the time of form, mind, and mental factorsüîΩare formations not associated with mind.

original: de dag ni sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed yin no zhes ma smos su zin kyang sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed bshad pa'i skabs yin pas gang gzugs kyi dus la gdags pa dang / sems kyi dus la gdags pa dang / sems las byung ba'i dus la gdags pa de dag ni 'du byed sems dang mi ldan pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dag ni sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed yin no zhes ma smos su zin kyang sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed bshad pa'i skabs yin pas gang gzugs kyi dus la gdags pa dang / sems kyi dus la gdags pa dang / sems las byung ba'i dus la gdags pa de dag ni 'du byed sems dang mi ldan pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Even though it is not stated, this is the section on formations not associated with mind. Therefore, those that are designated at the time of form, those that are designated at the time of mind, and those that are designated at the time of mental factors are formations not associated with mind.

original: de la 'du byed sems dang mi ldan pa mang du yod pa las kha cig ni gzugs kyi dus la gdags /üîΩkha cig ni sems kyi dus la gdags /
analyzed: de la 'du byed sems dang mi ldan pa mang du yod pa las kha cig ni gzugs kyi dus la gdags / kha cig ni sems kyi dus la gdags /
translated: Among the many formations not associated with mind, some are designated at the time of form,üîΩsome are designated at the time of mind,

original: kha cig ni sems las byung ba'i dus la gdags te ;
analyzed: kha cig ni sems las byung ba'i dus la gdags te ;
translated: and some are designated at the time of mental factors.

original: de bas na de dag btags par yod kyi rdzas su med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bas na de dag btags par yod kyi rdzas su med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, they are imputedly existent, not substantially existent.

original: yang na 'du byed sems dang mi ldan pa rnams gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba'i mthu las skyes pa'am /
analyzed: yang na 'du byed sems dang mi ldan pa rnams gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba'i mthu las skyes pa'am /
translated: Or they are derived from the power of form, mind and mental factors.

original: de gsum gyi yan lag tu gtogs pa na gzugs dang / sems dang / sems las byung pa'i dus la gdags pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de gsum gyi yan lag tu gtogs pa na gzugs dang / sems dang / sems las byung pa'i dus la gdags pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Or they are imputed to the time of form, mind and mental factors when they belong to the branches of those three.

original: 'du byed sems dang mi ldan pa de dag gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba'i ngag gis bskyed nas nam bdag gi ngo bo thob par gyur pa'i dus na chos de dag nyid kyi ming du btags te /
analyzed: 'du byed sems dang mi ldan pa de dag gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba'i ngag gis bskyed nas nam bdag gi ngo bo thob par gyur pa'i dus na chos de dag nyid kyi ming du btags te /
translated: When those nonmental formations are generated by the speech of form, mind and mental factors and they obtain their own nature, they are designated as names of those phenomena.

original: dper na 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa yang gzugs dang / sems dang sems las byung ba'i mthus bskyed par brtsams te /
analyzed: dper na 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa yang gzugs dang / sems dang sems las byung ba'i mthus bskyed par brtsams te /
translated: For example, the meditative attainment of cessation is generated by the power of form, mind and mental factors.

original: nam sems 'gags pa'i tshe mtshan nyid thob bar gyur pa'i skad cig ma gnyis pa phan chad 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa zhes gdags ba bzhin du 'du byed sems dang mi ldan pa gzhan yang gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba de dag gis thob parüîΩbya bar btsal nas /
analyzed: nam sems 'gags pa'i tshe mtshan nyid thob bar gyur pa'i skad cig ma gnyis pa phan chad 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa zhes gdags ba bzhin du 'du byed sems dang mi ldan pa gzhan yang gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba de dag gis thob par bya bar btsal nas /
translated: In the same way, other nonmental formations are obtained by form, mind and mental factors.

original: nam thob par gyur pa'i dus phan chad so so'i ming du gdags par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nam thob par gyur pa'i dus phan chad so so'i ming du gdags par rig par bya'o //
translated: When they are obtained, they are designated by their individual names.üîΩThus, nonmental formations generated by the power of form, mind and mental factors are not included in form, mind and mental factors.

original: 'di ltar gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba'i mthus bskyed pa'i 'du byed sems dang mi ldan pa'i rnams nyan thos rnam par smra ba rnams ni gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba la ma gtogs par rdzas su logs shig na yod par rtog ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba'i mthus bskyed pa'i 'du byed sems dang mi ldan pa'i rnams nyan thos rnam par smra ba rnams ni gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba la ma gtogs par rdzas su logs shig na yod par rtog ste /
translated: Sravakas who speak of them imagine that they exist as substances separate from form, mind and mental factors.

original: de nyid rdzas su logs shig na yod pa ma yin par bstan cing 'du byed sems dang mi ldan pa'i rnams gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba'i dus su gdags so zhes bshad na /
analyzed: de nyid rdzas su logs shig na yod pa ma yin par bstan cing 'du byed sems dang mi ldan pa'i rnams gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba'i dus su gdags so zhes bshad na /
translated: If it is explained that non-associated compositional factors are imputed at the time of form, mind and mental factors,

original: kha cig @80a * //
analyzed: kha cig @80a * //
translated: some may think

original: gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin nyid de yin par gdags sam /üîΩ'on te gzugs la sogs pa las gud na tha dad pa yod snyam du dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin nyid de yin par gdags sam / 'on te gzugs la sogs pa las gud na tha dad pa yod snyam du dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: that they are imputed to be the nature of form, mind and mental factors,üîΩor that they exist separately from form and so on.

original: de nyid dang gzhan du mi gdags so zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩgzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba'i bdag gis bskyed pa'i 'du byed sems dang mi ldan pa de dag gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid yin no zhes kyang mi gdags /
analyzed: de nyid dang gzhan du mi gdags so zhes bya ba smos te / gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba'i bdag gis bskyed pa'i 'du byed sems dang mi ldan pa de dag gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid yin no zhes kyang mi gdags /
translated: To dispel such doubts, it says that they are not imputed as the same or different.üîΩNon-associated compositional factors generated by the nature of form, mind and mental factors are not imputed to be the nature of form, mind and mental factors.

original: gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba las gzhan du logs shig na yod do zhes kyang mi gdags te /
analyzed: gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba las gzhan du logs shig na yod do zhes kyang mi gdags te /
translated: They are also not imputed to exist separately from form, mind and mental factors.

original: rten dang brten pa gcig na yang skyon du gyur ba'am tha dad na 'ang skyon du gyur pas dper na bum pa dang sa gcig par yang mi gdags tha dad par yang mi gdags pa dang / khu tshur dang sor mo gcig bar yang mi gdags tha dad par yang mi gdags pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rten dang brten pa gcig na yang skyon du gyur ba'am tha dad na 'ang skyon du gyur pas dper na bum pa dang sa gcig par yang mi gdags tha dad par yang mi gdags pa dang / khu tshur dang sor mo gcig bar yang mi gdags tha dad par yang mi gdags pa bzhin no //
translated: If the support and the supported are the same, there is a fault. If they are different, there is a fault. For example, a pot is not imputed to be the same as earth, nor is it imputed to be different from it. And a fist is not imputed to be the same as the fingers, nor is it imputed to be different from them.

original: 'di ltar bum pa dang sa rang bzhin gcig bar yang gdags su mi rung ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar bum pa dang sa rang bzhin gcig bar yang gdags su mi rung ste /
translated: In this way, it is not suitable to impute that a pot and earth are the same in nature.üîΩA pot is a shape that has a round belly and a flat base, and it functions to hold water. The shape of earth is in a different aspect, so it is not suitable to impute that it is the same as earth.

original: dum pa ni lto zlum po skye sdeng sdeng po la chu 'dzin pa'i bya ba byed pa'i dbyibs can yin la sa'i dbyibs kyang rnam pa gzhan du 'dug bas sa dang gcig pa zhes gdags su yang mi rung ba las bum pa tha dad pa zhes kyang gdagsüîΩsu mi rung ste /
analyzed: dum pa ni lto zlum po skye sdeng sdeng po la chu 'dzin pa'i bya ba byed pa'i dbyibs can yin la sa'i dbyibs kyang rnam pa gzhan du 'dug bas sa dang gcig pa zhes gdags su yang mi rung ba las bum pa tha dad pa zhes kyang gdags su mi rung ste /
translated: It is also not suitable to impute that a pot is different from earth.

original: bum pa sa las byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bum pa sa las byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a pot is made from earth.

original: de bzhin du sor mo dang khu tshur gcig pa zhes gdags su yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du sor mo dang khu tshur gcig pa zhes gdags su yang mi rung ste /
translated: In the same way, it is not suitable to impute that a fist and the fingers are the same.

original: sor mo dang khu tshur gcig par gyur na ni sor mo brkyang ba'i tshe na yang sor mo re re la khu chur gyi dbyibs 'dra bar snang bar gyur pa'i rigs na /
analyzed: sor mo dang khu tshur gcig par gyur na ni sor mo brkyang ba'i tshe na yang sor mo re re la khu chur gyi dbyibs 'dra bar snang bar gyur pa'i rigs na /
translated: If the fingers and the fist were identical, then when the fingers were extended, each finger would appear to have the shape of a fist.

original: sor mo brkyang ba'i tshe sor mo re re la khu tshur gyi dbyibs 'dra ba mi snang bas gcig pa zhes gdags su yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: sor mo brkyang ba'i tshe sor mo re re la khu tshur gyi dbyibs 'dra ba mi snang bas gcig pa zhes gdags su yang mi rung ngo //
translated: But when the fingers are extended, each finger does not appear to have the shape of a fist. Therefore, it is not suitable to designate them as identical.

original: sor mo dang khu tshur tha dad pa zhes kyang gdags su yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: sor mo dang khu tshur tha dad pa zhes kyang gdags su yang mi rung ste /
translated: It is also not suitable to designate the fingers and the fist as different.

original: khu tshur ni sor mo bsdus pa las gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khu tshur ni sor mo bsdus pa las gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the fist is formed from the fingers.

original: de dang 'dra bar 'dir yang rten ni gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar 'dir yang rten ni gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba'o //
translated: In the same way, here the basis is form, mind, and mental factors.

original: brten pa ni 'du byed sems dang mi ldan pa rnams so //
analyzed: brten pa ni 'du byed sems dang mi ldan pa rnams so //
translated: The dependent are the formations that are not associated with mind.

original: gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba dang / 'du byed sems dang mi ldan pa gcig ces gdags su mi rung ste /
analyzed: gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba dang / 'du byed sems dang mi ldan pa gcig ces gdags su mi rung ste /
translated: It is not suitable to designate form, mind, and mental factors, and the formations that are not associated with mind as identical.

original: bum pa dang chu gcig par mi rung ba bzhin du rten dang brten bar rang bzhin gcig par yang mi rung bar rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bum pa dang chu gcig par mi rung ba bzhin du rten dang brten bar rang bzhin gcig par yang mi rung bar rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Just as it is not possible for a pot and water to be the same, it is not possible for the support and the supported to be the same nature.

original: gzugs dang sems @80b dang sems las byung ba dang / 'du byed sems dang mi ldan pa tha dad pa zhes bya bar yang mi rung ste /üîΩgal te de dag tha dad par gyur na ni 'du byed sems dang mi ldan pa'i rnams gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba la brten mi dgos kyi de dag la ma brten par yang 'byung ba'i rigs na gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba la
analyzed: gzugs dang sems @80b dang sems las byung ba dang / 'du byed sems dang mi ldan pa tha dad pa zhes bya bar yang mi rung ste / gal te de dag tha dad par gyur na ni 'du byed sems dang mi ldan pa'i rnams gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba la brten mi dgos kyi de dag la ma brten par yang 'byung ba'i rigs na gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba la
translated: It is also not possible to say that form, mind, mental factors, and nonassociated compositional factors are different.üîΩIf they were different, then nonassociated compositional factors would not need to be supported by form, mind, and mental factors, and it would be logical for them to occur without support.

original: ma brten par 'du byed sems dang mi ldan pa mi 'byung bas na de dag tha dad pa zhes gdags su yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: ma brten par 'du byed sems dang mi ldan pa mi 'byung bas na de dag tha dad pa zhes gdags su yang mi rung ngo //
translated: But since nonassociated compositional factors do not occur without support by form, mind, and mental factors, it is not possible to designate them as different.

original: 'di ltar 'du byed sems dang mi ldan pa gang zhe na zhes dris nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'du byed sems dang mi ldan pa gang zhe na zhes dris nas /
translated: Thus, when asked, ‚ÄúWhat are nonassociated compositional factors?‚Äù

original: gang dag gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba'i dus su gdags pa ste /
analyzed: gang dag gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba'i dus su gdags pa ste /
translated: They are designated in relation to form, mind, and mental factors.üîΩThey are not designated as the same or different.

original: de nyid dang gzhan du mi gdags so zhes spyi tsam du bstan pa de dag kyang khyad par du na ming gis gang dang gang yin pa mi shes pas khyad par shes par 'dod nas de dag kyang gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: de nyid dang gzhan du mi gdags so zhes spyi tsam du bstan pa de dag kyang khyad par du na ming gis gang dang gang yin pa mi shes pas khyad par shes par 'dod nas de dag kyang gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: Since it is not known what they are in particular, he asks, ‚ÄúWhat are they?‚Äù

original: gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba'i dus su gdags pa de nyid dang gzhan du mi gdags pa'i 'du byed sems dang mi ldan pa de dag gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba'i dus su gdags pa de nyid dang gzhan du mi gdags pa'i 'du byed sems dang mi ldan pa de dag gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the question is, ‚ÄúWhat are those non-associated compositional factors that are designated in relation to form, mind, and mental factors, but are not designated as the same or different?‚Äù

original: 'di'i lan du rnyed pa dang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di'i lan du rnyed pa dang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In response to this, the root text states, ‚Äúgain, etc.‚Äù

original: de lta bu'i tshul can dag go zhes bya ba'i bar du bstan to //
analyzed: de lta bu'i tshul can dag go zhes bya ba'i bar du bstan to //
translated: Up to ‚Äúthey are of that type.‚Äù

original: de lta bu'i tshul can dag ces bya ba ni rnyed pa la sogs pa ming gis smos pa'i chos de dag dang rang bzhin 'dra ba'am /
analyzed: de lta bu'i tshul can dag ces bya ba ni rnyed pa la sogs pa ming gis smos pa'i chos de dag dang rang bzhin 'dra ba'am /
translated: ‚ÄúThey are of that type‚Äù means that they are similar in nature to the phenomena mentioned by name, such as gain, etc.

original: rigs 'dra ba'am /
analyzed: rigs 'dra ba'am /
translated: Or they are similar in type.

original: gzhan yang gzugs dang / sems dang sems las byung ba'i dus su gdags pa yang sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed yin par bsdu'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang gzugs dang / sems dang sems las byung ba'i dus su gdags pa yang sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed yin par bsdu'o //
translated: Moreover, the time of form, mind and mental factors is also included in the formations not associated with mind.

original: de dag kyang gang zhe na 'dir ma smos pa 'jug pa dang / so sor nges pa dang / sbyor ba dang / mgyogs pa dang / go rims dang / dus dang / yul dang / grangs dang / tshogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhe na 'dir ma smos pa 'jug pa dang / so sor nges pa dang / sbyor ba dang / mgyogs pa dang / go rims dang / dus dang / yul dang / grangs dang / tshogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: What are they? They are engagement, determination, application, speed, sequence, time, place, number and collection, etc.

original: rnyed pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir de la rnyed pa gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: rnyed pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir de la rnyed pa gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: In order to teach the nature of acquisition, he asks, ‚ÄúWhat is acquisition?‚Äù

original: 'du byed sems dang mi ldan pa de dag gi nang nas rnyed pa'i rang bzhin ji lta bu yin zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'du byed sems dang mi ldan pa de dag gi nang nas rnyed pa'i rang bzhin ji lta bu yin zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the question is, ‚ÄúWhat is the nature of acquisition from among those formations not associated with mind?‚Äù

original: de'i lan du thob pa dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba smos te dge ba'am ;
analyzed: de'i lan du thob pa dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba smos te dge ba'am ;
translated: In response, he says, ‚ÄúIt is obtainment and possession.‚Äù

original: mi dge ba'i chos sngon ma rnyed cing bdag la med pa las dang po nyid du rnyed par gyur pa la ni thob pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos sngon ma rnyed cing bdag la med pa las dang po nyid du rnyed par gyur pa la ni thob pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Obtainment is the first acquisition of a virtuous or nonvirtuous phenomenon that was not previously obtained and did not exist in the self.

original: de ltar skad cig ma dang po la dge ba'am /
analyzed: de ltar skad cig ma dang po la dge ba'am /
translated: Thus, in the first moment, one obtains virtues or nonvirtues that were not previously obtained.

original: mi dge ba'i chos ma rnyed pa rnyed nas skad cig ma gnyis pa phan chad nas chos de dag bdag la yod cing de dag dang ldan pa la ni ldan @81a * //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos ma rnyed pa rnyed nas skad cig ma gnyis pa phan chad nas chos de dag bdag la yod cing de dag dang ldan pa la ni ldan @81a * //
translated: From the second moment onward, one possesses those phenomena and is endowed with them.

original: pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called possession.

original: de ltar na thob pa dang ldan pa gnyis la rnyed pa zhes bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na thob pa dang ldan pa gnyis la rnyed pa zhes bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is taught that both obtainment and possession are called acquisition.

original: rnyed pa de la phye na du yod pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnyed pa de la phye na du yod pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate that acquisition is classified in different ways, it says:

analyzed: de 'ang sa bon dang / dbang dang / mngon du gyur pa dang ci rigs par sbyor ro zhes bya ba smos te /

original: rnyed pa de la'ang phye na rnam pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: rnyed pa de la'ang phye na rnam pa gsum yod de /

analyzed: sa bon rnyed pa dang / dbang rnyed pa dang / mngon du gyur pa rnyed pa'o //
translated: the acquisition of seeds, the acquisition of faculties, and the acquisition of manifest states.

original: de la sa bon rnyed pa ni ma 'ongs pa na bdag dang 'dra ba'i dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i chos bskyed pa'i phyir dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du mi ston pa'i chos rnams kyis rnam par shes pa'i rgyu la dge ba dang /

translated: Acquiring seeds means that in the future, through generating virtuous, nonvirtuous and neutral phenomena that are similar to oneself, one acquires seeds of virtuous, nonvirtuous and neutral phenomena as causes of consciousness.

analyzed: mi dge ba dang / lung du mi ston pa'i chos kyis bskrun cing bag chags gzhag pa la sa bon rnyed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the term acquiring seeds refers to the creation of causes and the establishment of imprints by virtuous, nonvirtuous and neutral phenomena.

analyzed: de ltar rgyu bskrun pas des brtas par gyur nas bdag gi 'bras bu bskyed par bya ba la mthu dang ldan par gyur te /
translated: Since causes are thus created, they increase and become capable of producing their own effects.

analyzed: gzhan gang gis kyang bar du gcad mi nus par 'bras bu bskyed pa'i mtha' ma'i skad cig ma 'bras bu skyes ni ma skyes /
translated: The final moment that produces its effect without being interrupted by anything else and the effect that has arisen but not yet ceased are said to be the acquisition of power.

analyzed: 'bras bu skyed nus pa'i mtshan nyid du gnas pa de la ni dbang rnyed pa zhes bya'o //

analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
