original: rnam par shes pa snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / sems med pa'i brgyal ba dang / gnyid stug pos non pa la sogs pa sems med pa'i dus de dag na yang rgyun chad de med pa dang /üîΩsems dang bcas pa'i dus na yang nam dge ba la dmigs pa'i tshe na mi dge ba'i sems dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems mi gnas te med /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / sems med pa'i brgyal ba dang / gnyid stug pos non pa la sogs pa sems med pa'i dus de dag na yang rgyun chad de med pa dang / sems dang bcas pa'i dus na yang nam dge ba la dmigs pa'i tshe na mi dge ba'i sems dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems mi gnas te med /
translated: Because they are interrupted and do not exist at times when there is no mind, such as when consciousness enters meditative absorption, when there is the meditative absorption of nondiscernment, when there is the meditative absorption of nonperception, when there is fainting, or when one is overcome by deep sleep.üîΩAlso, when there is a mind, at the time when it focuses on virtue, nonvirtuous minds and neutral minds do not exist.

original: nam mi dge ba la dmigs pa'i tshe na dge ba'i sems dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems mi gnas te med /
analyzed: nam mi dge ba la dmigs pa'i tshe na dge ba'i sems dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems mi gnas te med /
translated: When it focuses on nonvirtue, virtuous minds and neutral minds do not exist.

original: nam lung du ma bstan pa la dmigs pa de'i tshe na dge ba'i sems dang mi dge ba'i sems mi gnas te med pas na 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug ni mi brtan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nam lung du ma bstan pa la dmigs pa de'i tshe na dge ba'i sems dang mi dge ba'i sems mi gnas te med pas na 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug ni mi brtan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The six active consciousnesses are called unstable minds and mental factors.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang nyon mongs pa'i yid gnyis ni brtan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang nyon mongs pa'i yid gnyis ni brtan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The two, the foundation consciousness and afflicted mind, are called stable minds and mental factors.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: kun gzhi yang nam dgra bcom pa thob pa'i dus na med du zin gyi 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / sems med ba'i brgyal ba la sogs pa sems med pa'i dus thams cad na yang yod la /
analyzed: kun gzhi yang nam dgra bcom pa thob pa'i dus na med du zin gyi 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / sems med ba'i brgyal ba la sogs pa sems med pa'i dus thams cad na yang yod la /
translated: The foundation consciousness exists at all times when mind is absent, such as when one attains the state of an arhat, when one enters the meditative absorption of cessation, when one enters the meditative absorption of nonperception, and when one faints.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i sems dang bcas pa'i dus na yang rtag par yod pas na brtan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba zhes bya la /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i sems dang bcas pa'i dus na yang rtag par yod pas na brtan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba zhes bya la /
translated: When the mind is focused on virtue, nonvirtue, and so on, it is called a stable mind and mental factor because it always exists.

original: nyon mongs pa'i yid kyang zag pa med pa'i lam gyi bden pa'i dus dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i dus dang / mi slob pa'i dus rnams na med par zad kyi /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i yid kyang zag pa med pa'i lam gyi bden pa'i dus dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i dus dang / mi slob pa'i dus rnams na med par zad kyi /
translated: The afflicted mind also does not exist at the time of the truth of the uncontaminated path, at the time of meditative attainment of cessation, and at the time of no more learning.

original: de las ma gtogs pa'i dus thams cad du yod pas na brtan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba zhes bya'o//
analyzed: de las ma gtogs pa'i dus thams cad du yod pas na brtan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba zhes bya'o//
translated: But it exists at all times other than those, and therefore it is called a stable mind and mental factor.

original: de ltar na don gyi shugs kyis 'di 'dra bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na don gyi shugs kyis 'di 'dra bar 'gyur te /
translated: Thus this is the implied meaning.

original: zag pa med pa'i lam gyi dus na nyon mongs pa'i yid med ces bshad na zag pa can 'jig rten pa rnams kyi lam gyi dus na nyon mongs pa'i yid yod do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i lam gyi dus na nyon mongs pa'i yid med ces bshad na zag pa can 'jig rten pa rnams kyi lam gyi dus na nyon mongs pa'i yid yod do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: If it is explained that the afflicted mind does not exist at the time of the uncontaminated path, it is taught that the afflicted mind exists at the time of the contaminated mundane path.

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i dus na nyon mongs pa'i yid med @83a * //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i dus na nyon mongs pa'i yid med @83a * //
translated: The afflicted mind does not exist at the time of meditative attainment of cessation.

original: ces bshad na 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang 'du shes med pa'i tshe nyon mongs pa'i yid yod do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bshad na 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang 'du shes med pa'i tshe nyon mongs pa'i yid yod do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: If it is said that the afflicted mind exists in the meditative attainment of nondiscernment and in the state of nondiscernment, then it is taught that it exists in the state of nondiscernment.

original: mi slob pa'i dus na nyon mongs pa'i yid med ces bshad na slob pa'i dus na yod do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i dus na nyon mongs pa'i yid med ces bshad na slob pa'i dus na yod do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: If it is said that the afflicted mind does not exist at the time of no more learning, then it is taught that it exists at the time of learning.

original: de ltar sems dang sems las byung ba gnas pa dang / mi gnas pa rnam pa gnyis yod pa la 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe na sems dang sems las byung ba gang 'gags she na /
analyzed: de ltar sems dang sems las byung ba gnas pa dang / mi gnas pa rnam pa gnyis yod pa la 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe na sems dang sems las byung ba gang 'gags she na /
translated: Thus, when there are two types of minds and mental factors that are and are not abiding, what minds and mental factors cease at the time of meditative attainment of nondiscernment?üîΩTherefore it says:

original: de'i phyir / sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos mi brtan pa rnams gang 'gags pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩso so'i skye bo rnal 'byor pa des dang po 'du shes ni zug rdu /
analyzed: de'i phyir / sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos mi brtan pa rnams gang 'gags pa'o zhes bya ba smos te / so so'i skye bo rnal 'byor pa des dang po 'du shes ni zug rdu /
translated: The unstable minds and mental factors that cease.

original: 'du shes ni nad ces 'du shes sun phyung nas /
analyzed: 'du shes ni nad ces 'du shes sun phyung nas /
translated: Ordinary beings and yogis first reject discernment by thinking that discernment is painful and discernment is a disease.

original: 'du shes sun 'byin pa'i bsam pa des sems de ma thag tu gnyis la sogs pa 'byung ba dang mi mthun zhing 'gal bar gyur pa'i lus skyed do //üîΩde las sems gzhan 'byung ba dang mi mthun pa'i lus des mig gi rnam par shes pa nas /
analyzed: 'du shes sun 'byin pa'i bsam pa des sems de ma thag tu gnyis la sogs pa 'byung ba dang mi mthun zhing 'gal bar gyur pa'i lus skyed do // de las sems gzhan 'byung ba dang mi mthun pa'i lus des mig gi rnam par shes pa nas /
translated: The mind that is the intention to eliminate discriminations generates a body that is incompatible with and opposes the arising of two or more minds.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug sems las byung ba'i 'khor dang bcas par 'byung ba'i bgegs byas nas ril gyis mi 'byung bas bkag pas na /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug sems las byung ba'i 'khor dang bcas par 'byung ba'i bgegs byas nas ril gyis mi 'byung bas bkag pas na /
translated: That body is incompatible with the arising of other minds and it obstructs the arising of the six collections of consciousness, such as eye consciousness,

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos mi gnas pa rnams gang 'gog pa zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos mi gnas pa rnams gang 'gog pa zhes bya'o ;
translated: together with their retinue of mental factors. Since it completely prevents their arising, it is called the cessation of the nonabiding of mind and mental factors.

original: / de ltar na lus kyi rnam par shes pa drug gi tshogs sems las byung ba dang bcas te rgyu bkag pas na 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya ba yang gzugs kyi dus kyi khyad par la gdags kyi rdzas su med do //
analyzed: / de ltar na lus kyi rnam par shes pa drug gi tshogs sems las byung ba dang bcas te rgyu bkag pas na 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya ba yang gzugs kyi dus kyi khyad par la gdags kyi rdzas su med do //
translated: Thus, since it obstructs the movement of the six collections of consciousness together with their mental factors, the state of nondiscernment is imputed to a specific time of form but it does not exist as a substance.

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To explain the nature of the meditative attainment of cessation,

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: he asks, ‚ÄúWhat is the meditative attainment of cessation?‚Äù

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i rang bzhin dang / mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //üîΩde'i lan du cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i rang bzhin dang / mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to // de'i lan du cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba /
translated: The meaning of the question is, ‚ÄúWhat is the nature and characteristics of the meditative attainment of cessation?‚ÄùüîΩIn response, he says, ‚ÄúFree from attachment to the base of nothingness,

original: srid pa'i rtse mo nas gyen du bskyod pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo nas gyen du bskyod pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it is the meditative attainment of cessation that is the object of the peak of cyclic existence.‚Äù

original: gzugs med pa na skye mched bzhi la nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched dang / cung zad med cung zad med min skye mched las 'phags pa 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa des cung zad med pa'i skye mched man chad kyi nyon mongs pa dang 'dod @83b chags kun spangs pa na cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba
analyzed: gzugs med pa na skye mched bzhi la nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched dang / cung zad med cung zad med min skye mched las 'phags pa 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa des cung zad med pa'i skye mched man chad kyi nyon mongs pa dang 'dod @83b chags kun spangs pa na cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba
translated: In the formless realm, the four bases are the base of infinite space, the base of infinite consciousness, the base of nothingness, and the base of neither perception nor non-perception.üîΩThe noble ones who enter the meditative attainment of cessation that is superior to those bases are free from attachment to the base of nothingness and so on, since they abandon afflictions and attachment to the base of nothingness.

original: zhes bya'o // 'phags pa cung zad med pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba de srid pa'i rtse mo cung zad med cung zad med min skye mched kyi nyon mongs pa spongs pa'i phyir chas shing nyon mongs pa spang ba'i phyir brtson pa nas srid pa'i rtse mo nas gyen du bskyodüîΩpa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // 'phags pa cung zad med pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba de srid pa'i rtse mo cung zad med cung zad med min skye mched kyi nyon mongs pa spongs pa'i phyir chas shing nyon mongs pa spang ba'i phyir brtson pa nas srid pa'i rtse mo nas gyen du bskyodüîΩpa zhes bya'o //
translated: Those noble ones who are free from attachment to the base of nothingness are called ‚Äúthose who ascend from the summit of existence‚Äù because they strive to abandon the afflictions of the base of neither perception nor non-perception, the summit of existence, and they are diligent in abandoning afflictions.

original: de la so so'i skye bo 'jig rten pa'i lam la snyoms par 'jug pa rnams srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'dod chags dang ma bral yang cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi 'dod chags dang bral pa yod pas srid pa'i rtse mo las gyen du bskyod pa zhes byaüîΩba smos te /
analyzed: de la so so'i skye bo 'jig rten pa'i lam la snyoms par 'jug pa rnams srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'dod chags dang ma bral yang cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi 'dod chags dang bral pa yod pas srid pa'i rtse mo las gyen du bskyod pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore they are called those who ascend from the summit of existence.

original: so so'i skye bo 'jig rten pa'i lam la snyoms par zhugs pa rnams ni cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba yang srid pa'i rtse mo'i nyon mongs pa mthong bas spang ba dang / bsgom pas spang ba cung zad kyang ma spangs pas srid pa'i rtse mo las gyen du bskyod ces bya ba'i tshig gis so so'i skye bo rnams kyis ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug mi nus so zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo 'jig rten pa'i lam la snyoms par zhugs pa rnams ni cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba yang srid pa'i rtse mo'i nyon mongs pa mthong bas spang ba dang / bsgom pas spang ba cung zad kyang ma spangs pas srid pa'i rtse mo las gyen du bskyod ces bya ba'i tshig gis so so'i skye bo rnams kyis ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug mi nus so zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Ordinary beings who enter meditative attainment on the mundane path are free from attachment to the base of nothingness but they do not abandon even the slightest affliction of the summit of existence to be abandoned by the path of seeing or the path of meditation. Therefore the words they ascend from the summit of existence explain that ordinary beings are unable to enter meditative attainment in cessation.

original: kha cig srid pa'i rtse mo mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i 'dod chags dang bral ba yin kyang cung zad med pa'i skye mched bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa ma spangs te /
analyzed: kha cig srid pa'i rtse mo mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i 'dod chags dang bral ba yin kyang cung zad med pa'i skye mched bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa ma spangs te /
translated: Some are free from attachment to objects to be abandoned by seeing the summit of existence but have not abandoned afflictions to be abandoned by the path of meditation of the base of nothingness.

original: de'ang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de'ang gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la gnas pa'i 'phags pa'i bden pa de dag ste /üîΩde dag gis srid pa'i rtse mo'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pas srid pa'i rtse mo las gyen du bskyod kyang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa 'dod pa'i khams kyi dang yang ma bral bas cung zad med pa'i skye mched
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la gnas pa'i 'phags pa'i bden pa de dag ste / de dag gis srid pa'i rtse mo'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pas srid pa'i rtse mo las gyen du bskyod kyang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa 'dod pa'i khams kyi dang yang ma bral bas cung zad med pa'i skye mched
translated: They are ƒÅryas abiding in the result of stream entry and abiding in the result of once return.

original: kyi bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yang ma spangs te /
analyzed: kyi bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yang ma spangs te /
translated: They are called free from attachment to the base of nothingness because they have abandoned afflictions of the summit of existence to be abandoned by the path of seeing and have risen above the summit of existence but they have not abandoned afflictions of the desire realm to be abandoned by the path of meditation and they have not abandoned afflictions of the base of nothingness to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: de'i phyir cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi 'dod chags dang bral zhes smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi 'dod chags dang bral zhes smras te /
translated: Therefore they are called free from attachment to the base of nothingness.

original: don du na 'phags pa phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu rnyed pa dang / dgra bcom pa gnyis kyis 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug nus kyi 'phags pa'i rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la gnas pa dang /
analyzed: don du na 'phags pa phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu rnyed pa dang / dgra bcom pa gnyis kyis 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug nus kyi 'phags pa'i rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la gnas pa dang /
translated: In fact, it is taught that those who obtain the result of non-returner and the two arhats are able to enter the meditative attainment of cessation, but those abiding in the result of stream entry and once-returner

original: so so'i skye bos ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug mi nus so zhes bstan pa yin no //üîΩso so'i skye bo ni 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams 'byung ba'i 'du shes sngon du byas nas 'du shes med pa la snyoms @84a * //
analyzed: so so'i skye bos ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug mi nus so zhes bstan pa yin no // so so'i skye bo ni 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams 'byung ba'i 'du shes sngon du byas nas 'du shes med pa la snyoms @84a * //
translated: and ordinary beings are not able to enter the meditative attainment of cessation.

original: par 'jug na /
analyzed: par 'jug na /
translated: If ordinary beings enter the meditative attainment of nondiscernment by first creating the discernment that arises from the meditative attainment of nondiscernment,

original: 'phags pa 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa de dag bsam pa'am 'du shes ci 'dra ba zhig / dang por byas nas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug ce na /
analyzed: 'phags pa 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa de dag bsam pa'am 'du shes ci 'dra ba zhig / dang por byas nas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug ce na /
translated: then what kind of thought or discernment do ƒÅryas first create before entering the meditative attainment of cessation?

original: de'i phyir / gnas pa'i 'du shes sngon du 'gro ba'i yid la byed pas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / gnas pa'i 'du shes sngon du 'gro ba'i yid la byed pas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, ‚ÄúBy attention preceded by the discernment of abiding.‚Äù

original: 'phags pa'i 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa de dag 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhin du 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa de la 'byung ba'i 'du shes sngon du yid la byas nas snyoms par 'jug pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa de dag 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhin du 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa de la 'byung ba'i 'du shes sngon du yid la byas nas snyoms par 'jug pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The meditative attainment of cessation of ƒÅry beings is not like the meditative attainment of nondiscernment, which is entered after first mentally considering the discernment of emergence.

analyzed: gnas pa'i 'du shes sngon du yid la byas nas snyoms par 'jug pa ste /
translated: It is entered after first mentally considering the discernment of abiding.

original: de dag 'gog pa la ci'i phyir 'byung ba'i 'du shes su sngon du yid la mi byed ce na /
analyzed: de dag 'gog pa la ci'i phyir 'byung ba'i 'du shes su sngon du yid la mi byed ce na /
translated: Why do ƒÅry beings not first mentally consider the discernment of emergence in that meditative attainment of cessation?

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa de ni srid pa'i rtse mo'i sar gtogs pa yin la srid pa ni khams gsum par gtogs pa yin pas khams gsum pa la 'phags pa rnams 'byung ba dang / mthar 'byin pa'i 'du shes mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa de ni srid pa'i rtse mo'i sar gtogs pa yin la srid pa ni khams gsum par gtogs pa yin pas khams gsum pa la 'phags pa rnams 'byung ba dang / mthar 'byin pa'i 'du shes mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That meditative attainment of cessation belongs to the summit of existence bhavƒÅgra, but existence belongs to the three realms, because ƒÅry beings do not generate the discernment of emergence and final deliverance with respect to the three realms.

original: 'o na 'gog pa de la ci 'dra ba'i 'du shes skye zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'gog pa de la ci 'dra ba'i 'du shes skye zhe na /
translated: What type of discernment arises in that meditative attainment of cessation?

original: 'di ltar 'phags pa phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa de dag tshor ba dang / 'du shes kyis skyo nas dang po snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe tshor ba dang / 'du shes ni nad do //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'phags pa phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa de dag tshor ba dang / 'du shes kyis skyo nas dang po snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe tshor ba dang / 'du shes ni nad do //
translated: Feeling and perception are a disease,

original: skran no // zug rdu ste /
analyzed: skran no // zug rdu ste /
translated: an abscess, a thorn.

original: tshor ba dang 'du shes med pa'i 'gog pa 'di ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i dngos po ma yin yang mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'dra bar bde ba yin te /
analyzed: tshor ba dang 'du shes med pa'i 'gog pa 'di ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i dngos po ma yin yang mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'dra bar bde ba yin te /
translated: The cessation of feeling and perception, though not the actual state of nirvana, is blissful like nirvana.üîΩLet us abide in this bliss for a moment.

original: bde ba 'di la thang cig gcig gnas par bya'o snyam pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i 'du shes sngar btang nas /
analyzed: bde ba 'di la thang cig gcig gnas par bya'o snyam pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i 'du shes sngar btang nas /
translated: Having previously formed the perception of entering meditative absorption,

original: de nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i sems phra mo bskyed do //

translated: Then, the unstable minds and mental factors of their own bodies destroy the seeds of unstable minds and mental factors that are similar to their own type and are born later.

original: dang por sems phra ba skye'o //
analyzed: dang por sems phra ba skye'o //
translated: First, a subtle mind arises.

original: de'i 'og tu sems de bas kyang phra ba skye'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sems de bas kyang phra ba skye'o //
translated: After that, a mind subtler than that arises.

original: de'i 'og tu sems shin tu phra ba skyes nas shin tu phra bar gyur pa dang sems tha ma des sems gzhan skye bar mtshams sbyor bar mi nus te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sems shin tu phra ba skyes nas shin tu phra bar gyur pa dang sems tha ma des sems gzhan skye bar mtshams sbyor bar mi nus te /
translated: After that, when a mind that is subtler still has arisen, it becomes extremely subtle and that final mind is unable to link with the arising of another mind.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rang gi lus la sems dang sems las byung ba'i sa bon yod pa mthu nyams par byas pas na sems tha ma des bdag dang 'dra ba'i sems gzhan bskyed par mi nus te /
analyzed: rang gi lus la sems dang sems las byung ba'i sa bon yod pa mthu nyams par byas pas na sems tha ma des bdag dang 'dra ba'i sems gzhan bskyed par mi nus te /
translated: Since the seeds of mind and mental factors in one‚Äôs body have been impaired, the final mind is unable to generate another mind that is similar to itself.

original: rnam par shes pa drug rnams 'gags par gyur pas na mi brtan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba 'gag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa drug rnams 'gags par gyur pas na mi brtan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba 'gag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since the six consciousnesses have ceased, it is called the cessation of unstable mind and mental factors.

original: de bas na 'du shes med pa zhes bya ba yang gzugs kyi dus kyi khyad par la gdags te /
analyzed: de bas na 'du shes med pa zhes bya ba yang gzugs kyi dus kyi khyad par la gdags te /
translated: Therefore, the state called ‚Äúnon-perception‚Äù is also designated in relation to a specific time in the form realm.

original: de'i phyir / de btags par yod par zad kyi rdzas su med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir / de btags par yod par zad kyi rdzas su med do //
translated: Therefore, it is merely imputed to exist, but it does not exist substantially.

original: ci ltar gzugs kyi dus kyi khyad par la gdags she na /
analyzed: ci ltar gzugs kyi dus kyi khyad par la gdags she na /
translated: How is it designated in relation to a specific time in the form realm?

original: lus la rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: lus la rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two types of bodies:

original: sems dang bcas pa'i lus dang sems med pa'i lus so //üîΩde ltar lus rnam pa gnyis las 'du shes med pa ni /
analyzed: sems dang bcas pa'i lus dang sems med pa'i lus so // de ltar lus rnam pa gnyis las 'du shes med pa ni /
translated: a body with mind and a body without mind.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i sa bon nyams pa'i lud kyi dus la gdags pas na /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i sa bon nyams pa'i lud kyi dus la gdags pas na /
translated: From among those two types of bodies, the state of non-perception is designated in relation to a time when the seeds of mind and mental factors have been impaired in a body without mind.

original: gzugs kyi dus kyi khyad par la gdags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi dus kyi khyad par la gdags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The distinction of time in form is called designation.

original: 'du shes med pa ni sa dang yid la byed pa gnyis gzhag ste /
analyzed: 'du shes med pa ni sa dang yid la byed pa gnyis gzhag ste /
translated: The two, the stage and the attention, are posited in the state of non-perception.

original: gang zag dang rang bzhin dang btags pa gsum gyis bstan to //
analyzed: gang zag dang rang bzhin dang btags pa gsum gyis bstan to //
translated: It is taught by the three: the person, the nature, and the designation.

original: sa dang yid la byed pa ci'i phyir gzhag ce na ;üîΩ'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhin du 'du shes med pa la dge rgyas kyi 'dod chags dang bral la gong ma'i ma yin pa zhes bya ba med pas sa gzhag go //
analyzed: sa dang yid la byed pa ci'i phyir gzhag ce na ; 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhin du 'du shes med pa la dge rgyas kyi 'dod chags dang bral la gong ma'i ma yin pa zhes bya ba med pas sa gzhag go //
translated: Why are the stage and the attention posited?üîΩThe stage is posited because, unlike the attainment of non-perception, there is no statement like ‚Äúfree from attachment to the desire realm of the stage of the summit of existence‚Äù and ‚Äúnot free from attachment to the higher stages.‚Äù

original: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhin du 'du shes med pa la 'byung ba'i 'du shes sngon du 'gro ba'i yid la byed pa zhes bya ba med pas yid la byed pa gzhag go //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhin du 'du shes med pa la 'byung ba'i 'du shes sngon du 'gro ba'i yid la byed pa zhes bya ba med pas yid la byed pa gzhag go //
translated: The attention is posited because, unlike the attainment of non-perception, there is no statement like ‚Äúthe attention that precedes the arising of non-perception.‚Äù

original: phyi ma gsum gyis bshad pa ni 'du shes med par so so'i skye bo'i gang zag snyoms par 'jug pas gang zag gis bshad pa dang / 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug 'gags pa'i rang bzhin yin pas rang bzhin gyis bshad pa dang / gzugs kyi dus kyi khyad @86b par la gdags pas bshad do //
analyzed: phyi ma gsum gyis bshad pa ni 'du shes med par so so'i skye bo'i gang zag snyoms par 'jug pas gang zag gis bshad pa dang / 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug 'gags pa'i rang bzhin yin pas rang bzhin gyis bshad pa dang / gzugs kyi dus kyi khyad @86b par la gdags pas bshad do //
translated: The latter three explain it as the person, because ordinary beings enter it as a person; as the nature, because it has the nature of the cessation of the six active consciousnesses; and as a designation, because it is designated as a special time of form.

original: srog gi dbang po'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i srog gi dbang po gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: srog gi dbang po'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i srog gi dbang po gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: The nature of the faculty of life force is taught. What is the faculty of life force?

original: srog gi dbang po'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: srog gi dbang po'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: This is asking, ‚ÄúWhat is the nature and characteristic of the faculty of life force?‚Äù

original: de la srog ces kyang bya /
analyzed: de la srog ces kyang bya /
translated: It is called life force.

original: 'tsho ba zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: 'tsho ba zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: It is also called life.

original: ji srid ma shi bar gnas kyi bar du 'tsho bar byed pas na srog ces bya la /
analyzed: ji srid ma shi bar gnas kyi bar du 'tsho bar byed pas na srog ces bya la /
translated: It is called life force because it causes life to continue for as long as one does not die.

original: de nyid sems can ris 'dra ba rnams su gnas pa la dbang byed pas na dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid sems can ris 'dra ba rnams su gnas pa la dbang byed pas na dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called a faculty because it dominates the continuity of sentient beings of a similar class.

original: de'i lan du ris 'dra ba rnams su sngon gyi las kyis 'phangs pas gang 'du byed rnams kyis gnas pa'i dus nges pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i lan du ris 'dra ba rnams su sngon gyi las kyis 'phangs pas gang 'du byed rnams kyis gnas pa'i dus nges pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In response to that, it is said that the time of abiding of compounded phenomena is ascertained by the projection of prior karma in similar types.

original: ris zhes bya ba ni mi dang lha la sogs pa'i sems can gyi tshogs mang po la bya'o //
analyzed: ris zhes bya ba ni mi dang lha la sogs pa'i sems can gyi tshogs mang po la bya'o //
translated: Type refers to a multitude of sentient beings such as humans, gods and so on.

original: ris mtshungs par gyur pa la ris 'dra ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ris mtshungs par gyur pa la ris 'dra ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Similar types are called similar types.

original: ji ltar mtshungs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar mtshungs she na /
translated: How are they similar?üîΩDue to the cause of different reincarnating beings such as gods, humans, demigods, animals and so on and due to the cause of different virtuous and nonvirtuous karma, some are projected by prior karma to become kings and some are projected by prior karma to become beggars and so on.

original: lha dang mi dang lha ma yin dang byol song la sogs pa 'gro ba tha dad pa dang / las dge ba dang / mi dge ba tha dad pa'i rgyus kha cig sngon gyi las kyis 'phangs nas rgyal por byed pa dang / kha cig ni sngon gyi las kyis 'phangs nas sprang po byed pa la sogs pa sems can so sor skyes pa de dag kun kyang tshe re re yod pa las so so'i phung po lnga rgyun 'dra ba la ris 'dra ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: lha dang mi dang lha ma yin dang byol song la sogs pa 'gro ba tha dad pa dang / las dge ba dang / mi dge ba tha dad pa'i rgyus kha cig sngon gyi las kyis 'phangs nas rgyal por byed pa dang / kha cig ni sngon gyi las kyis 'phangs nas sprang po byed pa la sogs pa sems can so sor skyes pa de dag kun kyang tshe re re yod pa las so so'i phung po lnga rgyun 'dra ba la ris 'dra ba zhes bya ste /
translated: All those individual sentient beings have a life span and the similar continuum of the five aggregates of each is called a similar type.

original: ris 'dra ba rnams su zhes bya ba ni sems can phung po 'dra ba 'dzin pa rnams kyi nang gnas su skyes zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ris 'dra ba rnams su zhes bya ba ni sems can phung po 'dra ba 'dzin pa rnams kyi nang gnas su skyes zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúAmong those of similar class‚Äù means among those sentient beings who hold similar aggregates.

original: de'ang cis skyes she na /
analyzed: de'ang cis skyes she na /
translated: By what is one born there?

original: tshe rabs snga ma'i las dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / mi g-yo ba'i las kyis bskyed pa na las kyis 'phangs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshe rabs snga ma'i las dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / mi g-yo ba'i las kyis bskyed pa na las kyis 'phangs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When one is produced by virtuous, nonvirtuous, or stable karma, one is said to be projected by karma.

original: de la mi dge ba'i las kyis ni ngan song gsum du skye bar byed do //
analyzed: de la mi dge ba'i las kyis ni ngan song gsum du skye bar byed do //
translated: Among them, nonvirtuous karma causes birth in the three lower realms.

original: dge ba'i las kyis ni mi dang 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha drug gi nang du skye par byed do //
analyzed: dge ba'i las kyis ni mi dang 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha drug gi nang du skye par byed do //
translated: Virtuous karma causes birth among humans and in the six heavens of the desire realm.

original: mi g-yo ba'i las kyis ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams su skye bar byed do //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i las kyis ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams su skye bar byed do //
translated: Stable karma causes birth in the form and formless realms.

original: 'du byed rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga rnams kyi zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga rnams kyi zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúAmong the formations‚Äù means among the five aggregates.

original: gnas pa zhes bya ba ni dang po skye ba'i skad cig ma nas brtsams te shi ba'i bar du phung po lnga'i rgyun rgyun ma chad pa la gnas pa zhes bya'o ;üîΩ/ dus nges pa zhes bya ba ni ris mthun pa rnams su sngon gyi las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rgyus lo brgya zhig gnas par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: gnas pa zhes bya ba ni dang po skye ba'i skad cig ma nas brtsams te shi ba'i bar du phung po lnga'i rgyun rgyun ma chad pa la gnas pa zhes bya'o ; / dus nges pa zhes bya ba ni ris mthun pa rnams su sngon gyi las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rgyus lo brgya zhig gnas par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Abiding refers to the continuum of the five aggregates that is uninterrupted from the moment of initial birth until death.

original: lo stong zhig gnas par 'gyur ba la sogs pa tshe'i tshad ring thung la dus nges pa zhes bya ste /üîΩkha cig tshe ring bar dus nges kha cig tshe thung bar dus nges pa'o //
analyzed: lo stong zhig gnas par 'gyur ba la sogs pa tshe'i tshad ring thung la dus nges pa zhes bya ste / kha cig tshe ring bar dus nges kha cig tshe thung bar dus nges pa'o //
translated: Determinate time refers to the definite duration of life, such as one hundred years or one thousand years, due to the cause of virtuous or nonvirtuous karma in the continuity of similar type.

original: de yang @87a * //
analyzed: de yang @87a * //
translated: Some have a determinate time for a long life and some have a determinate time for a short life.

original: dper na byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi sems can phung po lnga'i rgyun lo stong gi bar du gnas par dus 'chad pa ste /
analyzed: dper na byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi sems can phung po lnga'i rgyun lo stong gi bar du gnas par dus 'chad pa ste /
translated: For example, the life of a sentient being of Uttarakuru is determined to last one thousand years.

original: de la srog gi dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la srog gi dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called the faculty of life force.

original: de ltar na phung po lnga rnams gnas pa'i dus nges pa la srog gi dbang po zhes bya bar zad pas srog gi dbang po yang gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba gsum gyi dus la gdags par zad kyi rdzas su logs shig na yod pa ni
analyzed: de ltar na phung po lnga rnams gnas pa'i dus nges pa la srog gi dbang po zhes bya bar zad pas srog gi dbang po yang gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba gsum gyi dus la gdags par zad kyi rdzas su logs shig na yod pa ni
translated: Thus, the so-called faculty of life force is nothing but the definite duration of the five aggregates. Therefore, the faculty of life force is merely imputed to the time of the three: form, mind, and mental factors.

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: It does not exist as a separate substance.

original: ris 'dra ba'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ris 'dra ba'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To explain the nature of similarity,

original: ris 'dra ba gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: ris 'dra ba gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: the root text asks, ‚ÄúWhat is similarity?‚Äù

original: ris 'dra ba'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: ris 'dra ba'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the question is, ‚ÄúWhat is the nature and characteristic of similarity?‚Äù

original: de'i lan du gang sems can rnams kyi lus 'dra ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i lan du gang sems can rnams kyi lus 'dra ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The answer is, ‚ÄúIt is the similarity of bodies of sentient beings.‚Äù

original: lha dang mi dang byol song dang yi dvags dang / sems can dmyal ba ste /
analyzed: lha dang mi dang byol song dang yi dvags dang / sems can dmyal ba ste /
translated: Gods, humans, animals, hungry ghosts, and hell beings

original: 'gro ba lngar skyes pa la sems can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba lngar skyes pa la sems can zhes bya'o //
translated: are called sentient beings.

original: sems can de dag dngos po gang la bdag gam bdag gir 'dzin pa'i dngos po de la lus zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems can de dag dngos po gang la bdag gam bdag gir 'dzin pa'i dngos po de la lus zhes bya ste /
translated: The body is the thing that sentient beings grasp as ‚ÄúI‚Äù or ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams na ni phung po lnga la bdag tu 'dzin ;
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams na ni phung po lnga la bdag tu 'dzin ;
translated: In the desire realm and the form realm, one grasps the five aggregates as a self.üîΩIn the formless realm, one grasps the four aggregates as a self.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni phung po bzhi la bdag tu 'dzin pas don du na phung po lnga la lus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni phung po bzhi la bdag tu 'dzin pas don du na phung po lnga la lus zhes bya'o //
translated: In general, the five aggregates are called the body.

original: so so'i phung po lnga char mthun pa la lus 'dra ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: so so'i phung po lnga char mthun pa la lus 'dra ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The five aggregates of each individual are called similar bodies.

original: mi yang mi rnams dang phung po lnga 'dra /
analyzed: mi yang mi rnams dang phung po lnga 'dra /
translated: Humans are similar to humans in their five aggregates.

original: lha yang lha rnams dang phung po lnga 'dra /
analyzed: lha yang lha rnams dang phung po lnga 'dra /
translated: Gods are similar to gods in their five aggregates.üîΩAnimals are similar to animals in their five aggregates.

original: byol song yang byol song rnams dang phung po lnga mthun pa la ris 'dra ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byol song yang byol song rnams dang phung po lnga mthun pa la ris 'dra ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called similar class.üîΩWhen classified, it is not only the mere similarity of the five aggregates that is called similar class. The similarity of the dress and behavior of individual kings is also called similar class.

original: de la dbye na phung po lnga mthun pa 'ba' zhig la ris 'dra ba zhes gdags par ma zad kyi rgyal po so so'i cha lugs dang spyod pa mthun pa la yang ris 'dra ba zhes bya ba dang / skyes pa yang skyes par cha lugs mthun /
analyzed: de la dbye na phung po lnga mthun pa 'ba' zhig la ris 'dra ba zhes gdags par ma zad kyi rgyal po so so'i cha lugs dang spyod pa mthun pa la yang ris 'dra ba zhes bya ba dang / skyes pa yang skyes par cha lugs mthun /
translated: Men are similar in their dress to men.

original: bud med kyang bud med dang cha lugs mthun /
analyzed: bud med kyang bud med dang cha lugs mthun /
translated: Women are similar in their dress to women.

original: ma ning yang ma ning dang cha lugs mthun /
analyzed: ma ning yang ma ning dang cha lugs mthun /
translated: The neuters are similar in appearance to the neuters.

original: dge slong pha yang dge slong pha dang cha lugs mthun /
analyzed: dge slong pha yang dge slong pha dang cha lugs mthun /
translated: The monks are similar in appearance to the monks.

original: dge slong ma yang dge slong mar cha lugs mthun /
analyzed: dge slong ma yang dge slong mar cha lugs mthun /
translated: The nuns are similar in appearance to the nuns.

original: dge bsnyen pha yang dge bsnyen phar cha lugs mthun /
analyzed: dge bsnyen pha yang dge bsnyen phar cha lugs mthun /
translated: The male lay disciples are similar in appearance to the male lay disciples.üîΩThe female lay disciples are similar in appearance to the female lay disciples.üîΩThe animals are similar in appearance to the animals.

original: dge bsnyen ma yang dge bsnyen mar cha lugs mthun pa dang / byol song yang nang dbye na rta yang rtar cha lugs mthun pa la sogs pa cha lugs mthun pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge bsnyen ma yang dge bsnyen mar cha lugs mthun pa dang / byol song yang nang dbye na rta yang rtar cha lugs mthun pa la sogs pa cha lugs mthun pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, similarity of class is called similarity of appearance.

original: de ltar na phung po lnga mthun pa la ris 'dra ba zhes bya bas ris 'dra ba yang gzugs dang / sems dang / sems las byung ba'i dus la gdags par zad kyi rdzas su med do //
analyzed: de ltar na phung po lnga mthun pa la ris 'dra ba zhes bya bas ris 'dra ba yang gzugs dang / sems dang / sems las byung ba'i dus la gdags par zad kyi rdzas su med do //
translated: Similarity of class is a designation for the time when the five aggregates are similar, and it is a designation for the time when the form, mind, and mental factors are similar, but it does not exist as a substance.

original: skye ba'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skye ba'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To explain the nature of birth,

original: skye ba gang zhe na zhes @87b dris te ;
analyzed: skye ba gang zhe na zhes @87b dris te ;
translated: the root text asks, ‚ÄúWhat is birth?‚Äù

original: skye ba'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to /
analyzed: skye ba'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to /
translated: The meaning of the question is, ‚ÄúWhat is the nature and characteristics of birth?‚Äù

original: de'i lan du ris mthun pa gang 'du byed rnams ma byung ba las byung ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i lan du ris mthun pa gang 'du byed rnams ma byung ba las byung ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In response to that, it is said, ‚ÄúAny similarity of type that arises from non-arisen formations.‚Äù

original: gang zhes bya ba ni sems can gang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang zhes bya ba ni sems can gang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúAny‚Äù means any sentient being.

original: ris mthun par zhes bya ba ni sems can sems can so so'i phung po lnga mthun pa'i nang du tshe rabs snga ma'i las kyis 'phangs nas phung po lnga skyes pa la skye ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ris mthun par zhes bya ba ni sems can sems can so so'i phung po lnga mthun pa'i nang du tshe rabs snga ma'i las kyis 'phangs nas phung po lnga skyes pa la skye ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúSimilarity of type‚Äù means that within the similarity of the five aggregates of each sentient being, the arising of the five aggregates projected by the karma of previous lives is called birth.

original: ri mthun pa smos pas ni 'du byed rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: ri mthun pa smos pas ni 'du byed rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: By mentioning ‚Äúsimilarity of type,‚Äù it is explained that formations are of two types:

original: rtsva shing la sogs pa phyi'i 'du byed dang / phung po lnga ste nang gi 'du byed las /
analyzed: rtsva shing la sogs pa phyi'i 'du byed dang / phung po lnga ste nang gi 'du byed las /
translated: outer formations such as grass, trees, and so on, and inner formations, the five aggregates.

original: 'dir nang gi 'du byed skyes pa la skye ba zhes bya bar 'dod kyi /
analyzed: 'dir nang gi 'du byed skyes pa la skye ba zhes bya bar 'dod kyi /
translated: Here, the arising of inner formations is asserted to be birth.

original: phyi'i 'du byed skyes pa rnams 'dir bshad pa'i skye ba'i nang du mi bsdu'o //

analyzed: smras pa / phyi nang gi 'du byed gnyi ga la yang skye ba dang rga ba la sogs pa yod par 'dra ba las bcom ldan 'das kyis nang gi 'du byed 'ba' zhig la skye ba dang / rga ba yod par gsungs te /
translated: Objection: Arising, aging, and so on are similar in that they exist for both internal and external formations. But the BhagavƒÅn says that arising and aging exist only for internal formations.

analyzed: phyi'i 'du byed rnams la ci'i phyir skye ba dang / rga ba yod par ma gsungs /

analyzed: smras pa / 'jig rten pa dang mthun par bya ba'i phyir te 'di ltar 'jig rten na ni phyi'i 'du byed rnams kyi skye ba dang rga ba la sogs 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa zhes ma grags la nang gi 'du byed rnams la skye ba dang 'jig pa la ni skye ba dang /

translated: The internal and external conditioned factors abide as the nature of moments. The prior moment is the cause, and the subsequent moment is the effect. The occurrence of the uninterrupted succession of causal and resultant moments is called engagement.

translated: The various causes and the various effects are called ‚Äúdeterminate.‚ÄùüîΩThe various causes are the many good actions that produce pleasant effects, such as not killing, not stealing, etc.

analyzed: mgyogs pa gang zhe na / rgyus 'bras bu myur du skyed par byed pa'am /

analyzed: skad cig ma rnams la skad cig ma snga ma'i rjes su bar chad med par phyi ma skyed 'byung ba la mgyogs pa zhes bya ste /

analyzed: 'di yang phung po lnga la gdags pas gzugs dang / sems dang sems las byung ba'i dus la gdags par zad kyi rdzas su med do //

analyzed: 'di yang phung po lnga la btags pas /

analyzed: dus gang zhe na rgyu dang 'bras bu 'brel bar 'jug pa la dus zhes bya ste /

analyzed: de bas na 'di yang phung po lnga la btags pas gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba'i dus la gdags par zad kyi rdzas su med do //

analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: de bas na 'di yang phung po lnga la gdags pas gzugs dang / sems dang sems las byung ba'i dus la gdags par zad kyi rdzas su med do //
translated: Therefore, this is also imputed to the five aggregates, and is exhausted in being imputed to form, mind, and mental factors, and does not exist substantially.

original: tshogs pa gang zhe na /

analyzed: de bas na 'di yang phung po lnga la gdags pas btags pa'i yod par zad kyi rdzas su med do //

original: 'du byed kyi phung po bshad nas /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi phung po bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the formation aggregate,

original: mjug bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mjug bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir /

analyzed: 'di ni 'du byed kyi phung po zhes bya'o zhes bya ba smos te / gong du smos pa'i 'du byed sems dang ldan pa lnga bcu rtsa gcig dang / panytsa skandha'i nang du byung ba 'du byed sems dang mi ldan ba bcu bzhi'i steng du /
translated: This is called the formation aggregate.

original: de dang tshul 'dra ba 'du byed sems dang mi ldan pa dgus bsnan te /
analyzed: de dang tshul 'dra ba 'du byed sems dang mi ldan pa dgus bsnan te /
translated: The fifty-one formations mentioned above that are associated with mind and the fourteen formations that are not associated with mind that occur in the Pa√±caskandhaprakara·πáa, plus nine more formations that are not associated with mind, similar to those,

analyzed: 'di dag la 'du byed kyi phung po zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: 'du byed kyi phung po rnams bshad zin to //

translated: Since the consciousness aggregate is mentioned after the formation aggregate, the time has come to explain it.

analyzed: rnam par shes pa gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: What is consciousness?

original: rnam par shes pa'i phung po'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phung po'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: This is the question: What is the nature and characteristic of the consciousness aggregate?

analyzed: de'i lan du dmigs pa so sor rnam par rig pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The answer is: The awareness of individual objects.

original: dmigs pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i yul gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang chos kyi bar du drug go //
analyzed: dmigs pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i yul gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang chos kyi bar du drug go //
translated: The object is the six objects of form, sound, smell, taste, touch, and mental objects, which are the objects of mind and mental factors.

original: rnam par rig pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa ni /
translated: Consciousness is

original: dmigs pa de dag 'dzin pa'am /
analyzed: dmigs pa de dag 'dzin pa'am /
translated: the apprehension of those objects,

original: rtogs pa'am / khong du chud pa la bya ste /
analyzed: rtogs pa'am / khong du chud pa la bya ste /
translated: or the understanding or comprehension of them.

original: dmigs par bya ba gang yin pa rig cing shes pas na rnam par rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba gang yin pa rig cing shes pas na rnam par rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called consciousness because it is aware of and knows whatever is an object.

original: dmigs pa rnam par rig pa'i shes pa de la yang rnam pa drug yod de /
analyzed: dmigs pa rnam par rig pa'i shes pa de la yang rnam pa drug yod de /
translated: That consciousness which is the apprehension of an object also has six aspects,

original: @94a * // mig gi rnam par shes pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du /
analyzed: @94a * // mig gi rnam par shes pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du /
translated: from eye consciousness to mind consciousness.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug go //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug go //
translated: These are the six consciousnesses that engage objects.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug po des ji ltar dmigs par rnam par rig ce na /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug po des ji ltar dmigs par rnam par rig ce na /
translated: How does that consciousness that engages objects apprehend its objects?

original: de la mig gi rnam par shes pa ni mig gi dbang po la brten nas gzugs la gzugs tsam du rig cing shes so //
analyzed: de la mig gi rnam par shes pa ni mig gi dbang po la brten nas gzugs la gzugs tsam du rig cing shes so //
translated: Eye consciousness, based on the eye faculty, is aware of and knows form as mere form.

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa ni rna ba'i dbang po la brten nas sgra la sgra tsam du rig cing shes so //üîΩsna'i rnam par shes pa ni sna'i dbang po la brten nas dri la dri tsam du rig cing shes so //
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa ni rna ba'i dbang po la brten nas sgra la sgra tsam du rig cing shes so // sna'i rnam par shes pa ni sna'i dbang po la brten nas dri la dri tsam du rig cing shes so //
translated: The ear consciousness, based on the ear faculty, is aware of and cognizes sound as mere sound.üîΩThe nose consciousness, based on the nose faculty, is aware of and cognizes smell as mere smell.

original: lce'i rnam par shes pa ni lce'i dbang po la brten nas ro la ro tsam du rig cing shes so //üîΩlus kyi rnam par shes pa ni lus kyi dbang po la brten nas /
analyzed: lce'i rnam par shes pa ni lce'i dbang po la brten nas ro la ro tsam du rig cing shes so // lus kyi rnam par shes pa ni lus kyi dbang po la brten nas /
translated: The tongue consciousness, based on the tongue faculty, is aware of and cognizes taste as mere taste.

original: reg bya la reg bya tsam du rig cing shes so //
analyzed: reg bya la reg bya tsam du rig cing shes so //
translated: The body consciousness, based on the body faculty, is aware of and cognizes touch as mere touch.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni yid kyi dbang po la brten nas chos rnams rig cing shes pas na /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni yid kyi dbang po la brten nas chos rnams rig cing shes pas na /
translated: The mental consciousness, based on the mental faculty, is aware of and cognizes phenomena.

original: rnam par shes pa drug po dag la dmigs pa rnam par rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa drug po dag la dmigs pa rnam par rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the six consciousnesses are called the awareness of the observed objects.

original: de ltar rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the nature of consciousness,üîΩin order to teach their synonyms,

original: de dag gi ming gi rnam grangs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag gi ming gi rnam grangs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: it is said:

original: sems dang yid dang de bzhin te zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: sems dang yid dang de bzhin te zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The root text says, ‚Äúmind, thought, and consciousness.‚Äù

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug la rnam par shes pa zhes kyang bya /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug la rnam par shes pa zhes kyang bya /
translated: The six active forms of consciousness are called consciousnesses because they are aware of objects.

original: dmigs pas rnam par rig pas rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ste de la sems zhes kyang byed la yid ces kyang bya /
analyzed: dmigs pas rnam par rig pas rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ste de la sems zhes kyang byed la yid ces kyang bya /
translated: They are also called minds because they are aware of objects, and they are also called thoughts because they think about objects.

original: dper na dmigs pa rnam par rig pas rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na dmigs pa rnam par rig pas rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba de bzhin du /
translated: For example, they are called consciousnesses because they are aware of objects.

original: de la sems zhes bya ba dang / yid ces kyang bya'o //
analyzed: de la sems zhes bya ba dang / yid ces kyang bya'o //
translated: They are also called minds and thoughts.

original: yang ci'i phyir de skad ces bya ba'i rnam grangs kyi don bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩsna tshogs pa dang yid rten byed pa'i phyir bya ba smos te ;üîΩsems kyi don ni sna tshogs kyi don te /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir de skad ces bya ba'i rnam grangs kyi don bstan pa'i phyir / sna tshogs pa dang yid rten byed pa'i phyir bya ba smos te ; sems kyi don ni sna tshogs kyi don te /
translated: Now, in order to teach the meaning of the synonyms, the root text says,üîΩ‚ÄúBecause it is a collection, a foundation, and an accumulator.‚Äù

original: sna tshogs kyi rang bzhin bstan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi rang bzhin bstan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of mind is a collection because it is taught to be the nature of a collection.

original: sems zhes bya la sems de ma thag tu 'byung ba'i rten byed pa'i phyir yid ces kyang bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems zhes bya la sems de ma thag tu 'byung ba'i rten byed pa'i phyir yid ces kyang bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of thought is that it is a foundation for the mind that arises immediately after it.

original: de la 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams la ni ci'i phyir sna tshogs zhes bya zhe na ;
analyzed: de la 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams la ni ci'i phyir sna tshogs zhes bya zhe na ;
translated: Why are the six active consciousnesses called various?

original: de ltar 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams te /
analyzed: de ltar 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams te /
translated: The six active consciousnesses

original: gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa so so'i rang bzhin yin pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i yul yang ser po dang / dkar po la sogs pa sna tshogs kyi rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa so so'i rang bzhin yin pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i yul yang ser po dang / dkar po la sogs pa sna tshogs kyi rang bzhin yin la /
translated: are various because their objects are various and because they are the basis of various afflicted and unafflicted states.

original: de la dmigs pa'i mig gi rnam par shes @94b pa yang sngar sngon po la dmigs na sngon po'i rnam par skye /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i mig gi rnam par shes @94b pa yang sngar sngon po la dmigs na sngon po'i rnam par skye /
translated: The eye consciousness that observes blue arises in the aspect of blue.

original: de nas ser po la dmigs na ser po'i rnam par skye /
analyzed: de nas ser po la dmigs na ser po'i rnam par skye /
translated: If it then observes yellow, it arises in the aspect of yellow.

original: de nas dmar po la dmigs na dmar po'i rnam par skye /
analyzed: de nas dmar po la dmigs na dmar po'i rnam par skye /
translated: If it then observes red, it arises in the aspect of red.

original: de nas dkar po la dmigs na dkar po'i rnam par skye ste /
analyzed: de nas dkar po la dmigs na dkar po'i rnam par skye ste /
translated: If it then observes white, it arises in the aspect of white.

original: yul sna tshogs pa bzhin du rnam par shes pa yang sna tshogs su skye bas na rnam par shes pa drug la sems zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: yul sna tshogs pa bzhin du rnam par shes pa yang sna tshogs su skye bas na rnam par shes pa drug la sems zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: Since consciousness arises as various objects, consciousness is also called mind.

original: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa drug dmigs pa sna tshogs la dmigs pa'i phyir sna tshogs yin pas na sems zhes bshad pa yang yul sngon po dang / ser po la sogs pa mang po rnam par shes pas skad cig mar rim gyis 'dzin pa'i rigs kyi dbang du byas nas sna tshogs zhes bya'i skad cig ma gcig la ni sna tshogs zhes mi bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa drug dmigs pa sna tshogs la dmigs pa'i phyir sna tshogs yin pas na sems zhes bshad pa yang yul sngon po dang / ser po la sogs pa mang po rnam par shes pas skad cig mar rim gyis 'dzin pa'i rigs kyi dbang du byas nas sna tshogs zhes bya'i skad cig ma gcig la ni sna tshogs zhes mi bya ste /
translated: Thus, since the six consciousnesses are various because they focus on various objects, the explanation that mind is various is from the perspective of the class of consciousnesses that gradually apprehend many objects such as blue and yellow in a series of moments. It is not that a single moment is called various.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na skad cig ma gcig la ni yul nges pa dang / rnam par nges pa'i phyir rnam pa sna tshogs med do //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na skad cig ma gcig la ni yul nges pa dang / rnam par nges pa'i phyir rnam pa sna tshogs med do //
translated: Why is that? Because in a single moment, the object is ascertained and the aspect is ascertained, there is no variety of aspects.

original: ja ltar yul nges shing rnam pa nges she na /
analyzed: ja ltar yul nges shing rnam pa nges she na /
translated: How is the object ascertained and the aspect ascertained?

original: skad cig ma'i tshe na ni sna tshogs zhes mi bya ste /
analyzed: skad cig ma'i tshe na ni sna tshogs zhes mi bya ste /
translated: It is not that a moment is called various.

original: sngon po 'ba' zhig la dmigs kyi ser po la ma dmigs pa dang / sngon po la dmigs pa'i tshe sngon po'i rnam pa nyid du skyes kyi ser po'i rnam par ma skyes pa'i phyir sna tshogs med do //
analyzed: sngon po 'ba' zhig la dmigs kyi ser po la ma dmigs pa dang / sngon po la dmigs pa'i tshe sngon po'i rnam pa nyid du skyes kyi ser po'i rnam par ma skyes pa'i phyir sna tshogs med do //
translated: It focuses on blue alone, not on yellow, and when it focuses on blue, it arises in the aspect of blue, not in the aspect of yellow.üîΩThe mind is called manas because it is the support of the six consciousnesses that immediately precede it.

original: rnam par shes pa drug po sems de ma thag pa'i rten byed pa'i phyir yid ces bya ba 'di yang mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa drug skyes nas 'gag go //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa drug po sems de ma thag pa'i rten byed pa'i phyir yid ces bya ba 'di yang mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa drug skyes nas 'gag go //
translated: The six eye consciousnesses and so on arise and cease.

original: 'gags ma thag tu de'i rjes la yid kyi rnam par shes pa skyes pa'am /
analyzed: 'gags ma thag tu de'i rjes la yid kyi rnam par shes pa skyes pa'am /
translated: Immediately after they cease, mental consciousness arises.

original: rnam par shes pa phyi ma drug gzhan skyes pas /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa phyi ma drug gzhan skyes pas /
translated: Or, the six other subsequent consciousnesses arise.

original: drug po snga ma 'gags ma thag pa de nyid rnam par shes pa de ma thag pa phyi ma gzhan skye ba'i rten byed pa'i phyir na drug po snga ma 'gags pa de nyid la yid ces bya'o //
analyzed: drug po snga ma 'gags ma thag pa de nyid rnam par shes pa de ma thag pa phyi ma gzhan skye ba'i rten byed pa'i phyir na drug po snga ma 'gags pa de nyid la yid ces bya'o //
translated: The six that have just ceased are called manas because they act as the support for the arising of the subsequent six consciousnesses.

original: de ltar rnam par shes pa drug gi rang bzhin dang mig gi rnam grangs bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par shes pa drug gi rang bzhin dang mig gi rnam grangs bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having explained the nature of the six consciousnesses and the synonyms for eye consciousness,

original: dngos su'am gtso na sems zhes bya ba gang la bya bstan pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i gtso bo gang yin bstan par bya ba'i phyir ;
analyzed: dngos su'am gtso na sems zhes bya ba gang la bya bstan pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i gtso bo gang yin bstan par bya ba'i phyir ;
translated: in order to explain what is actually or primarily called mind and to explain which is the primary consciousness,

original: dngos su na sems ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dngos su na sems ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúIn actuality, mind is the storehouse consciousness.‚Äù

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rang bzhin gyi phyir sems zhes bshad pa de ni sems gtso bo zhes mi bya'i dngos su mngon sum na'am gtso bo na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la sems zhes bya'o @95a * //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rang bzhin gyi phyir sems zhes bshad pa de ni sems gtso bo zhes mi bya'i dngos su mngon sum na'am gtso bo na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la sems zhes bya'o @95a * //
translated: Because the nature of the various forms of actual consciousness is various, it is called mind. That is not called the primary mind. In actuality, the storehouse consciousness is called mind.

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: yang na sems kyi gtso bo ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang na sems kyi gtso bo ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Or, the meaning is that the primary mind is the storehouse consciousness.

original: gtso bo na kun gzhi la sems zhes ci'i phyir bya ba dang / kun gzhi ci'i phyir sems rnams kyi gtso bo yin par bstan par bya ba'i phyir 'di ltar de ni 'du byed thams cad kyi sa bon bsags pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gtso bo na kun gzhi la sems zhes ci'i phyir bya ba dang / kun gzhi ci'i phyir sems rnams kyi gtso bo yin par bstan par bya ba'i phyir 'di ltar de ni 'du byed thams cad kyi sa bon bsags pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Thus it is the accumulation of the seeds of all conditioned phenomena.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Thus means

original: 'og nas 'byung ba'i gtan tshigs ltar na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'og nas 'byung ba'i gtan tshigs ltar na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: in accordance with the reasons that will be explained below.

original: de ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni kun gzhi dang sbyar te /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni kun gzhi dang sbyar te /
translated: The word it refers to the foundation consciousness.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de ni zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de ni zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The foundation consciousness is the principal mind.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de skad cig ma'i rgyun gyis 'byung ba la skad cig ma re re la yang 'dus byas thams cad kyi sa bon bsags shing bslad pas na bsags pa'i don dang ldan pa'i phyir gtso bo'am dngos su na kun gzhi la sems zhes
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de skad cig ma'i rgyun gyis 'byung ba la skad cig ma re re la yang 'dus byas thams cad kyi sa bon bsags shing bslad pas na bsags pa'i don dang ldan pa'i phyir gtso bo'am dngos su na kun gzhi la sems zhes
translated: The foundation consciousness is the principal mind because it is the accumulation of the seeds of all conditioned phenomena in each moment of its momentary continuum.

original: bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word mind in the phrase ‚Äúthe principal mind‚Äù is a synonym for the foundation consciousness.

original: kun gzhi'i skad cig ma re re la yang 'dus byas rnams kyi sa bon bsags pa yang ji ltar sogs she na ;
analyzed: kun gzhi'i skad cig ma re re la yang 'dus byas rnams kyi sa bon bsags pa yang ji ltar sogs she na ;
translated: How does the accumulation of seeds of conditioned states occur in each instant of the foundation consciousness?

original: kun gzhi de la sngon sa bon yod pa rnams /
analyzed: kun gzhi de la sngon sa bon yod pa rnams /
translated: Seeds of conditioned states that exist in the foundation consciousnessüîΩare repeatedly nourished by karmic action and thus they are said to accumulate.

original: 'du byed rnams kyis yang nas yang du brtas par byas pas na de dag gi sa bon bsags pa zhes bya ba'am yang na kun gzhi de 'dus byas kyi sa bon brtas pa dang 'brel zhing ldan pas na de dag gi sa bon bsags pa zhes bya ba'o
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyis yang nas yang du brtas par byas pas na de dag gi sa bon bsags pa zhes bya ba'am yang na kun gzhi de 'dus byas kyi sa bon brtas pa dang 'brel zhing ldan pas na de dag gi sa bon bsags pa zhes bya ba'o
translated: Or, the foundation consciousness is related to and possesses the nourished seeds of conditioned states and thus they are said to accumulate.

original: // de'i don kyang zhib tu bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: // de'i don kyang zhib tu bshad par bya'o //
translated: This will be explained in detail later.

original: 'di ji ltar rgyu dang rkyen gyis byas pa rnams la 'dus byas zhes bya bas lam gyi bden pa yang rgyu rkyen gyis byas pa'i phyir /üîΩzag pa med pa'i 'dus byas zhes bya la /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar rgyu dang rkyen gyis byas pa rnams la 'dus byas zhes bya bas lam gyi bden pa yang rgyu rkyen gyis byas pa'i phyir / zag pa med pa'i 'dus byas zhes bya la /
translated: Since conditioned states are said to be produced by causes and conditions, the truth of the path is also conditioned because it is produced by causes and conditions.

original: rgyu rkyen gyis byas pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa zag pa can gyi 'dus byas kyang yod na 'dir 'dus byas gang la bya zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu rkyen gyis byas pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa zag pa can gyi 'dus byas kyang yod na 'dir 'dus byas gang la bya zhe na /
translated: If uncontaminated states are conditioned, then contaminated conditioned states such as form and so on also exist because they are produced by causes and conditions.

original: 'di'i skabs su 'dus byas zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i 'dus byas rnams la bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'i skabs su 'dus byas zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i 'dus byas rnams la bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: In this context, ‚Äúconditioned‚Äù should be understood as referring to conditioned states that are contaminated.

original: yang na 'dus byas thams cad kyi sa bon bsags pa zhes 'byung bas zag pa dang bcas pa'i 'dus byas dang / zag pa med pa'i 'dus byas gnyi ga la bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na 'dus byas thams cad kyi sa bon bsags pa zhes 'byung bas zag pa dang bcas pa'i 'dus byas dang / zag pa med pa'i 'dus byas gnyi ga la bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Or, since it says that the seeds of all conditioned states are stored there, it should be understood as referring to both conditioned states that are contaminated and conditioned states that are uncontaminated.

original: 'dus byas de dag skye ba yang rkyen bzhi las skye ste /
analyzed: 'dus byas de dag skye ba yang rkyen bzhi las skye ste /
translated: These conditioned states arise from four conditions.

original: rkyen bzhi ni rgyu'i rkyen dang / bdag po'i rkyen dang / de ma thag pa'i rkyen dang / mig gi dbang po'i rkyen to //
analyzed: rkyen bzhi ni rgyu'i rkyen dang / bdag po'i rkyen dang / de ma thag pa'i rkyen dang / mig gi dbang po'i rkyen to //
translated: The four conditions are the causal condition, the condition that is the antecedent state, the dominant condition, and the condition that is the support.

original: de la rgyu'i rkyen ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la bsgos pa'i bag chags te /
analyzed: de la rgyu'i rkyen ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la bsgos pa'i bag chags te /
translated: The causal condition is the perfuming that is deposited on the store consciousness.

original: 'dir @95b gzhi dang gnas lta bur bag chags dang kun gzhi bshad mod kyi bsgo bar bya ba dang / sgo bar byed pa gnyis tha mi dad pas kun gzhi nyid ni 'du byed rnams kyi rgyu'i rkyen to //
analyzed: 'dir @95b gzhi dang gnas lta bur bag chags dang kun gzhi bshad mod kyi bsgo bar bya ba dang / sgo bar byed pa gnyis tha mi dad pas kun gzhi nyid ni 'du byed rnams kyi rgyu'i rkyen to //
translated: Here, although perfuming and the store consciousness are explained as being like a basis and a support, since the object that is perfumed and that which perfumes are not different, the store consciousness itself is the causal condition of the formations.

original: bdag po'i rkyen ni mig gi dbang po nas /
analyzed: bdag po'i rkyen ni mig gi dbang po nas /
translated: The dominant condition is the eye faculty.üîΩ

original: yid kyi dbang po'i bar du dbang po drug go //
analyzed: yid kyi dbang po'i bar du dbang po drug go //
translated: The dominant condition is the six sense faculties, from the eye faculty to the mind faculty.

original: de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa drug kyang snga ma 'gags pa de yid kyi rnam par shes pa'am rnam par shes pa drug phyi ma skye ba'i rten byed pas na snga ma 'gags pa nyid ni /üîΩphyi ma'i de ma thag pa'i rkyen to //
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa drug kyang snga ma 'gags pa de yid kyi rnam par shes pa'am rnam par shes pa drug phyi ma skye ba'i rten byed pas na snga ma 'gags pa nyid ni / phyi ma'i de ma thag pa'i rkyen to //
translated: The immediately preceding condition is the six consciousnesses of the eye and so on, because the former ceasing is the support for the arising of the latter mental consciousness or the six consciousnesses.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni gzugs nas brtsams te chos kyi bar du yul drug go //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni gzugs nas brtsams te chos kyi bar du yul drug go //
translated: The object condition is the six objects, from form to phenomena.

original: 'di lta bur 'dus byas rnams rkyen bzhi las skyes par ji mngon zhe na /
analyzed: 'di lta bur 'dus byas rnams rkyen bzhi las skyes par ji mngon zhe na /
translated: How do we know that conditioned states arise from four conditions?

original: mdo las gsungs pas na mngon te /
analyzed: mdo las gsungs pas na mngon te /
translated: Because it is stated in the sutras.

original: mdo sde las kyang mig ma nyams par gyur la gzugs rnams kyang snang bar gyur pa dang / de skyed pa yid la byed pa nye bar gnas par gyur na de ltar de dag las skyes pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pas rkyen bzhi la 'dus byas 'byung bar mngon no //
analyzed: mdo sde las kyang mig ma nyams par gyur la gzugs rnams kyang snang bar gyur pa dang / de skyed pa yid la byed pa nye bar gnas par gyur na de ltar de dag las skyes pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pas rkyen bzhi la 'dus byas 'byung bar mngon no //
