original: de'i don kyang mig ma nyams pa zhes bya ba ni mig gi dbang po ling tog la sogs pas ma khebs shing ma god pa'o //
analyzed: de'i don kyang mig ma nyams pa zhes bya ba ni mig gi dbang po ling tog la sogs pas ma khebs shing ma god pa'o //
translated: The meaning of that sutra passage is as follows: The eye is undamaged means the eye sense faculty is not covered by cataracts and so on, nor is it impaired.

original: gzugs rnams kyang snang bar gyur ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzugs rnams kyang snang bar gyur ces bya ba ni /
translated: Forms appear means

original: mig gi yul du gyur pa'i gzugs rnams kyang rtsig pa la sogs pas mchod ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mig gi yul du gyur pa'i gzugs rnams kyang rtsig pa la sogs pas mchod ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: that forms that are objects of the eye are not obstructed by walls and so on.

original: de skyed pa'i yid la byed pa nye bar gnas pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa snga ma 'gags ma thag pa rnams phyi ma skyed pa'i de ma thag pa'i rkyen yin pas de ma thag pa'i rkyen kyang nye bar gnas pa zhes bya ba'i don
analyzed: de skyed pa'i yid la byed pa nye bar gnas pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa snga ma 'gags ma thag pa rnams phyi ma skyed pa'i de ma thag pa'i rkyen yin pas de ma thag pa'i rkyen kyang nye bar gnas pa zhes bya ba'i don
translated: The meaning of the phrase ‚Äúthe immediately preceding condition is present‚Äù is as follows:

original: to // de lta na mig dang gzugs dang de ma thag pa'i rkyen las mig gi rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: to // de lta na mig dang gzugs dang de ma thag pa'i rkyen las mig gi rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúeye consciousness arises from the eye and form and the immediately preceding condition‚Äù means that the eye consciousness arises from the eye and form and the immediately preceding condition.

original: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sgra dang / de ma thag pa'i rkyen las rna ba'i rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes bya ba phyi ma rnams la yang rim bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sgra dang / de ma thag pa'i rkyen las rna ba'i rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes bya ba phyi ma rnams la yang rim bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the phrase ‚Äúear consciousness arises from the ear and sound and the immediately preceding condition‚Äù should be applied to the subsequent sense consciousnesses.

original: smras pa / khyod kyis ni rkyen bzhi las 'dus byas skye bar bshad la mdo las ni rkyen gsum las 'dus byas skye bar bshad na /
analyzed: smras pa / khyod kyis ni rkyen bzhi las 'dus byas skye bar bshad la mdo las ni rkyen gsum las 'dus byas skye bar bshad na /
translated: Objection: You have explained that conditioned states arise from four conditions, but the s≈´tras explain that conditioned states arise from three conditions.

original: ji ltar mi 'gal /
analyzed: ji ltar mi 'gal /
translated: How are these statements not contradictory?

original: smras pa / rgyu'i rkyen kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni dus thams cad du yod la /
analyzed: smras pa / rgyu'i rkyen kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni dus thams cad du yod la /
translated: He replied: The causal condition, the foundation consciousness, exists at all times.

original: dmigs pa dang rnam pa mi gsal bar gcod pa bas shes par dka' ba'i phyir mdo las ma gsungs @96a * //üîΩso ; de ltar rkyen bzhi las mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba'i 'og tu khyim 'di na bum pa brgya zhig yod dam /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang rnam pa mi gsal bar gcod pa bas shes par dka' ba'i phyir mdo las ma gsungs @96a * // so ; de ltar rkyen bzhi las mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba'i 'og tu khyim 'di na bum pa brgya zhig yod dam /
translated: Since it is difficult to understand because its object and aspect are not clear, it is not mentioned in the sutras.

original: ji tsam zhig yod ces tshol ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo //üîΩtshol ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa byung ba'i 'og tu 'di ni sngon po zhig yin no zhes rnam par 'jog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ji tsam zhig yod ces tshol ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo // tshol ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa byung ba'i 'og tu 'di ni sngon po zhig yin no zhes rnam par 'jog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo //
translated: In this way, after the eye consciousness arises from the four conditions, a mental consciousness that searches for the number of pots in the house arises, thinking, ‚ÄúHow many pots are there?‚ÄùüîΩAfter the mental consciousness that searches arises, a mental consciousness that ascertains the object arises, thinking, ‚ÄúThis is blue.‚Äù

original: rnam par 'jog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i 'og tu 'di ni sngon po nyid yin gyi ser po ma yin no zhes rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rnam par 'jog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i 'og tu 'di ni sngon po nyid yin gyi ser po ma yin no zhes rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo //
translated: After the mental consciousness that ascertains the object arises, a mental consciousness that conceives of the object arises, thinking, ‚ÄúThis is just blue and not yellow.‚Äù

original: de nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa de yang yul la dmigs nas /
analyzed: de nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa de yang yul la dmigs nas /
translated: Then, that mental consciousness, having observed an object,

original: yang na ni 'dod chags la sogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa skye /
analyzed: yang na ni 'dod chags la sogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa skye /
translated: either the afflictions such as attachment arise,

original: yang na ni yul la dmigs nas 'khor ba la skyo ba la sogs pa rnam par byang ba 'byung ba'i phyogs skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na ni yul la dmigs nas 'khor ba la skyo ba la sogs pa rnam par byang ba 'byung ba'i phyogs skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: or, having observed an object, the purification such as the disgust for sa·πÉsƒÅra arises.

original: de ltar na yid kyi rnam par shes pa nyon mongs pa skyes pa'i dus na bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed rnams mngon par 'du byed do //
analyzed: de ltar na yid kyi rnam par shes pa nyon mongs pa skyes pa'i dus na bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed rnams mngon par 'du byed do //
translated: Thus, when the mental consciousness has arisen with afflictions, it creates the formative forces that are meritorious, demeritorious, or unshakable.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa de dag gis mngon par 'du byas nas 'du byed de dag 'gags na ni ma 'gags par byed na kun gzhi la bag chags gnyis bsgo zhing brtas par byed do //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa de dag gis mngon par 'du byas nas 'du byed de dag 'gags na ni ma 'gags par byed na kun gzhi la bag chags gnyis bsgo zhing brtas par byed do //
translated: Having created those formative forces, when those formative forces cease, it causes the non-cessation of the alaya consciousness.

original: bag chags gnyis ni rgyu mthun pa'i bag chags dang / rnam par smin pa'i bag chags so //
analyzed: bag chags gnyis ni rgyu mthun pa'i bag chags dang / rnam par smin pa'i bag chags so //
translated: The two habitual tendencies are the habitual tendencies of natural outflow and the habitual tendencies of karmic maturation.

original: de la rgyu mthun pa'i bag chags zhes bya ba ni las ci 'dra ba byas pa 'bras bu yang de 'dra ba smin par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: de la rgyu mthun pa'i bag chags zhes bya ba ni las ci 'dra ba byas pa 'bras bu yang de 'dra ba smin par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The so-called habitual tendencies of natural outcome are such that whatever kind of action is performed, the result will ripen in a similar way.

original: dper na tshe 'dir sbyin pa byas na tshe rabs gzhan du yang 'bras bu sbyin pa la dga' ba'o //
analyzed: dper na tshe 'dir sbyin pa byas na tshe rabs gzhan du yang 'bras bu sbyin pa la dga' ba'o //
translated: For example, if one gives in this life, one will delight in giving in other lives as well.

original: rnam par smin pa'i bag chags ni sbyin pa'i rgyus lha dang mi'i nang du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa skyes nas longs spyod chen por 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i bag chags ni sbyin pa'i rgyus lha dang mi'i nang du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa skyes nas longs spyod chen por 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The habitual tendencies of full ripening are such that, by the cause of giving, the consciousness of the ground of all is born among gods and humans and one will have great resources.

original: de la kun gzhi la dge ba dang mi dge ba dang mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed rnams kyi rgyu mthun pa'i bag chags yod pa la brten nas ni tshe rabs gzhan du yang bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed nyid skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la kun gzhi la dge ba dang mi dge ba dang mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed rnams kyi rgyu mthun pa'i bag chags yod pa la brten nas ni tshe rabs gzhan du yang bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed nyid skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In this regard, on the basis of the existence of the habitual tendencies of natural outcome of virtuous, nonvirtuous, and unmoving formations in the foundation consciousness, in other lives as well, the formations of merit, demerit, and the unmoving are born.

original: rnam par smin pa'i bag chags yod pa la brten nas ni /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i bag chags yod pa la brten nas ni /
translated: On the basis of the existence of the habitual tendencies of full ripening,

original: lha dang mi la sogs pa'i rigs mthun pa gzhan dag tu kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid skye zhing smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha dang mi la sogs pa'i rigs mthun pa gzhan dag tu kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid skye zhing smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: The consciousness of the storehouse consciousness itself is born and matures in other similar types of beings, such as gods and humans.

original: spyod lam dang sprul ba dang / @96b bzo'i gnas la sogs pa lung du ma bstan pa'i 'du byed rnams kyis ni ma 'ongs pa na yang bdag dang 'dra ba'i chos skyed pa'i phyir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la rgyu mthun pa'i bag chags sogs shing brtas par byed de /
analyzed: spyod lam dang sprul ba dang / @96b bzo'i gnas la sogs pa lung du ma bstan pa'i 'du byed rnams kyis ni ma 'ongs pa na yang bdag dang 'dra ba'i chos skyed pa'i phyir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la rgyu mthun pa'i bag chags sogs shing brtas par byed de /
translated: The indeterminate formations of the activities of daily life, emanations, the arts, and so on, plant and increase the seeds of similar future dharmas in the storehouse consciousness.

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i chos la rnam par smin pa'i bag chags ni med do /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i chos la rnam par smin pa'i bag chags ni med do /
translated: There are no seeds of indeterminate dharmas in the storehouse consciousness that are the results of retribution.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos ni mthu che bas rnam par smin pa yod kyi /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos ni mthu che bas rnam par smin pa yod kyi /
translated: Because virtuous and nonvirtuous dharmas are powerful and have results of retribution.

original: lung du ma bstan pa ni zhing ba tsha can dang 'dra bas mthu chung ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa skyed par mi nus so //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa ni zhing ba tsha can dang 'dra bas mthu chung ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa skyed par mi nus so //
translated: Indeterminate dharmas are weak, like barren soil, and are incapable of producing results of retribution.

original: rgyu mthun pa'i bag chags la zhib tu dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i bag chags la zhib tu dpyad par bya ste /
translated: The seeds of the results of similar causes should be carefully analyzed.

original: rgyu mthun pa'i bag chags la brten nas kun gzhi'i 'bras bu ngo bo nyid dang kun gzhi'i rgyu'i ngo bo ste rnam pa gnyis su gzhag go //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i bag chags la brten nas kun gzhi'i 'bras bu ngo bo nyid dang kun gzhi'i rgyu'i ngo bo ste rnam pa gnyis su gzhag go //
translated: The result of the foundation consciousness is posited in two ways: the nature of the result of the foundation consciousness and the nature of the cause of the foundation consciousness.

original: ji lta zhe na /üîΩ'di ltar 'du byed dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i 'du byed rnams bdag dang 'dra ba'i rgyu mthun pa'i sa bon kun gzhi la 'jug pa'i tshe kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa khyad par can skyed pa'i rgyu lta bur 'du byed rnams gnas pas 'du byed rnams ni rgyu yin la /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na / 'di ltar 'du byed dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i 'du byed rnams bdag dang 'dra ba'i rgyu mthun pa'i sa bon kun gzhi la 'jug pa'i tshe kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa khyad par can skyed pa'i rgyu lta bur 'du byed rnams gnas pas 'du byed rnams ni rgyu yin la /
translated: How is this?

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid du gnas so //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid du gnas so //
translated: Thus when virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral compositional activities that are similar to the self plant seeds in the foundation consciousness, they remain as causes that generate a special foundation consciousness. Thus compositional activities are causes and the foundation consciousness is posited as the result.

original: 'di ltar dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i 'du byed rnams kyang rang gi rgyu mthun pa'i sa bon kun gzhi la yod pa la brten nas kun gzhi las 'du byed de dag 'byung bas na kun gzhi rgyu lta bur gnas la /
analyzed: 'di ltar dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i 'du byed rnams kyang rang gi rgyu mthun pa'i sa bon kun gzhi la yod pa la brten nas kun gzhi las 'du byed de dag 'byung bas na kun gzhi rgyu lta bur gnas la /
translated: Thus, the formations of virtue, nonvirtue, and the ethically neutral are produced from the foundation consciousness, which is the seed that is the natural outflow of those formations.

original: 'du byed rnams ni 'bras bu lta bur gnas so //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams ni 'bras bu lta bur gnas so //
translated: The foundation consciousness is thus the cause, and the formations are the result.

original: rnam par smin pa'i bag chags kyi dbang du byas nas dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i bag chags kyi dbang du byas nas dpyad par bya ste /
translated: The foundation consciousness should be analyzed in terms of the latent propensities of karmic ripening.

original: 'di ltar dge ba dang mi dge ba'i 'du byed rnams kyi ni kun gzhi 'bras bu nyid du gzhag go //
analyzed: 'di ltar dge ba dang mi dge ba'i 'du byed rnams kyi ni kun gzhi 'bras bu nyid du gzhag go //
translated: The foundation consciousness is posited as the result of virtuous and nonvirtuous formations.

original: kun gzhi dge ba dang mi dge ba yi bag chags kyi rgyur ni mi gzhag go //
analyzed: kun gzhi dge ba dang mi dge ba yi bag chags kyi rgyur ni mi gzhag go //
translated: The foundation consciousness is not posited as the cause of the latent propensities of virtue and nonvirtue.

original: ci'i phyir rgyur mi gzhag ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rgyur mi gzhag ce na /
translated: Why is it not posited as the cause?

original: kun gzhi la rnam par smin pa'i bag chags yod pa de las ma 'ongs pa na dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i rnam par smin pa gzhan bskyed pa med pas na dge ba dang mi dge ba'i 'du byed kyi rgyur kun gzhi mi gzhag go //
analyzed: kun gzhi la rnam par smin pa'i bag chags yod pa de las ma 'ongs pa na dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i rnam par smin pa gzhan bskyed pa med pas na dge ba dang mi dge ba'i 'du byed kyi rgyur kun gzhi mi gzhag go //
translated: Since the foundation consciousness does not generate other virtuous and nonvirtuous karmic maturation in the future, it is not posited as the cause of virtuous and nonvirtuous formations.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang 'bras bu lta bur kun gzhi gzhag pa ni rnam par smin pa'i bag chags la brtan nas lha dang mi la sogs pa'i ris mthun pa gzhan du kun gzhi skye zhing smin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩsmras pa / dmigs pa'i yul @97a * //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang 'bras bu lta bur kun gzhi gzhag pa ni rnam par smin pa'i bag chags la brtan nas lha dang mi la sogs pa'i ris mthun pa gzhan du kun gzhi skye zhing smin pa'i phyir ro // smras pa / dmigs pa'i yul @97a * //
translated: The foundation consciousness is posited as the cause of virtuous and nonvirtuous karmic maturation because the foundation consciousness arises and matures in other similar classes of gods, humans, and so on, based on the karmic imprints of karmic maturation.

original: dang rnam pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa yang yod mi srid de /
analyzed: dang rnam pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa yang yod mi srid de /
translated: Objection: It is impossible for consciousness to exist without an object of apprehension and aspect.

original: dper na 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyi dmigs pa'i yul ni gzugs la sogs pa yin la /
analyzed: dper na 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyi dmigs pa'i yul ni gzugs la sogs pa yin la /
translated: For example, the object of apprehension of the consciousnesses that engage their objects is form and so on.

original: de yang sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par skye na /
analyzed: de yang sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par skye na /
translated: And if that form arises in the aspect of blue and so on,

original: gal te kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug las ma gtogs par logs shig na yod na de dmigs pa ni ci la dmigs /
analyzed: gal te kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug las ma gtogs par logs shig na yod na de dmigs pa ni ci la dmigs /
translated: If the so-called foundation consciousness exists separately from the six active consciousnesses, then what is its object?

original: yul la dmigs na yang /
analyzed: yul la dmigs na yang /
translated: If it has an object,

original: ji ltar dmigs zhes pa'i lan du /
analyzed: ji ltar dmigs zhes pa'i lan du /
translated: then how does it apprehend its object?üîΩThe response to that is:

original: de yang dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su mi gcod pa ste zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩde yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni kun gzhi dang sbyar te ;
analyzed: de yang dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su mi gcod pa ste zhes bya ba smos te / de yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni kun gzhi dang sbyar te ;
translated: It does not fully comprehend its object and aspect.üîΩThe word also is connected to foundation consciousness.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means that foundation consciousness also does not fully comprehend its object and aspect.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug rnams ni dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su chad pa ste /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug rnams ni dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su chad pa ste /
translated: The six active consciousnesses fully comprehend their objects and aspects.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: 'di ltar 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug la mig gi rnam par shes pa gzugs la dmigs kyi sgra la mi dmigs pa dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa ni sgra la dmigs kyi gzugs la mi dmigs pa nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug la mig gi rnam par shes pa gzugs la dmigs kyi sgra la mi dmigs pa dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa ni sgra la dmigs kyi gzugs la mi dmigs pa nas /
translated: The six active consciousnesses are as follows: Eye consciousness focuses on form but does not focus on sound, ear consciousness focuses on sound but does not focus on form, and so on.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa chos la dmigs pas na dmigs pa yongs su gcod do //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa chos la dmigs pas na dmigs pa yongs su gcod do //
translated: The mental consciousness determines the object of observation because it observes phenomena.üîΩWhen the eye consciousness observes blue, it arises in the aspect of blue, but it does not arise in the aspect of yellow.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa sngon po la dmigs pa'i tshe sngon po'i rnam par skye'i ser po'i rnam par mi skye ba dang ; ser po la dmigs pa'i tshe ser po'i rnam par skye'i /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa sngon po la dmigs pa'i tshe sngon po'i rnam par skye'i ser po'i rnam par mi skye ba dang ; ser po la dmigs pa'i tshe ser po'i rnam par skye'i /
translated: When it observes yellow, it arises in the aspect of yellow, but it does not arise in the aspect of blue.

original: sngon po'i rnam par mi skye bas rnam pa yongs su gcod pa'o //üîΩyang na 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug rnams ni gzugs la dmigs pa na yang 'di ni gzugs so zhes dmigs pa la yang gsal par gcod pa dang ; 'di ni sngon po zhes rnam pa la gsal bar gcod pa lta bur kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su mi gcod pa ste /üîΩdes dmigs pa la yang gsal bar gcod mi nus /
analyzed: sngon po'i rnam par mi skye bas rnam pa yongs su gcod pa'o // yang na 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug rnams ni gzugs la dmigs pa na yang 'di ni gzugs so zhes dmigs pa la yang gsal par gcod pa dang ; 'di ni sngon po zhes rnam pa la gsal bar gcod pa lta bur kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su mi gcod pa ste / des dmigs pa la yang gsal bar gcod mi nus /
translated: Thus it determines the aspect.üîΩOr, when the six active consciousnesses observe form, they clearly determine the object of observation by thinking, this is form and they clearly determine the aspect by thinking, this is blue.

original: rnam pa la yang gsal bar gcod mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa la yang gsal bar gcod mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But the foundation consciousness does not determine the object of observation or the aspect because it is not able to clearly determine the object of observation and it is not able to clearly determine the aspect.

original: ci'i phyir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dmigs pa dang rnam pa gsal bar gcod mi nus she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dmigs pa dang rnam pa gsal bar gcod mi nus she na /
translated: Why is it that the ƒÅlaya consciousness cannot clearly discern its object and mode of activity?

original: 'di ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa'i yul ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa'i yul ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: In this way, the object-field of the ƒÅlaya consciousness is twofold:

original: nang gi nye bar len pa'i rnam pa dang / phyi rol gyi snod la rnam par rig pa'i rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi nye bar len pa'i rnam pa dang / phyi rol gyi snod la rnam par rig pa'i rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa'o //
translated: the internal appropriated aspect and the external unsegmented aspect of the cognition of the physical universe.

original: nang gi nye bar len @97b pa'i rnam pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: nang gi nye bar len @97b pa'i rnam pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The internal appropriated aspect is also twofold:

original: de skad du bshad pa dang / slob dpon ba su mi tras smras pa /

analyzed: 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa'i tshe yid kyi rnam par shes pa mi gsal ba de'i mtshan nyid du de na yod de de bas na mdo las kyang 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa na rnam par shes pa ni lus dang ma bral ba'o zhes gsungs

original: lan du 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa'i tshe yid kyi rnam par shes pa mi gsal bar gnas pas rnam par shes pa lus las ma bral lo zhes bya bar mi rigs te /
analyzed: lan du 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa'i tshe yid kyi rnam par shes pa mi gsal bar gnas pas rnam par shes pa lus las ma bral lo zhes bya bar mi rigs te /
translated: In response, it is illogical to say that when one enters meditative attainment in the state of cessation, mental consciousness exists there with the characteristics of nonclarity and that consciousness is not separated from the body.

original: de bas na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa'i tshe lus las ma bral bar rigs so //
analyzed: de bas na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa'i tshe lus las ma bral bar rigs so //
translated: Therefore it is logical that foundation consciousness alone is not separated from the body when one enters meditative attainment in the state of cessation.

original: slob dpon pa su mi tras smras pa /
analyzed: slob dpon pa su mi tras smras pa /
translated: Vasumitra says:

original: 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa'i tshe kun gzhi las ma gtogs par yid kyi rnam par @103a * //
analyzed: 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa'i tshe kun gzhi las ma gtogs par yid kyi rnam par @103a * //
translated: When one enters meditative attainment of cessation, there is no mind other than the foundation consciousness.üîΩ

original: shes pa lus dang ma bral bar ci'i phyir mi rigs /
analyzed: shes pa lus dang ma bral bar ci'i phyir mi rigs /
translated: Why is it not accepted that the mental consciousness is not separated from the body when one enters the meditative attainment of cessation?

original: lan du smras pa /
analyzed: lan du smras pa /
translated: The opponent replies:

original: 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa'i tshe yid kyi rnam par shes pa yod par khas blangs na ni nyes pa dang po skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa'i tshe yid kyi rnam par shes pa yod par khas blangs na ni nyes pa dang po skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: If you accept that the mental consciousness exists when one enters the meditative attainment of cessation, then the first fault arises.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa de na yod pa dang / skad cig ma'i ngang la gnas pas de ma thag pa'i rkyen kyang yod la 'gog pa la sogs pa'i dus na dbang po ma nyams pas mig la sogs ba'i dbang po yang yod do //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa de na yod pa dang / skad cig ma'i ngang la gnas pas de ma thag pa'i rkyen kyang yod la 'gog pa la sogs pa'i dus na dbang po ma nyams pas mig la sogs ba'i dbang po yang yod do //
translated: Since that mental consciousness exists and abides for a moment, the condition as the equivalent and immediate antecedent exists. Since the sense faculties such as the eyes are not impaired at the time of cessation, etc., the sense faculties exist.

original: yul med par rnam par shes pa gnas mi srid pas yul yang yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yul med par rnam par shes pa gnas mi srid pas yul yang yod par 'gyur te /
translated: Since it is impossible for consciousness to exist without an object, the object also exists.

original: de ltar na yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa gsum 'dus pas reg pa skye'o //
analyzed: de ltar na yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa gsum 'dus pas reg pa skye'o //
translated: Thus, since the object, sense faculty, and consciousness are combined, contact arises.

original: reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba 'byung ngo //
analyzed: reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba 'byung ngo //
translated: Feeling arises due to the condition of contact.

original: tshor ba'i rkyen gyis 'du shes dang / sems pa 'byung bas na 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa'i tshe yid kyi rnam par shes pa yod par mi rigs so //
analyzed: tshor ba'i rkyen gyis 'du shes dang / sems pa 'byung bas na 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa'i tshe yid kyi rnam par shes pa yod par mi rigs so //
translated: Since feeling is a condition for conceptualization and intention, it is not reasonable that mental consciousness exists when one has entered the meditative absorption of cessation.

original: gal te gzhan na re /
analyzed: gal te gzhan na re /
translated: If someone else says,

original: 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa'i tshe yid kyi rnam par shes pa yod pas reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / 'du shes la sogs pa yod par gyur na yang nyes pa ci yod /
analyzed: 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa'i tshe yid kyi rnam par shes pa yod pas reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / 'du shes la sogs pa yod par gyur na yang nyes pa ci yod /
translated: ‚ÄúEven if feeling, conceptualization, etc., exist as conditions for contact when mental consciousness exists at the time of entering the meditative absorption of cessation, what is the error?‚Äù

original: lan du 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa'i tshe 'du shes dang / tshor ba la sogs pa yod par khas blangs na ni 'gog pa ni 'du shes tshor ba 'gog par byed pa'o zhes bshad pa nyid don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lan du 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa'i tshe 'du shes dang / tshor ba la sogs pa yod par khas blangs na ni 'gog pa ni 'du shes tshor ba 'gog par byed pa'o zhes bshad pa nyid don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: We reply, if you accept that feeling, conceptualization, etc., exist at the time of entering the meditative absorption of cessation, then it is meaningless to explain that the meditative absorption of cessation is the cessation of conceptualization and feeling.

original: de lta bas na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni dus thams cad du gnas la /
analyzed: de lta bas na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni dus thams cad du gnas la /
translated: Therefore, the foundation consciousness exists at all times.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa skye ba'i sa bon yang kun gzhi la yod pas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa pa las langs pa'i tshe /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa skye ba'i sa bon yang kun gzhi la yod pas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa pa las langs pa'i tshe /
translated: Also, the seeds of the arising of the active consciousnesses exist in the foundation consciousness.üîΩ

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid las 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa skye bar khas blang dgos so //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid las 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa skye bar khas blang dgos so //
translated: Since the seeds that give rise to the active forms of consciousness also exist in the foundation consciousness, it must be accepted that the active forms of consciousness arise from the foundation consciousness when one arises from the meditative attainment of cessation, the meditative attainment of nonperception, or the state of nonperception.

original: rigs pa'i gtan tshigs gzhan gyis kyang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yod par bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩyang dmigs pa'i rkyen la ltos nas rnam pa gzhan du 'jug pa nyid dang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rigs pa'i gtan tshigs gzhan gyis kyang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yod par bstan pa'i phyir / yang dmigs pa'i rkyen la ltos nas rnam pa gzhan du 'jug pa nyid dang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the foundation consciousness also exists through other logical arguments, the root text states:üîΩ‚ÄúAlso, because it is the basis for the arising of the afflicted view of the self and because it is the support for the six consciousnesses.‚Äù

original: phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tshig 'jug nas 'byung ba 'di yang sbyar te /
analyzed: phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tshig 'jug nas 'byung ba 'di yang sbyar te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand because it is the support for the six consciousnesses‚Äù is a continuation of the phrase ‚Äúbecause it is the basis for the arising of the afflicted view of the self.‚Äù

original: yang dmigs pa'i rkyen la ltos nas rnam pa gzhan du 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa las ma gtogs pa kun gzhi rnam par @103b shes pa yod par mngon no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang dmigs pa'i rkyen la ltos nas rnam pa gzhan du 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa las ma gtogs pa kun gzhi rnam par @103b shes pa yod par mngon no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Moreover, because it engages in a different aspect in dependence on the objective condition, the existence of foundation consciousness is evident, apart from the consciousnesses that engage their objects.

original: de la dmigs pa'i rkyen gyi don ni rkyen bzhi las mig gi rnam par shes pa'i yul gzugs nas lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul reg bya ste lnga dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul chos thams cad de drug la dmigs pa'i rkyen zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i rkyen gyi don ni rkyen bzhi las mig gi rnam par shes pa'i yul gzugs nas lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul reg bya ste lnga dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul chos thams cad de drug la dmigs pa'i rkyen zhes bya'o //
translated: The meaning of objective condition is as follows: From among the four conditions, the five objects of the eye consciousness from form to body consciousness and the object of mental consciousness, all phenomena, are called objective conditions.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen de dag kyang rang bzhin tha dad de gzugs kyi rang bzhin dang rnam pa las sgra'i rang bzhin dang rnam pa gzhan yin pa dang / sgra'i rang bzhin dang rnam pa las gzugs kyi rang bzhin dang rnam pa gzhan yin pas rnam pa gzhan zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen de dag kyang rang bzhin tha dad de gzugs kyi rang bzhin dang rnam pa las sgra'i rang bzhin dang rnam pa gzhan yin pa dang / sgra'i rang bzhin dang rnam pa las gzugs kyi rang bzhin dang rnam pa gzhan yin pas rnam pa gzhan zhes bya ba dang /
translated: These objective conditions have different natures, since the nature and aspect of form is different from the nature and aspect of sound, and the nature and aspect of sound is different from the nature and aspect of form.

original: gzugs kyi rang bzhin la yang sna tshogs tha dad de /
analyzed: gzugs kyi rang bzhin la yang sna tshogs tha dad de /
translated: The nature of form is also diverse,üîΩbecause the nature and aspect of blue is different from the nature and aspect of yellow, and the nature and aspect of yellow is different from the nature and aspect of white.

original: ser po'i rang bzhin dang rnam pa las sngon po'i rang bzhin dang rnam pa gzhan yin pa dang / sngon po'i rang bzhin dang rnam pa las dkar po'i rang bzhin dang rnam pa gzhan yin pas rnam pa gzhan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ser po'i rang bzhin dang rnam pa las sngon po'i rang bzhin dang rnam pa gzhan yin pa dang / sngon po'i rang bzhin dang rnam pa las dkar po'i rang bzhin dang rnam pa gzhan yin pas rnam pa gzhan zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called ‚Äúdifferent aspects.‚Äù

original: de la mig gi dbang po rnam par shes pa gzugs kyi rang bzhin dang rnam par skyes pa las sgras rkyen byas nas sgra la brten te /üîΩrna ba'i rnam par shes pa sgra'i rnam par skyes pa ni dmigs pa'i rkyen la ltos nas rnam pa gzhan du 'jug pa zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: de la mig gi dbang po rnam par shes pa gzugs kyi rang bzhin dang rnam par skyes pa las sgras rkyen byas nas sgra la brten te / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa sgra'i rnam par skyes pa ni dmigs pa'i rkyen la ltos nas rnam pa gzhan du 'jug pa zhes bya ba'am /
translated: In this regard, the eye consciousness arises with the nature and aspect of form. Sound acts as a condition for the ear consciousness to arise with the aspect of sound, in dependence on sound.üîΩIn dependence on the objective condition, it is called ‚Äúengaging with a different aspect.‚Äù

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa dkar po'i rnam par skyes pa las ser pos rkyen byas nas ser po'i rnam par skyes pa ni dmigs pa'i rkyen la ltos nas rnam pa gzhan du 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa dkar po'i rnam par skyes pa las ser pos rkyen byas nas ser po'i rnam par skyes pa ni dmigs pa'i rkyen la ltos nas rnam pa gzhan du 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Or, the eye consciousness arises with the aspect of white. Yellow acts as a condition for the eye consciousness to arise with the aspect of yellow. In dependence on the objective condition, it is called ‚Äúengaging with a different aspect.‚Äù

original: de ltar rnam par shes pa sngon po'i rnam par skyes pa las yul ser pos rkyen byas nas ser po'i rnam pa gzhan skye ba dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa gzugs kyi rnam par skyes pa las dmigs pa'i rkyen sgras rkyen byas nas rna ba'i rnam par shes pa sgra'i rnam par skye ba dang /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par shes pa sngon po'i rnam par skyes pa las yul ser pos rkyen byas nas ser po'i rnam pa gzhan skye ba dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa gzugs kyi rnam par skyes pa las dmigs pa'i rkyen sgras rkyen byas nas rna ba'i rnam par shes pa sgra'i rnam par skye ba dang /
translated: From the eye consciousness that arises in the aspect of form, the ear consciousness arises in the aspect of sound due to the condition of the object, sound.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen la ltos nas rnam pa gzhan du skye zhing 'jug go //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen la ltos nas rnam pa gzhan du skye zhing 'jug go //
translated: In dependence on the condition of the object, other aspects arise and engage.

original: dmigs ba'i rkyen la ma ltos ma brten par rnam pa gzhan du 'jug cing skye par mi nus te /
analyzed: dmigs ba'i rkyen la ma ltos ma brten par rnam pa gzhan du 'jug cing skye par mi nus te /
translated: Without depending on the condition of the object, other aspects cannot arise and engage.

original: de bas na 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyi dmigs pa'i rkyen dgos so //
analyzed: de bas na 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyi dmigs pa'i rkyen dgos so //
translated: Therefore, the condition of the object is necessary for the engaging consciousnesses.

original: dper na myu gu bskyed pa las chu me rlung la sogs pa'i grogs byed pa yod kyang rgyu'i rkyen sa bon med na myu gu mi skye ste /
analyzed: dper na myu gu bskyed pa las chu me rlung la sogs pa'i grogs byed pa yod kyang rgyu'i rkyen sa bon med na myu gu mi skye ste /
translated: For example, although water, fire, wind, and so on assist in the production of a sprout, without the causal condition of the seed, the sprout will not arise.

original: sa bon dgos pa de bzhin du 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams la dmigs pa'i rkyen yod na de dag rgyu'i @104a * //
analyzed: sa bon dgos pa de bzhin du 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams la dmigs pa'i rkyen yod na de dag rgyu'i @104a * //
translated: Just as the seed is necessary, so too the objective condition is necessary for the active consciousnesses.

original: rkyen kyang med du mi rung ste /üîΩgdon mi za bar rgyu'i rkyen kyang dgos so //
analyzed: rkyen kyang med du mi rung ste / gdon mi za bar rgyu'i rkyen kyang dgos so //
translated: The causal condition is also necessary,üîΩbecause the active consciousnesses must definitely have a causal condition.

original: de la 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyi rgyu'i rkyen ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yin te /
analyzed: de la 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyi rgyu'i rkyen ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yin te /
translated: The causal condition of the active consciousnesses is the store consciousness,

original: de bas na 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa las ma gtogs par kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyi sa bon gyi gzhir gyur pa zhig yod par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa las ma gtogs par kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyi sa bon gyi gzhir gyur pa zhig yod par shes par bya'o //
translated: because of that, one should understand that the so-called store consciousness, which is the basis of the seeds of the active consciousnesses, exists apart from the active consciousnesses.

original: de la mig gi rnam par shes pa rna ba'i rnam par shes pa las rnam pa dang rang bzhin gzhan yin pa dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa las sna'i rnam par shes pa rnam pa dang rang bzhin gzhan yin te /
analyzed: de la mig gi rnam par shes pa rna ba'i rnam par shes pa las rnam pa dang rang bzhin gzhan yin pa dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa las sna'i rnam par shes pa rnam pa dang rang bzhin gzhan yin te /
translated: The visual consciousness is different in aspect and nature from the auditory consciousness, and the olfactory consciousness is different in aspect and nature from the auditory consciousness.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams rang bzhin tha dad pa yang de dag gi dmigs pa dang / rnam pa'i rkyen tha dad pa'i sgo nas de dag gi rang bzhin yang tha dad par gzhag gi de ma thag pa'i rkyen dang bdag po'i rkyen tha dad pas de dag tha dad par gzhag pa ni med do //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams rang bzhin tha dad pa yang de dag gi dmigs pa dang / rnam pa'i rkyen tha dad pa'i sgo nas de dag gi rang bzhin yang tha dad par gzhag gi de ma thag pa'i rkyen dang bdag po'i rkyen tha dad pas de dag tha dad par gzhag pa ni med do //
translated: The active consciousnesses are also different by nature, because their objective conditions and aspect conditions are different. Their nature is posited as different, but they are not posited as different by way of their immediately preceding condition and dominant condition.

original: de ltar dmigs pa'i rkyen tha dad pa'i sgo nas de dag gi rang bzhin tha dad par 'gyur ba'i phyir dmigs pa'i rkyen la ltos nas rnam pa gzhan du 'jug pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar dmigs pa'i rkyen tha dad pa'i sgo nas de dag gi rang bzhin tha dad par 'gyur ba'i phyir dmigs pa'i rkyen la ltos nas rnam pa gzhan du 'jug pa nyid do //
translated: Because their nature becomes different by way of the different objective conditions, they engage in different aspects in reliance on the objective condition.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen tha dad pa'i sgo nas rnam par shes pa tha dad par 'gyur ba yang gzugs kyi rnam pa las sgra'i rnam pa gzhan yin pa dang ; sgra'i rnam pa las dri'i rnam pa gzhan yin pas na mig gi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa'i rkyen gzugs yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen tha dad pa'i sgo nas rnam par shes pa tha dad par 'gyur ba yang gzugs kyi rnam pa las sgra'i rnam pa gzhan yin pa dang ; sgra'i rnam pa las dri'i rnam pa gzhan yin pas na mig gi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa'i rkyen gzugs yin te /
translated: Consciousness becomes different by way of the different objective conditions because the aspect of form is different from the aspect of sound and the aspect of sound is different from the aspect of smell. The objective condition of eye consciousness is form.

original: gzugs la rnam par shes pa dmigs nas gzugs kyi rnam par skye ba dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa'i rkyen sgra yin te /üîΩsgra la dmigs nas sgra'i rnam par skye ba la sogs pa rang bzhin tha dad par gzhag pa yang yul tha dad pa'i sgo nas tha dad par gzhag dgos par zad do //
analyzed: gzugs la rnam par shes pa dmigs nas gzugs kyi rnam par skye ba dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa'i rkyen sgra yin te / sgra la dmigs nas sgra'i rnam par skye ba la sogs pa rang bzhin tha dad par gzhag pa yang yul tha dad pa'i sgo nas tha dad par gzhag dgos par zad do //
translated: The objective condition of auditory consciousness is sound.üîΩConsciousness arises in the aspect of sound by objectifying sound.

original: de ma thag pa'i rkyen tha dad pa'i sgo nas 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams tha dad par gzhag pa ni med de /
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i rkyen tha dad pa'i sgo nas 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams tha dad par gzhag pa ni med de /
translated: The consciousnesses are posited as different by way of different objects, but they are not posited as different by way of different immediately preceding conditions.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: rnam par shes ba snga ma 'gag pa de dag 'di kho na bskyed pa'i rkyen rgyu ni byed pa gzhan skyed pa'i rkyen mi byed do zhes nges pa med de /
analyzed: rnam par shes ba snga ma 'gag pa de dag 'di kho na bskyed pa'i rkyen rgyu ni byed pa gzhan skyed pa'i rkyen mi byed do zhes nges pa med de /
translated: There is no certainty that the former consciousness that has ceased is the condition that produces just that and not the condition that produces another.

original: dper na / mig gi rnam par shes pa sngar 'gags na sngar 'gags pa de gal te mig gi rnam par shes pa phyi ma skye ba'i de ma thag pa'i rkyen byed /
analyzed: dper na / mig gi rnam par shes pa sngar 'gags na sngar 'gags pa de gal te mig gi rnam par shes pa phyi ma skye ba'i de ma thag pa'i rkyen byed /
translated: For example, if the former eye consciousness has ceased, it is not certain that it is the immediately preceding condition of the later eye consciousness.

original: gal te rna ba'i rnam par shes pa phyi ma @104b skyed pa'i rkyen byed pas 'di kho na bskyed pa'i rten rkyen byed ces nges pa med pas na de ma thag pa'i rkyen las ni rnam par shes pa tha dad par gzhag pa med do //
analyzed: gal te rna ba'i rnam par shes pa phyi ma @104b skyed pa'i rkyen byed pas 'di kho na bskyed pa'i rten rkyen byed ces nges pa med pas na de ma thag pa'i rkyen las ni rnam par shes pa tha dad par gzhag pa med do //
translated: Since there is no certainty, consciousness is not posited as different from the immediately preceding condition.

original: de bzhin du bdag po'i rkyen tha dad pas rnam par shes pa tha dad par gzhag pa yang med de /
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag po'i rkyen tha dad pas rnam par shes pa tha dad par gzhag pa yang med de /
translated: Similarly, consciousness is not posited as different due to different dominant conditions.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩdper na / mig gi dbang po lta bu mig gi rnam par shes pa sngo po'i rnam par lta bu skye ba'i rkyen kyang byed la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / dper na / mig gi dbang po lta bu mig gi rnam par shes pa sngo po'i rnam par lta bu skye ba'i rkyen kyang byed la /
translated: Why is that?üîΩFor example, the eye faculty is a condition for the production of eye consciousness that has the aspect of blue.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa ser po'i rnam pa lta bu skye ba'i rkyen kyang byed de /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa ser po'i rnam pa lta bu skye ba'i rkyen kyang byed de /
translated: It is also a condition for the production of eye consciousness that has the aspect of yellow.

original: yul mang po'i sgo nas mig gi rnam par shes pa rnam pa sna tshogs su skye ba kun gyi rkyen byed pas na bdag po'i rkyen tha dad pa'i sgo nas rnam par shes pa tha dad par gzhag pa med do //
analyzed: yul mang po'i sgo nas mig gi rnam par shes pa rnam pa sna tshogs su skye ba kun gyi rkyen byed pas na bdag po'i rkyen tha dad pa'i sgo nas rnam par shes pa tha dad par gzhag pa med do //
translated: Since the objective condition is the cause of the various aspects of eye consciousness arising from many objects, consciousness is not posited as different by way of different dominant conditions.

original: de ltar yul rnam pa tha dad pas rnam par shes pa rnam pa gzhan du 'jug pa de yang dmigs pa'i rkyen la mi ltos par 'jug mi srid de /
analyzed: de ltar yul rnam pa tha dad pas rnam par shes pa rnam pa gzhan du 'jug pa de yang dmigs pa'i rkyen la mi ltos par 'jug mi srid de /
translated: Thus the engagement of consciousness in different aspects due to different objects cannot occur without depending on the objective condition.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen la ltos dgos pa de bzhin du 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa de dag skye rgyu'i rkyen la mi ltos par skye mi srid pas rgyu'i rkyen yang dogs so //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen la ltos dgos pa de bzhin du 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa de dag skye rgyu'i rkyen la mi ltos par skye mi srid pas rgyu'i rkyen yang dogs so //
translated: Just as it must depend on the objective condition, it is impossible for those consciousnesses that engage to arise without depending on the causal condition that is the cause of their arising.

original: gal te nyan thos rnam par smra ba ba rnams na re /
analyzed: gal te nyan thos rnam par smra ba ba rnams na re /
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ika SautrƒÅntikas say:

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams la dmigs pa'i rkyen med par mi rigs pa de bzhin du de dag la rgyu'i rkyen yang med par mi rigs pa ni bden mod kyi 'jug pa'i rnam bar shes pa de dag gi ni rkyen reg pa dang /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams la dmigs pa'i rkyen med par mi rigs pa de bzhin du de dag la rgyu'i rkyen yang med par mi rigs pa ni bden mod kyi 'jug pa'i rnam bar shes pa de dag gi ni rkyen reg pa dang /
translated: Just as it is illogical for the active consciousnesses to lack objective conditions, it is also true that it is illogical for them to lack causal conditions.

original: yid la byed pa la sogs pa sems las byung ba dang / lhan cig 'grogs pa rnams yin nam /
analyzed: yid la byed pa la sogs pa sems las byung ba dang / lhan cig 'grogs pa rnams yin nam /
translated: Are the causal conditions of the active consciousnesses the mental factors such as contact and attention that accompany them?

original: 'on te rgyu'i rkyen gzhan zhig yod par dpyad dgos so zhe na lan du /
analyzed: 'on te rgyu'i rkyen gzhan zhig yod par dpyad dgos so zhe na lan du /
translated: Or is it necessary to investigate whether there is another causal condition?

original: rgyu'i rkyen zhes bya ba ni chos gang la mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i sa bon yod cing de'i sa bon gyi gzhi yod par byed pa la rgyu'i rkyen zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu'i rkyen zhes bya ba ni chos gang la mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i sa bon yod cing de'i sa bon gyi gzhi yod par byed pa la rgyu'i rkyen zhes bya ste /
translated: The so called causal condition is that which makes the seed of a phenomenon such as eye consciousness and its basis exist.

original: de bas na mig la sogs pa'i sa bon ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la yod pas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid rgyu'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: de bas na mig la sogs pa'i sa bon ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la yod pas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid rgyu'i rkyen yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the seeds of eye consciousness and so on exist in foundation consciousness, foundation consciousness itself is the causal condition.

original: de skad du bshad pa la /
analyzed: de skad du bshad pa la /
translated: In response to that explanation,

original: nyan thos rnam par smra ba pa rnams kyis smras pa /
analyzed: nyan thos rnam par smra ba pa rnams kyis smras pa /
translated: The ≈õrƒÅvaka Proponents of Consciousness say:

original: skad cig ma snga ma la rna ba'i rnam par shes pa skye snas /
analyzed: skad cig ma snga ma la rna ba'i rnam par shes pa skye snas /
translated: The ear consciousness arises in the previous moment.

original: bdag 'gags pa'i dus na ma 'ongs pa na bdag dang 'dra ba'i rna ba'i rnam par shes pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir mig rnam par shes pa skad cig ma phyi ma skye ba las sa bon 'jog ste /üîΩde @105a * //üîΩltar 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa nyid gcig la gcig sa bon 'jog gi kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dgos pa med do zhes lan du 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams la ni gcig la gcig sa bon 'jog par mi rigs te /
analyzed: bdag 'gags pa'i dus na ma 'ongs pa na bdag dang 'dra ba'i rna ba'i rnam par shes pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir mig rnam par shes pa skad cig ma phyi ma skye ba las sa bon 'jog ste / de @105a * // ltar 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa nyid gcig la gcig sa bon 'jog gi kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dgos pa med do zhes lan du 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams la ni gcig la gcig sa bon 'jog par mi rigs te /
translated: When the self is ceasing, in order to generate an ear consciousness similar to itself in the future, it plants a seed in the subsequent moment of eye consciousness.üîΩThus the seeds are planted in the active consciousnesses themselves, not in the foundation consciousness.

original: bag chags sog bar byed pa dang bsgo bar bya ba gnyis dus mnyam par yod par 'dod de /
analyzed: bag chags sog bar byed pa dang bsgo bar bya ba gnyis dus mnyam par yod par 'dod de /
translated: It is not logical for the seeds to be planted in the active consciousnesses themselves because the impregnators of the latent propensities and that which is impregnated are asserted to exist simultaneously.

original: gang gi tshe sgo bar byed pa yod pa de'i tshe bso bar bya ba yang yod na gcig gi gcig la bsgo bar 'dod pa las 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du mi ston pa dang /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sgo bar byed pa yod pa de'i tshe bso bar bya ba yang yod na gcig gi gcig la bsgo bar 'dod pa las 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du mi ston pa dang /
translated: When there is that which is to be impregnated, then there is also that which impregnates. But it is not tenable that one consciousness impregnates another, because the desire to impregnate one with the other is absent, and because the active forms of consciousness arise as virtuous, nonvirtuous, and undefined,

original: khams tha ma dang bar ma dang / rab rnams dang ; 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / zag pa bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa rnams rim pa bzhin du 'byung ba'i phyir de dag nang gcig la gcig bsgo bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: khams tha ma dang bar ma dang / rab rnams dang ; 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / zag pa bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa rnams rim pa bzhin du 'byung ba'i phyir de dag nang gcig la gcig bsgo bar mi rung ngo //
translated: as belonging to the final, intermediate, or initial stages of concentration, as mundane or transcendent, and as either contaminated or uncontaminated.

original: ji lta zhe na /üîΩrna ba'i rnam par shes pa snga ma 'gags pa des mig gi rnam par shes pa phyi ma skye ba la bag chags bsgo zhes bya bar gang gi tshe /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa snga ma 'gags pa des mig gi rnam par shes pa phyi ma skye ba la bag chags bsgo zhes bya bar gang gi tshe /
translated: How is that?üîΩThe former moment of ear consciousness that has ceased impregnates the later moment of eye consciousness that has arisen.

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa skyes pa de'i tshe mig gi rnam par shes pa ma skyes na gang la la bag chags bsgo /
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa skyes pa de'i tshe mig gi rnam par shes pa ma skyes na gang la la bag chags bsgo /
translated: When the ear consciousness has arisen, the eye consciousness has not arisen, so what is impregnated by what?

original: gang gi ste mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba de'i tshe rna ba'i rnam par shes pa 'gags na phyi ma la sus sgo bar byed de mi rigs so //
analyzed: gang gi ste mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba de'i tshe rna ba'i rnam par shes pa 'gags na phyi ma la sus sgo bar byed de mi rigs so //
translated: When the eye consciousness arises, the ear consciousness ceases. Who then opens the door for the latter? It is illogical to say that it does.

original: gzhan yang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams ni dge ba'i rang bzhin yang yin /üîΩmi dge ba'i rang bzhin yang yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams ni dge ba'i rang bzhin yang yin / mi dge ba'i rang bzhin yang yin /
translated: Moreover, the active forms of consciousness are virtuous,

original: lung du mi ston pa'i rang bzhin yang yin pa las chos de dag ni phan tshun me dang chu bzhin du 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir dus gcig tu mi bde bzhin du mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: lung du mi ston pa'i rang bzhin yang yin pa las chos de dag ni phan tshun me dang chu bzhin du 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir dus gcig tu mi bde bzhin du mi 'byung ste /
translated: nonvirtuous, or indeterminate. Since these states are mutually exclusive, like fire and water, they do not occur at the same time.

original: gang gi tshe dge ba byung ba de'i tshe mi dge ba mi 'byung /
analyzed: gang gi tshe dge ba byung ba de'i tshe mi dge ba mi 'byung /
translated: When a virtuous state occurs, a nonvirtuous state does not occur.

original: gang gi tshe mi dge ba byung ba na de'i tshe lung du mi ston pa mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gang gi tshe mi dge ba byung ba na de'i tshe lung du mi ston pa mi 'byung ngo //
translated: When a nonvirtuous state occurs, an indeterminate state does not occur.

original: de ltar na skad cig ma snga ma la 'jug ba'i rnam par shes pa dge ba'i rang bzhin zhig byung nas /
analyzed: de ltar na skad cig ma snga ma la 'jug ba'i rnam par shes pa dge ba'i rang bzhin zhig byung nas /
translated: Thus, when a virtuous state of consciousness occurs, a nonvirtuous state of consciousness does not occur.

original: dge ba des ma 'ongs pa na bdag dang 'dra ba'i dge ba bskyed pa'i phyir skad cig ma gnyis pa la 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa mi dge ba'i rang bzhin byung ba la bag chags bsgo zhes bya bar yang gang gi tshe skad cig ma la dagüîΩba byung ba de'i skad cig ma la mi dge ba'i rang bzhin gyis 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ma byung bas na gang gi tshe bag chags bsgo /
analyzed: dge ba des ma 'ongs pa na bdag dang 'dra ba'i dge ba bskyed pa'i phyir skad cig ma gnyis pa la 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa mi dge ba'i rang bzhin byung ba la bag chags bsgo zhes bya bar yang gang gi tshe skad cig ma la dag ba byung ba de'i skad cig ma la mi dge ba'i rang bzhin gyis 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ma byung bas na gang gi tshe bag chags bsgo /
translated: Because of that virtue, in the second moment of consciousness that is the nature of nonvirtue, the latent ten dency is said to be infused in order to generate virtue like that in the future.üîΩWhen virtue arises in one moment, the consciousness that is the nature of nonvirtue does not arise in that moment.

original: gang gi tshe @105b mi dge ba skyes pa de na dge ba snga ma 'gags pas gang gis phyi ma de la bag chags bsgo ste de ltar mi rigs so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe @105b mi dge ba skyes pa de na dge ba snga ma 'gags pas gang gis phyi ma de la bag chags bsgo ste de ltar mi rigs so //
translated: When nonvirtue arises, the previous virtue has ceased. By what is the latent tendency infused in the subsequent nonvirtue? That is not tenable.

original: de bzhin du lung ma bstan pa la yang phan tshun du sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du lung ma bstan pa la yang phan tshun du sbyar ro //
translated: So too, the neutral should be applied to each other.

original: de la khams tha ma ni 'dod pa'i khams so //
analyzed: de la khams tha ma ni 'dod pa'i khams so //
translated: The lowest realm is the desire realm.

original: khams 'bring po ni gzugs kyi khams so //
analyzed: khams 'bring po ni gzugs kyi khams so //
translated: The middling realm is the form realm.

original: khams rab ni gzugs med pa'i khams so //
analyzed: khams rab ni gzugs med pa'i khams so //
translated: The best realm is the formless realm.

original: khams de dag gi 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyang rim gyis 'byung ba'i phyir gcig la gcig bsgo bar mi rigs te /üîΩ'dod pa'i khams kyi sbyor ba'i sems kyis gzugs kyi ting nge 'dzin bskyed pa'i las snga mas phyi ma la bsgo zhes bya bar yang gang gi tshe 'dod pa'i khams kyi sbyor ba'i sems byung ba na gzugs kyi khams kyi ting nge 'dzin ma skyes na gang la
analyzed: khams de dag gi 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyang rim gyis 'byung ba'i phyir gcig la gcig bsgo bar mi rigs te / 'dod pa'i khams kyi sbyor ba'i sems kyis gzugs kyi ting nge 'dzin bskyed pa'i las snga mas phyi ma la bsgo zhes bya bar yang gang gi tshe 'dod pa'i khams kyi sbyor ba'i sems byung ba na gzugs kyi khams kyi ting nge 'dzin ma skyes na gang la
translated: Also, the consciousnesses that engage those elements arise in sequence, so it is illogical that they are mutually conditioning.üîΩIf the prior action of the mind of preparation of the desire realm generates the meditative attainment of the form realm, what is conditioned by what?üîΩWhen the mind of preparation of the desire realm arises, if the meditative attainment of the form realm has not arisen, by what is it conditioned?

original: bsgo / gang gi tshe gzugs kyi khams kyi ting nge 'dzin skyes pa na 'dod pa'i khams kyi sbyor ba'i sems 'gags na gang gis phyi ma la bsgo ste mi rigs so ;
analyzed: bsgo / gang gi tshe gzugs kyi khams kyi ting nge 'dzin skyes pa na 'dod pa'i khams kyi sbyor ba'i sems 'gags na gang gis phyi ma la bsgo ste mi rigs so ;
translated: When the meditative attainment of the form realm arises, if the mind of preparation of the desire realm has ceased, by what is the latter conditioned?üîΩIt is illogical.

original: / de bzhin du gzugs med pa'i khams la sogs pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: / de bzhin du gzugs med pa'i khams la sogs pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: So too, this should be applied to the formless realm and so on.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems kyang rim gyis 'byung bas na gcig la gcig bsgo bar mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems kyang rim gyis 'byung bas na gcig la gcig bsgo bar mi rigs te /
translated: Also, since mundane and supramundane minds arise in sequence, it is illogical that they are mutually conditioning.

original: ji lta zhe na 'jig rten pa'i sems 'jig rten pa'i chos mchog tu 'byung ba'i 'og tu 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems sdug bsngal la chos shes pa 'byung bas na snga mas phyi ma la bsgo zhes bya bar yang gang gi tshe 'jig rten pa'i sems 'jigüîΩrten pa'i chos mchog 'byung ba na 'jig rten las 'ongs pa'i sems sdug bsngal la chos shes pa ma byung bas na gang la bsgo /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na 'jig rten pa'i sems 'jig rten pa'i chos mchog tu 'byung ba'i 'og tu 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems sdug bsngal la chos shes pa 'byung bas na snga mas phyi ma la bsgo zhes bya bar yang gang gi tshe 'jig rten pa'i sems 'jig rten pa'i chos mchog 'byung ba na 'jig rten las 'ongs pa'i sems sdug bsngal la chos shes pa ma byung bas na gang la bsgo /
translated: How is that?üîΩWhen the mundane mind arises from the mundane supreme mundane state, the supramundane mind that is the Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering does not arise.

original: gang gi tshe 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems sdug bsngal la chos shes pa byung ba na 'jig rten gyi chos mchog gi sems 'gags pas na gang gis phyi ma la bsgo ste mi rigs so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems sdug bsngal la chos shes pa byung ba na 'jig rten gyi chos mchog gi sems 'gags pas na gang gis phyi ma la bsgo ste mi rigs so //
translated: When the supramundane mind that is the Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering arises, the mundane mind of the supreme mundane state has ceased.üîΩTherefore it is illogical to say that the former imprints the latter.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'i sems rnams kyang rim gyis 'byung bas na gcig la gcig bag chags bsgo bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'i sems rnams kyang rim gyis 'byung bas na gcig la gcig bag chags bsgo bar mi rigs so //
translated: Also it is illogical to say that the minds that are respectively contaminated and uncontaminated minds imprint each other, since they arise in sequence.

original: de las sa god ma la ni yon tan du lta /
analyzed: de las sa god ma la ni yon tan du lta /
translated: The former views the latter as a quality.

original: sa 'og ma la ni skyon du lta ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: sa 'og ma la ni skyon du lta ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i lam mo //
translated: The path with outflows is the view of the lower stage as a fault.

original: mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam ni zag pa med pa'i lam mo //üîΩde la gang gi tshe zag pa can gyi lam byung ba de'i tshe zag pa @106a * //
analyzed: mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam ni zag pa med pa'i lam mo // de la gang gi tshe zag pa can gyi lam byung ba de'i tshe zag pa @106a * //
translated: The path of seeing and the path of cultivation are uncontaminated paths.

original: med pa'i lam ma byung bas gang la bsgo /üîΩgang gi tshe zag pa med pa'i lam byung ba de'i tshe zag pa dang bcas pa'i lam 'gags pas na phyi ma la su bsgo ste mi rigs so //
analyzed: med pa'i lam ma byung bas gang la bsgo / gang gi tshe zag pa med pa'i lam byung ba de'i tshe zag pa dang bcas pa'i lam 'gags pas na phyi ma la su bsgo ste mi rigs so //
translated: When a contaminated path arises, the uncontaminated path does not arise.üîΩWhen the uncontaminated path arises, the contaminated path ceases.

original: de skad du bshad pa dang / gal te gzhan gyis smras pa /üîΩde ltar na sems nyid kyis nyid la bsgo ste /
analyzed: de skad du bshad pa dang / gal te gzhan gyis smras pa / de ltar na sems nyid kyis nyid la bsgo ste /
translated: Therefore, it is illogical to say that the latter is cultivated by the former.üîΩIf you say that the mind itself is the controller of the mind itself,

original: 'di ltar skad cig ma gcig la dge ba'i sems 'byung ba de nyid kyis sems de nyid la bsgo bas kun gzhi mi dgos so zhe na yang ral gri so ji ltar rnon yang so de nyid kyis so de mi chod pa bzhin du bdag la bdag byed
analyzed: 'di ltar skad cig ma gcig la dge ba'i sems 'byung ba de nyid kyis sems de nyid la bsgo bas kun gzhi mi dgos so zhe na yang ral gri so ji ltar rnon yang so de nyid kyis so de mi chod pa bzhin du bdag la bdag byed
translated: then just as a sword cannot cut itself, the mind itself cannot control the mind itself.

original: par 'gal bas sems de nyid kyis de nyid la bsgo bar mi rigs so de ltar ni mi rigs kyi 'di ltar rigs te /
analyzed: par 'gal bas sems de nyid kyis de nyid la bsgo bar mi rigs so de ltar ni mi rigs kyi 'di ltar rigs te /
translated: But it is illogical for that mind to be instructed by that mind.

original: me tog tsam pa ka dang til 'bru gnyis skyes kyang mnyam du skyes 'gag kyang mnyam du 'gags la /
analyzed: me tog tsam pa ka dang til 'bru gnyis skyes kyang mnyam du skyes 'gag kyang mnyam du 'gags la /
translated: It is not illogical to say that a champaka flower and a sesame seed arise together and cease together.

original: gang gi tshe me tog yod pa de'i tshe til 'bru yang yod de /
analyzed: gang gi tshe me tog yod pa de'i tshe til 'bru yang yod de /
translated: When the flower exists, the sesame seed also exists.üîΩThe momentariness of the flower instructs the momentariness of the sesame seed with the scent of the flower.

original: me tog gi skad cig ma des til 'bru'i skad cig ma la me tog gi dris sgo bar byed pa de bzhin du ;
analyzed: me tog gi skad cig ma des til 'bru'i skad cig ma la me tog gi dris sgo bar byed pa de bzhin du ;
translated: In the same way,

original: rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa /
translated: the consciousness that is the result of evolution,

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams lhan cig tu skyes pa lhan cig tu 'gags te /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams lhan cig tu skyes pa lhan cig tu 'gags te /
translated: the consciousness that is the all-base, and the consciousnesses that engage their objects arise together and cease together.

original: gang gi tshe kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yod pa de'i tshe 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyang yod de /
analyzed: gang gi tshe kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yod pa de'i tshe 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyang yod de /
translated: When the all-base consciousness exists, the consciousnesses that engage their objects also exist.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i skad cig ma de la de dang lhan cig tu 'byung ba'i 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ni ma 'ongs pa na bdag dang 'dra ba'i 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i phyir bag chags sgo bar byed de /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i skad cig ma de la de dang lhan cig tu 'byung ba'i 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ni ma 'ongs pa na bdag dang 'dra ba'i 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i phyir bag chags sgo bar byed de /
translated: In that moment of foundation consciousness, the operative consciousness that arises simultaneously with it plants the latent propensities, because in the future it generates an operative consciousness that is similar to itself.

original: kun gzhi bag chags dang ldan pa de las 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams skye'o zhes de ltar khas blang dgos so //
analyzed: kun gzhi bag chags dang ldan pa de las 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams skye'o zhes de ltar khas blang dgos so //
translated: Thus it must be accepted that the operative consciousnesses arise from the foundation consciousness that possesses the latent propensities.

original: de lta bas na 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa las ma gtogs pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba 'dus byas thams cad kyi sa bon dang ldan pa logs shig na yod par grub po //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa las ma gtogs pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba 'dus byas thams cad kyi sa bon dang ldan pa logs shig na yod par grub po //
translated: Therefore, apart from the operative consciousness, the so-called foundation consciousness that possesses the seeds of all conditioned states exists separately.

original: rigs pa'i gtan tshigs gzhan gyis kyang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa las ma gtogs par kun gzhi yod par bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rigs pa'i gtan tshigs gzhan gyis kyang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa las ma gtogs par kun gzhi yod par bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to prove by another logical reason that the foundation consciousness exists apart from the operative consciousness, he says,

original: chad nas yang 'jug pa dang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: chad nas yang 'jug pa dang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚Äúbecause there is reentry and also because there is entry into a new existence.‚Äù

original: phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tshig mjug nas 'byung ba 'dir yang sbyar te /
analyzed: phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tshig mjug nas 'byung ba 'dir yang sbyar te /
translated: The word ‚Äútherefore‚Äù at the end of the verse is also to be supplied here.

original: chad nas yang 'jug pa'i phyir 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa las ma gtogs par kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba yang yod @106b par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chad nas yang 'jug pa'i phyir 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa las ma gtogs par kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba yang yod @106b par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, because it is interrupted and then reconnects, it should be understood that there is a consciousness called the foundation consciousness, apart from the active forms of consciousness.

original: chad pa ni sems med pa'i gnyid kyis log pa dang / ra rob dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa'i dus na 'jug ba'i rnam par shes pa drug rnams rgyu'i rgyun chad de mi 'byung bas na chad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chad pa ni sems med pa'i gnyid kyis log pa dang / ra rob dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa'i dus na 'jug ba'i rnam par shes pa drug rnams rgyu'i rgyun chad de mi 'byung bas na chad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúInterrupted‚Äù means that the six active forms of consciousness are interrupted and do not occur when the mind is unconscious, as in deep dreamless sleep, in a faint, or in a coma.

original: de la gnyid rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la gnyid rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of sleep:

original: sems dang bcas pa'i gnyid dang / sems med pa'i gnyid do //
analyzed: sems dang bcas pa'i gnyid dang / sems med pa'i gnyid do //
translated: sleep with a mind and sleep without a mind.

original: sems dang bcas pa'i gnyid ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa lnga 'gags kyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa rmi lam dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: sems dang bcas pa'i gnyid ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa lnga 'gags kyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa rmi lam dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Sleep with a mind is when the five sense consciousnesses of the eye, etc., are stopped, but the mental consciousness continues with dreams.

analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la brgal ba bzhin du 'dir yang dang po gnyid ldog du byed pa'i sems de'i 'og tu gnyid kyi rdzas mi 'dra bas chod pas dang po'i sems de las ldang ba'i sems skye'o zhen yang dang po'i sems de ni 'gags te med
translated: Just as when one arises from the meditative attainment of nondiscernment, the first mind that arises is the mind of meditative equipoise of the meditative attainment of cessation, so too here, when one arises from sleep without mind, the first mind that arises is the mind of sleep.üîΩJust as when one arises from the meditative attainment of cessation, the first mind that arises is the mind of meditative equipoise of the meditative attainment of nondiscernment, so too here, when one arises from sleep without mind, the first mind that arises is the mind of sleep.
