analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la ci'i phyir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i don bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the meaning of the term foundation consciousness, he says:

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid ni sa bon thams cad kyi kun gzhi dang zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩrang gi yul dmigs par bya ba'i yul shes pas na rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid ni sa bon thams cad kyi kun gzhi dang zhes bya ba smos te / rang gi yul dmigs par bya ba'i yul shes pas na rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The foundation consciousness is the foundation of all seeds.üîΩConsciousness is so called because it cognizes its object.

original: yul shes pa yang kun @112a * //
analyzed: yul shes pa yang kun @112a * //
translated: The object of consciousness is the foundation consciousness itself.

original: gzhi nyid kyis shes par zad kyi de las ma gtogs par shes par byed pa'i byed pa po dang / byed pa po la sogs pa bdag med pas na kun gzhi nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: gzhi nyid kyis shes par zad kyi de las ma gtogs par shes par byed pa'i byed pa po dang / byed pa po la sogs pa bdag med pas na kun gzhi nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Since there is no creator other than that, and since there is no self of persons, it is called the foundation consciousness.

original: sa bon thams cad kyi kun gzhi zhes bya ba la 'dod chags la sogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi sa bon ji snyed yod pa'i gnas dang rten byed pas na kun gzhi zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sa bon thams cad kyi kun gzhi zhes bya ba la 'dod chags la sogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi sa bon ji snyed yod pa'i gnas dang rten byed pas na kun gzhi zhes bya ste /
translated: It is the foundation of all seeds because it is the abode and support of all the seeds of the afflictions such as attachment.

original: kun gzhi zhes bya ba dang / gnas zhes bya ba dang / rten zhes bya ba ni don gcig ste ming gi rnam grangs su zad do //
analyzed: kun gzhi zhes bya ba dang / gnas zhes bya ba dang / rten zhes bya ba ni don gcig ste ming gi rnam grangs su zad do //
translated: The terms ‚Äústorehouse consciousness,‚Äù ‚Äúfoundation,‚Äù and ‚Äúsupport‚Äù are synonymous.

original: yang na ma bsgribs la lung du mi ston pa dang / bsgribs la lung du mi ston pa dang / dge ba dang ; mi dge ba dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i chos thams cad kyi sa bon gyi gnas dang /
analyzed: yang na ma bsgribs la lung du mi ston pa dang / bsgribs la lung du mi ston pa dang / dge ba dang ; mi dge ba dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i chos thams cad kyi sa bon gyi gnas dang /
translated: Alternatively, the storehouse consciousness is the basis for the seeds of all entities, whether they are unobscured and undefined, obscured and undefined, virtuous, nonvirtuous, contaminated, or uncontaminated.

original: kun gzhi byed pas na kun gzhi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi byed pas na kun gzhi zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the ‚Äústorehouse‚Äù because it is the agent that creates the storehouse.

original: yang na kun gzhi zhes bya ba ni yul la bya ste /
analyzed: yang na kun gzhi zhes bya ba ni yul la bya ste /
translated: Alternatively, the term ‚Äústorehouse‚Äù can be taken to mean an object.

original: nyon mongs pa'i yid kyi yul byed pas na kun gzhi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i yid kyi yul byed pas na kun gzhi zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the ‚Äústorehouse‚Äù because it is the object of the afflicted mind.

original: yang na kun gzhi zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don ni 'dre ba'am 'brel ba'am 'jug pa la bya ste /
analyzed: yang na kun gzhi zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don ni 'dre ba'am 'brel ba'am 'jug pa la bya ste /
translated: Alternatively, the term ‚Äústorehouse‚Äù can be taken to mean a mixture or a combination or an engagement.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de chos thams cad la 'bras bu'i dngos po'i ngo bor 'dre zhing 'brel pas kun gzhi zhes bya ba'am kun gzhi de chos thams cad kyi rgyu'i dngos por 'dre zhing 'brel bas na kun gzhi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de chos thams cad la 'bras bu'i dngos po'i ngo bor 'dre zhing 'brel pas kun gzhi zhes bya ba'am kun gzhi de chos thams cad kyi rgyu'i dngos por 'dre zhing 'brel bas na kun gzhi zhes bya'o //
translated: Or because that foundation consciousness is mixed with and related to all phenomena in the nature of a cause, it is called the foundation consciousness.

original: de la chos thams cad la 'bras bu'i ngo bor 'bre  zhing 'brel ba ni nam dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyis kun gzhi la bag chags sogs pa na /
analyzed: de la chos thams cad la 'bras bu'i ngo bor 'bre  zhing 'brel ba ni nam dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyis kun gzhi la bag chags sogs pa na /
translated: In this regard, it is mixed with and related to all phenomena in the nature of an effect because when virtuous and nonvirtuous phenomena and so on are deposited as predispositions in the foundation consciousness,

original: kun gzhi bag chags dang bcas pa'i mtshan nyid khyad par can du byas pa yin pas chos rnams ni rgyu yin la kun gzhi ni 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: kun gzhi bag chags dang bcas pa'i mtshan nyid khyad par can du byas pa yin pas chos rnams ni rgyu yin la kun gzhi ni 'bras bu yin te /
translated: the foundation consciousness is transformed into a special state together with the predispositions. Thus phenomena are the cause and the foundation consciousness is the effect.

original: de ltar na kun gzhi de chos rnams la 'bras bu'i dngos por 'dre zhing 'brel pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na kun gzhi de chos rnams la 'bras bu'i dngos por 'dre zhing 'brel pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus the foundation consciousness is said to be mixed with and related to all phenomena in the nature of an effect.

original: kun gzhi de chos rnams la rgyu'i dngos por 'dre zhing 'brel pa ni nam kun gzhi bag chags de las chos rnams byung bas na kun gzhi ni rgyu ltar gnas la chos rnams 'bras bu ltar gnas pas na kun gzhi de chos thams cad kyi rgyu'i dngos por
analyzed: kun gzhi de chos rnams la rgyu'i dngos por 'dre zhing 'brel pa ni nam kun gzhi bag chags de las chos rnams byung bas na kun gzhi ni rgyu ltar gnas la chos rnams 'bras bu ltar gnas pas na kun gzhi de chos thams cad kyi rgyu'i dngos por
translated: The all-base is mixed with and related to phenomena as their causal entity.

original: 'dre zhing 'brel pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dre zhing 'brel pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since phenomena arise from that all-base with habitual tendencies, the all-base exists like a cause, and since phenomena exist like effects, the all-base is said to be mixed with and related to all phenomena as their causal entity.

original: kun gzhi zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don gzhan yang bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kun gzhi zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don gzhan yang bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach another meaning of the term all-base,

original: lus kyi kun gzhi dang rgyu dang lus la gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lus kyi kun gzhi dang rgyu dang lus la gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it says, ‚Äúbecause it is the all-base of the body, the cause, and because it is the basis of the body.‚Äù

original: de la lus kyi kun gzhi zhes bya ba la tshor ba dang / 'du @112b shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: de la lus kyi kun gzhi zhes bya ba la tshor ba dang / 'du @112b shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: In this regard, the all-base of the body is the four mental aggregates of feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness,

original: ming gi phung po bzhi dang / gzugs kyi phung po ste phung po lnga la lus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ming gi phung po bzhi dang / gzugs kyi phung po ste phung po lnga la lus zhes bya'o //
translated: and the form aggregate. These five aggregates are called the body.

original: lus de yang kun gzhi la gnas shing kun gzhi la brten la kun gzhi'i mthus rgyun ma chad par 'byung ste /
analyzed: lus de yang kun gzhi la gnas shing kun gzhi la brten la kun gzhi'i mthus rgyun ma chad par 'byung ste /
translated: That body also exists in the foundation consciousness, is supported by the foundation consciousness, and arises uninterruptedly by the power of the foundation consciousness.

original: lus kyi gnas dang gzhi byed pa'i phyir yang kun gzhi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lus kyi gnas dang gzhi byed pa'i phyir yang kun gzhi zhes bya'o //
translated: The foundation consciousness is also called the foundation because it is the basis and support of the body.

original: lus kyi rgyu dang rten byed pas na kun gzhi zhes bya ste /
analyzed: lus kyi rgyu dang rten byed pas na kun gzhi zhes bya ste /
translated: The foundation consciousness is called the foundation because it is the cause and support of the body.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: phung po lnga'i sa bon kun gzhi la yod pa brtas par gyur pa dang / ma'i mngal du kun gzhi rnam par shes pas mtshams sbyar nas /
analyzed: phung po lnga'i sa bon kun gzhi la yod pa brtas par gyur pa dang / ma'i mngal du kun gzhi rnam par shes pas mtshams sbyar nas /
translated: The seeds of the five aggregates exist in the foundation consciousness and they develop.üîΩThe foundation consciousness connects the foundation consciousness with the mother‚Äôs womb and the body is produced and arises from name and form.

original: lus de ming dang gzugs 'byung zhing 'grub par kun gzhis byed pas na lus kyi rgyu byed pa'i phyir yang kun gzhi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lus de ming dang gzugs 'byung zhing 'grub par kun gzhis byed pas na lus kyi rgyu byed pa'i phyir yang kun gzhi zhes bya'o //
translated: The foundation consciousness is also called the foundation because it is the cause of the body.

original: lus la gnas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la lus kyi mig la sogs pa'i dbang po dang bcas pa'i gzugs la bya'o //
analyzed: lus la gnas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la lus kyi mig la sogs pa'i dbang po dang bcas pa'i gzugs la bya'o //
translated: It is called the foundation because it exists in the body. The body refers to the form aggregate that is the basis of the eye and other sense organs.

original: 'di ltar mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa drug gis ni lus mtha' dag la khyab par gnas pa ma yin gyi kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni lus mtha' dag la khyab par gnas te /
analyzed: 'di ltar mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa drug gis ni lus mtha' dag la khyab par gnas pa ma yin gyi kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni lus mtha' dag la khyab par gnas te /
translated: Thus, the six consciousnesses such as eye consciousness do not abide pervading the entire body. But the store consciousness does abide pervading the entire body.

original: kun la khyab pa'i mtshan nyid du lus dang kun gzhir 'brel pas na lus kun la khyab par gnas pa'i phyir yang kun gzhi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun la khyab pa'i mtshan nyid du lus dang kun gzhir 'brel pas na lus kun la khyab par gnas pa'i phyir yang kun gzhi zhes bya'o //
translated: It is also called store consciousness because it is related to the body and the store consciousness as a characteristic that pervades everything.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de la ming du kun gzhi zhes bya bar yang ma zad kyi ming gzhan yang yod par bstan pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de la ming du kun gzhi zhes bya bar yang ma zad kyi ming gzhan yang yod par bstan pa'i phyir ;
translated: Not only is the store consciousness called store consciousness, it also has other names.

original: len pa'i rnam par shes pa yang de yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: len pa'i rnam par shes pa yang de yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is also the appropriating consciousness.

original: kun gzhi de la ming du len pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kun gzhi de la ming du len pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of this is that the store consciousness is also called appropriating consciousness.

original: kun gzhi de la ci'i phyir ming du len pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: kun gzhi de la ci'i phyir ming du len pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is the store consciousness called appropriating consciousness?

original: de'i gtan tshigs su /
analyzed: de'i gtan tshigs su /
translated: The reason is stated in the verse:

original: lus len pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lus len pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because it appropriates a body.

original: kun gzhi 'dis lus len pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / lus mi gtong bar byed pas na len pa'i rnam par shes ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi 'dis lus len pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / lus mi gtong bar byed pas na len pa'i rnam par shes ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This foundation consciousness is called the appropriating consciousness because it appropriates a body, maintains it, and prevents the body from being discarded.

original: gal te gzhan na re /
analyzed: gal te gzhan na re /
translated: If someone else says,

original: lus ni sems kyis ma blangs kyi mu stegs kyis brtags pa'i bdag gis lus len to zhe na /
analyzed: lus ni sems kyis ma blangs kyi mu stegs kyis brtags pa'i bdag gis lus len to zhe na /
translated: The body is not appropriated by the mind. The self imagined by the tƒ´rthikas appropriates the body.

original: 'jig rten na lus ni sems kyis len par grags kyi bdag gis len par ma grags pa dang / bdag ni rtag pa yin pas rtag pa la ni lus len pa dang mi len pa gnyis su mi rigs la /
analyzed: 'jig rten na lus ni sems kyis len par grags kyi bdag gis len par ma grags pa dang / bdag ni rtag pa yin pas rtag pa la ni lus len pa dang mi len pa gnyis su mi rigs la /
translated: In the world, the body is known to be appropriated by the mind, not by the self. And it is not logical for the permanent self to appropriate or not appropriate a body.

original: bdag de lus len pa dang mi len pa gnyis byed na ni mi len pa las len pa'i mtshan nyid du gzhan du gyur pas rtag par mi rung ste /üîΩde bas na bdag gis @113a * //
analyzed: bdag de lus len pa dang mi len pa gnyis byed na ni mi len pa las len pa'i mtshan nyid du gzhan du gyur pas rtag par mi rung ste / de bas na bdag gis @113a * //
translated: If that self both appropriated and did not appropriate a body, it would be illogical for it to be permanent, since it would have changed from not appropriating to appropriating a body.

original: lus len par mi rigs so //
analyzed: lus len par mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore it is illogical for the self to appropriate a body.

original: sems kyis lus len pa yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la tshe rabs snga ma'i 'du byed kyi bag chags bsags pas bag chags de'i rgyus ma'i mngal du khu ba dang khrag gi nang du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa brgyal ba'i dus na sems des lus
analyzed: sems kyis lus len pa yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la tshe rabs snga ma'i 'du byed kyi bag chags bsags pas bag chags de'i rgyus ma'i mngal du khu ba dang khrag gi nang du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa brgyal ba'i dus na sems des lus
translated: Also, the mind that appropriates the body is the foundation consciousness, because the latent tendencies of formative factors from previous lives are accumulated in the foundation consciousness. Due to the cause of those latent tendencies, when the foundation consciousness faints within the semen and blood in the mother‚Äôs womb, the mindüîΩappropriates the body.

original: blangs te / kun gzhi'i mthus ming dang gzugs yod par byas nas sems de nyid kyis nam ma shi ba'i bar du len cing 'dzin par byed pas na len pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya bar 'dod do //üîΩkun gzhis lus len gyi mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa lngas ni khrag dang khu ba'i tshe lus len par mi byed la rnam par shes pa lnga'i rjes las byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pas kyang ma'i mngal du khrag dang khu ba'i tshe lus
analyzed: blangs te / kun gzhi'i mthus ming dang gzugs yod par byas nas sems de nyid kyis nam ma shi ba'i bar du len cing 'dzin par byed pas na len pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya bar 'dod do // kun gzhis lus len gyi mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa lngas ni khrag dang khu ba'i tshe lus len par mi byed la rnam par shes pa lnga'i rjes las byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pas kyang ma'i mngal du khrag dang khu ba'i tshe lus
translated: Through the power of the foundation consciousness, name and form are made to exist and that mind itself appropriates and holds the body until death. Therefore it is asserted that it is called the appropriating consciousness.

original: len par mi byed do //
analyzed: len par mi byed do //
translated: The body is appropriated by the foundation consciousness, but the five sense consciousnesses such as the eye consciousness do not appropriate the body at the time of semen and blood. Nor does the mental consciousness that arises after the five sense consciousnesses appropriate the body at the time of semen and blood in the mother‚Äôs womb.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa ni /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa ni /
translated: The eye consciousness and so onüîΩdo not exist at the time of the mother‚Äôs blood and semen in the womb.üîΩAfter the time of the mother‚Äôs blood and semen in the womb has passed, the eye consciousnesses and so on arise from the womb when they encounter their individual conditions.

original: ma'i mngal du khrag dang khu ba'i dus na med kyi khrag dang khu ba'i ma'i mngal gyi dus 'das nas mngal nas byung ba dang / gdod so so'i rkyen dang phrad nas mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams 'byung bas na mngal gyi tshe na de dag med pa'i phyir lus mi len to //
analyzed: ma'i mngal du khrag dang khu ba'i dus na med kyi khrag dang khu ba'i ma'i mngal gyi dus 'das nas mngal nas byung ba dang / gdod so so'i rkyen dang phrad nas mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams 'byung bas na mngal gyi tshe na de dag med pa'i phyir lus mi len to //
translated: Therefore, since they do not exist at the time of the womb, they do not appropriate the body.

original: de'i rjes las byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang rkyen gyi mthu las skye ste /
analyzed: de'i rjes las byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang rkyen gyi mthu las skye ste /
translated: The mental consciousness that arises after that also arises from the power of conditions.üîΩSince it arises after the eye consciousness, it does not exist at the time of the mother‚Äôs womb.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rjes las byung bas na ma'i mngal gyi tshe na ni med kyi phyis gdod 'byung bas na lus mi len to //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rjes las byung bas na ma'i mngal gyi tshe na ni med kyi phyis gdod 'byung bas na lus mi len to //
translated: Since it arises later, it does not appropriate the body.

original: gzhan dag gis brgal ba la /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis brgal ba la /
translated: Others argue:

original: bden te khrag dang khu ba'i dus na mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa ni med de /
analyzed: bden te khrag dang khu ba'i dus na mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa ni med de /
translated: It is true that the eye consciousness and so on do not exist at the time of the mother‚Äôs blood and semen.

original: de dag so so'i rkyen las skye ba yin pas na lus mi len kyang de dag las ma gtogs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa rnam par smin pa'i rang bzhin 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis byung ba de ni 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes paüîΩzhes bya ba de la bya bas des khrag dang khu ba'i dus na lus len to zhes bya ba'i lan du /
analyzed: de dag so so'i rkyen las skye ba yin pas na lus mi len kyang de dag las ma gtogs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa rnam par smin pa'i rang bzhin 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis byung ba de ni 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba de la bya bas des khrag dang khu ba'i dus na lus len to zhes bya ba'i lan du /
translated: Apart from those, there is no mental consciousness that is by nature the ripening of karma and arises due to the condition of karmic formation.üîΩThis is the response to the question, ‚ÄúWhat is consciousness due to the condition of karmic formation?‚Äù

original: 'di ltar mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa lnga dang / de'i rjes las byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa ma gtogs par gzhan rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis 'byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba khrag dang khu ba'i dus na lus len par
analyzed: 'di ltar mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa lnga dang / de'i rjes las byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa ma gtogs par gzhan rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis 'byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba khrag dang khu ba'i dus na lus len par
translated: Thus, apart from the five consciousnesses such as eye consciousness and the mental consciousness that arises after them, there is no other so-called ripening consciousness that arises due to the condition of karmic formation, no so-called mental consciousness that arises due to the condition of karmic formation that takes up a body at the time of blood and semen.

original: byed pa ni cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te de med do //
analyzed: byed pa ni cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te de med do //
translated: It does not exist in the slightest.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar mig la sogs @113b pa'i rjes las byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa las ma gtogs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa yod na /üîΩyang na ni dge ba'i rang bzhin zhig yin /üîΩyang na ni mi dge ba'i rang bzhin zhig yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar mig la sogs @113b pa'i rjes las byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa las ma gtogs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa yod na / yang na ni dge ba'i rang bzhin zhig yin / yang na ni mi dge ba'i rang bzhin zhig yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, apart from the mental consciousness that arises after the eye consciousness and so on, there is no mental consciousness.

original: gal te gzhan na re /
analyzed: gal te gzhan na re /
translated: If it did exist,üîΩit would be either virtuous or nonvirtuous.üîΩIf you say that the mental faculty is virtuous or nonvirtuous,

original: yid de dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rang bzhin yin na ni nyes snyam pa dang / de lta na ni mi rung ste /
analyzed: yid de dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rang bzhin yin na ni nyes snyam pa dang / de lta na ni mi rung ste /
translated: then that is not correct.

original: 'di ltar 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis byung ba'i rnam par shes pa de rtag tu rnam par smin pa'i rang bzhin yin pas gcig tu lung du ma bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis byung ba'i rnam par shes pa de rtag tu rnam par smin pa'i rang bzhin yin pas gcig tu lung du ma bstan pa yin la /
translated: Because consciousness that arises due to the condition of formation is always the nature of karmic maturation, it is neutral.

original: rnam par shes pa drug las ma gtogs pa'i yid de ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i rang bzhin du mi rung bas de la 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa drug las ma gtogs pa'i yid de ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i rang bzhin du mi rung bas de la 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya bar mi rung ngo //
translated: But that mind which is not included among the six consciousnesses is not suitable as the nature of karmic maturation because it is the nature of virtue and nonvirtue. Therefore, it is not suitable to say that consciousness is conditioned by karmic formation.

original: de bas na des khrag dang khu ba'i dus na lus len par yang mi rigs so //
analyzed: de bas na des khrag dang khu ba'i dus na lus len par yang mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore it is not reasonable that it takes up a body at the time of blood and semen.

original: gzhan yang khyed kyi lta ba ltar na sems can thams cad ni sems kyi rgyud gcig ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang khyed kyi lta ba ltar na sems can thams cad ni sems kyi rgyud gcig ste /
translated: Moreover, according to your view, the mindstreams of all sentient beings are one.

original: de bas na rnam par shes pa drug gi tshogs kyang rim gyis 'byung gi cig car mi 'byung ngo zhes lta'o //
analyzed: de bas na rnam par shes pa drug gi tshogs kyang rim gyis 'byung gi cig car mi 'byung ngo zhes lta'o //
translated: Therefore, the collection of six consciousnesses also arises gradually and not simultaneously.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: This is so.

original: gang gi tshe dge ba'i ngo bo'i rnam par shes pa byung ba de'i tshe mi dge ba'i ngo bo'i rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ba gang gi tshe mi dge ba'i chos ngo bo'i rnam par shes pa byung ba de'i tshe dge ba'i ngo bo dang /
analyzed: gang gi tshe dge ba'i ngo bo'i rnam par shes pa byung ba de'i tshe mi dge ba'i ngo bo'i rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ba gang gi tshe mi dge ba'i chos ngo bo'i rnam par shes pa byung ba de'i tshe dge ba'i ngo bo dang /
translated: When a virtuous consciousness arises, an unvirtuous consciousness does not arise.üîΩWhen a virtuous consciousness arises, an unvirtuous consciousness does not arise.

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i ngo bo'i rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i ngo bo'i rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ste /
translated: When a neutral consciousness arises, a virtuous or nonvirtuous consciousness does not arise.

original: de dag rim gyis 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de dag rim gyis 'byung ngo //
translated: They arise in sequence.

original: de la gang rnam par smin pa'i rang bzhin de dag ni lan cig chad nas slar mtshams mi sbyor te /
analyzed: de la gang rnam par smin pa'i rang bzhin de dag ni lan cig chad nas slar mtshams mi sbyor te /
translated: Among them, those that are the nature of karmic maturation are severed once and do not reconnect again.

original: dper na mig gi dbang po 'di dag rnam par smin pa'i rang bzhin yin pas na lan cig chad pa dang / phyis mi 'byung ba bzhin du gal te 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug las ma gtogs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba rnam par smin pa'i rang bzhin yod na rnam par smin pa'i rang bzhin de chad nas 'byung ba'i skyon du 'gyur te
analyzed: dper na mig gi dbang po 'di dag rnam par smin pa'i rang bzhin yin pas na lan cig chad pa dang / phyis mi 'byung ba bzhin du gal te 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug las ma gtogs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba rnam par smin pa'i rang bzhin yod na rnam par smin pa'i rang bzhin de chad nas 'byung ba'i skyon du 'gyur te
translated: If a mental consciousness that is not one of the six active consciousnesses exists and is by nature karmic maturation, then the error arises that the nature of karmic maturation would be severed and then occur again.

original: / ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩrnam par shes pa de dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rang bzhin du khas blangs pas nam dge ba byung ba'i tshe na mi dge ba'i sems ma byung la mi dge ba'i tshe na dge ba'i sems ma byung ste /
analyzed: / ci'i phyir zhe na / rnam par shes pa de dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rang bzhin du khas blangs pas nam dge ba byung ba'i tshe na mi dge ba'i sems ma byung la mi dge ba'i tshe na dge ba'i sems ma byung ste /
translated: Why?üîΩBecause it is asserted that consciousness is by nature virtuous or nonvirtuous. When a virtuous mind occurs, a nonvirtuous mind does not occur and when a nonvirtuous mind occurs, a virtuous mind does not occur.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i sems kyang mi dge ba'i sems sngar 'byung ba 'gags te chad nas gdod dge ba'i sems 'byung ba'i rnam par smin pa la chad pa yod pa'i @114a * //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i sems kyang mi dge ba'i sems sngar 'byung ba 'gags te chad nas gdod dge ba'i sems 'byung ba'i rnam par smin pa la chad pa yod pa'i @114a * //
translated: Also, when a virtuous or nonvirtuous mind occurs, a nonvirtuous mind that occurred previously is severed and then a virtuous mind occurs.

original: skyon du 'gyur bas mi rigs so //
analyzed: skyon du 'gyur bas mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable to posit a mental consciousness apart from the store consciousness.

original: de bas na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las ma gtogs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa rnam par smin ba'i rang bzhin dang / gcig tu lung ma bstan pa'i mtshan nyid ni yod pa ma yin te med do //
analyzed: de bas na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las ma gtogs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa rnam par smin ba'i rang bzhin dang / gcig tu lung ma bstan pa'i mtshan nyid ni yod pa ma yin te med do //
translated: Thus, there is no mental consciousness apart from the store consciousness that has the nature of being the result of evolution and is always morally indeterminate.

original: de la lan pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni lus thams cad khyab par len pa la de'ang rgyun mi 'chad par lus len pa la len pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya na /üîΩ'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug gi chogs rnams ni gnas so sor nges par 'jug ste /
analyzed: de la lan pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni lus thams cad khyab par len pa la de'ang rgyun mi 'chad par lus len pa la len pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya na / 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug gi chogs rnams ni gnas so sor nges par 'jug ste /
translated: The so-called appropriating consciousness is so called because it appropriates the body and pervades the whole body.

original: lus kun la khyab par mi 'jug pa dang / rtag tu lus mi len gyi rgyun 'chad nas 'jug pa'i phyir lus thams cad la len pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lus kun la khyab par mi 'jug pa dang / rtag tu lus mi len gyi rgyun 'chad nas 'jug pa'i phyir lus thams cad la len pa ma yin no //
translated: The six consciousnesses, such as visual consciousness, are not appropriating consciousnesses because they do not pervade the whole body, because they do not always appropriate the body, and because they are interrupted.

original: ji ltar gnas so sor nges par 'jug ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar gnas so sor nges par 'jug ce na /
translated: How are they interrupted?

original: mig gi rnam par shes pas kyang mig gi dbang po'i gnas 'ba' zhig blangs kyi /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pas kyang mig gi dbang po'i gnas 'ba' zhig blangs kyi /
translated: The eye consciousness takes up only the location of the eye faculty,

original: gnas gzhan ma blangs pa nas /
analyzed: gnas gzhan ma blangs pa nas /
translated: but it does not take up other locations.

original: lus kyi rnam par shes pas kyang gang du reg bya 'byung ba'i lus de nyid tshe blangs kyi /
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par shes pas kyang gang du reg bya 'byung ba'i lus de nyid tshe blangs kyi /
translated: The body consciousness takes up only the body where tactile objects occur,

original: gzhan ma blangs pas na lus kun len pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ma blangs pas na lus kun len pa ma yin no //
translated: but it does not take up other locations. Therefore it does not always take up the body.üîΩThe consciousnesses engage intermittently because the eye consciousness arises from the foundation consciousness and then its continuum is severed. Only then does the nose consciousness arise.

original: rgyun chad nas 'jug pa ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams las mig gi rnam par shes pa skyes nas de'i rgyun chad de gdod sna'i rnam par shes pa skye ba dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa skyes nas chad de gdod mig gi rnam par shes pa skye bas na rtag tu lus len pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyun chad nas 'jug pa ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams las mig gi rnam par shes pa skyes nas de'i rgyun chad de gdod sna'i rnam par shes pa skye ba dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa skyes nas chad de gdod mig gi rnam par shes pa skye bas na rtag tu lus len pa ma yin no //
translated: The nose consciousness arises and then is severed. Only then does the eye consciousness arise. Therefore it does not always take up the body.

original: gzhan yang sems med pa'i gnyid dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa'i dus na 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams ril gyis 'gags pas de'i tshe lus ma blangs pas rtag tu lus len pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang sems med pa'i gnyid dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa'i dus na 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams ril gyis 'gags pas de'i tshe lus ma blangs pas rtag tu lus len pa ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, the foundation consciousness always takes up the body because the active forms of consciousness are completely severed at times when the mind is absent, such as when one is unconscious or in deep sleep. Therefore it does not always take up the body.

original: de lta bas na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni ma'i mngal du nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe ming dang gzugs kyi mtshan nyid kyi lus blangs nas nam ma shi'i bar du lus len cing 'dzin par byed pas na len pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni ma'i mngal du nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe ming dang gzugs kyi mtshan nyid kyi lus blangs nas nam ma shi'i bar du lus len cing 'dzin par byed pas na len pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the store consciousness is called the appropriating consciousness because it appropriates and holds the body characterized by name and form from the time of reentry into the womb until death.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the store consciousness is complete.

original: // / da ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid bshad par brtsams te ;
analyzed: // / da ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid bshad par brtsams te ;
translated: Now the defiled mind is to be explained.

original: de bas na de bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na de bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is explained.

original: gal te 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug las ma gtogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i yid ces bya ba yod na dmigs pa'i yul med pa'i rnam par shes pas ni mi srid pas nyon mongs pas yid de ci la dmigs pa bstan pa dang / gong du sems zhes bya ba @114b dngos su 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams la mi bya'i dngos su kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la sems zhes bya ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: gal te 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug las ma gtogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i yid ces bya ba yod na dmigs pa'i yul med pa'i rnam par shes pas ni mi srid pas nyon mongs pas yid de ci la dmigs pa bstan pa dang / gong du sems zhes bya ba @114b dngos su 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams la mi bya'i dngos su kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la sems zhes bya ba de bzhin du /
translated: If there were a so-called afflicted mind that is not included among the six active consciousnesses, it would be impossible for it to be a consciousness without an objective support.üîΩTherefore, it is explained that the afflicted mind has an objective support, and that the term mind in the above passage does not refer to the active consciousnesses but to the foundation consciousness.üîΩIn the same way, here the term mind does not refer to the six active consciousnesses that have ceased but to the afflicted mind.

original: 'dir yang dngos su yid ces bya ba rnam par shes pa snga ma 'gags pa drug po la mi bya'i yid ces bya ba yang dngos su nyon mongs pa'i yid la bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩdngos su na yid ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos su yid ces bya ba rnam par shes pa snga ma 'gags pa drug po la mi bya'i yid ces bya ba yang dngos su nyon mongs pa'i yid la bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩdngos su na yid ces bya ba smos te /
translated: To explain this, the root text says, ‚ÄúThe afflicted mind is the consciousness called mind.‚Äù

original: dngos sam gtso na nyon mongs pa'i yid la yid ces bya ba'i rnam par shes pa snga ma 'gags pa drug po la ni dngos su ni yid ces mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos sam gtso na nyon mongs pa'i yid la yid ces bya ba'i rnam par shes pa snga ma 'gags pa drug po la ni dngos su ni yid ces mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If it is asked what is the mind that is the support of the mental factors, it is the afflicted mind.üîΩIf it is asked what is the mind that is the support of the six consciousnesses, it is the mental consciousness.üîΩIf it is asked what is the mind that is the support of the afflicted mind, it is the foundation consciousness.üîΩIf it is asked what is the mind that is the support of the foundation consciousness, it is the mental consciousness.

original: nyon mongs pa'i yid de ci la dmigs she na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i yid de ci la dmigs she na /
translated: If it is asked what is the mind that is the support of the mental consciousness, it is the foundation consciousness.üîΩThus, the foundation consciousness is the support of the mental consciousness.

original: de'i phyir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la dmigs te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la dmigs te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The mental consciousness is the support of the foundation consciousness.üîΩThe afflicted mind is the support of the mental consciousness.üîΩThe six consciousnesses are the support of the afflicted mind.üîΩThe afflicted mind is the support of the six consciousnesses.

original: nyon mongs pa'i yid ni rtag tu kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la dmigs te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i yid ni rtag tu kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la dmigs te /
translated: The mental consciousness is the support of the afflicted mind.üîΩThe foundation consciousness is the support of the mental consciousness.

original: de bas na de yul ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yin no //üîΩnyon mongs pa'i yid kun gzhi la ji ltar dmigs she na /
analyzed: de bas na de yul ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yin no // nyon mongs pa'i yid kun gzhi la ji ltar dmigs she na /
translated: The mental consciousness is the support of the foundation consciousness.üîΩThe six consciousnesses are the support of the afflicted mind.üîΩThe afflicted mind is the support of the six consciousnesses.üîΩThe mental consciousness is the support of the afflicted mind.üîΩThe foundation consciousness is the support of the mental consciousness.

original: nyon mongs pa'i yid des kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la bdag ces bya ba ni 'di yin no zhes kun gzhi la bdag tu dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i yid des kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la bdag ces bya ba ni 'di yin no zhes kun gzhi la bdag tu dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mental consciousness is the support of the foundation consciousness.üîΩThe six consciousnesses are the support of the afflicted mind.üîΩThe afflicted mind is the support of the six consciousnesses.üîΩThe mental consciousness is the support of the afflicted mind.üîΩThe foundation consciousness is the support of the mental consciousness.üîΩThe mental consciousness is the support of the foundation consciousness.üîΩThe six consciousnesses are the support of the afflicted mind.üîΩThe afflicted mind is the support of the six consciousnesses.üîΩThe mental consciousness is the support of the afflicted mind.üîΩThe foundation consciousness is the support of the mental consciousness.üîΩThe mental consciousness is the support of the foundation consciousness.üîΩThe six consciousnesses are the support of the afflicted mind.üîΩThe afflicted mind is the support of the six consciousnesses.üîΩThe mental consciousness is the support of the afflicted mind.üîΩThe foundation consciousness is the support of the mental consciousness.üîΩThe mental consciousness is the support of the foundation consciousness.üîΩThe six consciousnesses are the support of the afflicted mind.üîΩThe afflicted mind is the support of the six consciousnesses.üîΩThe mental consciousness is the support of the afflicted mind.üîΩThe foundation consciousness is the

original: yang na nyon mongs pa'i yid de yul gzhan na yang dmigs mod kyi yul gzhan pas kun gzhi la gcor bdag tu dmigs pas dngos su na yid ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la dmigs te zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na nyon mongs pa'i yid de yul gzhan na yang dmigs mod kyi yul gzhan pas kun gzhi la gcor bdag tu dmigs pas dngos su na yid ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la dmigs te zhes bya'o //
translated: Or, although that afflicted mind also observes other objects, it is said that the mind directly observes the foundation consciousness as a self, since it observes the foundation consciousness as a self through other objects.

original: nyon mongs pa'i yid de ci'i phyir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la bdag tu dmigs pa bstan pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i yid de sems yin na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i yid de ci'i phyir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la bdag tu dmigs pa bstan pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i yid de sems yin na /
translated: Why is it that the afflicted mind observes the foundation consciousness as a self?

original: sems las byung ba'i chos dang mi ldan pa'i sems yod mi srid pas nyon mongs pa'i yid de sems las byung ba du dang ldan pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sems las byung ba'i chos dang mi ldan pa'i sems yod mi srid pas nyon mongs pa'i yid de sems las byung ba du dang ldan pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Since it is impossible for a mind to exist that is not associated with mental factors, the root text states that the afflicted mind is associated with a number of mental factors.

original: rtag tu bdag tu gti mug pa dang / bdag tu lta ba dang / bdag tu nga rgyal ba dang / bdag la chags pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rtag tu bdag tu gti mug pa dang / bdag tu lta ba dang / bdag tu nga rgyal ba dang / bdag la chags pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is always associated with four mental factors: delusion regarding a self, the view of a self, pride in a self, and attachment to a self.

original: nyon mongs pa'i yid de rtag tu sems las byung bas nyon mongs pa can bdag tu gti mug pa dang / bdag tu lta ba dang / bdag tu nga rgyal ba dang / bdag la chags pa ste sems las byung ba bzhi dang ldan pas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la bdag ni 'di yin no snyam du dmigs so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i yid de rtag tu sems las byung bas nyon mongs pa can bdag tu gti mug pa dang / bdag tu lta ba dang / bdag tu nga rgyal ba dang / bdag la chags pa ste sems las byung ba bzhi dang ldan pas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la bdag ni 'di yin no snyam du dmigs so //
translated: The afflicted mind is always associated with four mental factors: afflicted view of self, conceit based on self, attachment to self, and delusion about self. Therefore, it focuses on the storehouse consciousness and thinks, ‚ÄúThis is my self.‚Äù

original: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni ji srid du dgra bcom pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i dus las ma gtogs pa dge ba dang mi dge ba dang @115a * //
analyzed: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni ji srid du dgra bcom pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i dus las ma gtogs pa dge ba dang mi dge ba dang @115a * //
translated: It is always associated with these four mental factors, except when one is an arhat, or on the noble path, or in the attainment of cessation.

original: lung du ma bstan par byed pa'i dus dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa pa dang / sems med pa'i gnyid dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa'i tshe dus thams cad du kun gzhi la bdag tu lta zhing dmigs pa rgyun mchad par byed pas na rtag tu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan par byed pa'i dus dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa pa dang / sems med pa'i gnyid dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa'i tshe dus thams cad du kun gzhi la bdag tu lta zhing dmigs pa rgyun mchad par byed pas na rtag tu zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúconstant‚Äù because it always views and observes the self in the foundation consciousness, even when one is in a neutral state, when one is in the meditative absorption of nonperception, when one is in the state of nonperception, when one is in mindless sleep or fainting, and so on.

original: de ltar na nyon mongs pa'i yid rtag tu nga dang bdag go zhes rlom sems pa'i rang bzhin yin pas na dngos su na de la yid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na nyon mongs pa'i yid rtag tu nga dang bdag go zhes rlom sems pa'i rang bzhin yin pas na dngos su na de la yid ces bya'o //
translated: Thus the afflicted mind is called ‚Äúmind‚Äù in the sense that it is the nature of the conceit ‚ÄúI am‚Äù and the self.

original: gzhan dag gis smras pa /üîΩde ltar dngos su na nyon mongs pa'i yid la yid ces bya na rnam par shes pa drug po 'gags ma thag pa de la don gang gis na yid ces bya zhes bya ba'i lan du /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis smras pa / de ltar dngos su na nyon mongs pa'i yid la yid ces bya na rnam par shes pa drug po 'gags ma thag pa de la don gang gis na yid ces bya zhes bya ba'i lan du /
translated: Others ask,

original: gang yang mig gi rnam par shes pa nas /
analyzed: gang yang mig gi rnam par shes pa nas /
translated: ‚ÄúIf the afflicted mind is called ‚Äòmind‚Äô in this sense, then what is the meaning of ‚Äòmind‚Äô in the statement ‚ÄòThe mind that has just ceased is the immediately preceding condition of the six consciousnesses‚Äô?‚ÄùüîΩThe answer to this is that the mind is the mental faculty.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du drug po 'gags ma thag pa la yid ces bya ba yang mig nas lus kyi bar du rnam par shes pa lnga'i rten ni mig gi dbang po nas lus kyi dbang po'i bar du lnga yin par grags na /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du drug po 'gags ma thag pa la yid ces bya ba yang mig nas lus kyi bar du rnam par shes pa lnga'i rten ni mig gi dbang po nas lus kyi dbang po'i bar du lnga yin par grags na /
translated: The five sense faculties from the eye faculty up to the body faculty are well known as the supports or faculties of the five consciousnesses from eye consciousness up to body consciousness.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten tam dbang po ma grags pas de'i rten grags par bya ba'i phyir rnam par shes pa drug po snga ma 'gags pa la yid ces bya bar btags par zad de /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten tam dbang po ma grags pas de'i rten grags par bya ba'i phyir rnam par shes pa drug po snga ma 'gags pa la yid ces bya bar btags par zad de /
translated: But the support or faculty of mental consciousness is not well known, so in order to make it well known, the former ceased sixth consciousness is designated as mind manas.

original: gang dag dang bdag gir rlom sems pa de la dngos su yid ces bya bas rnam par shes pa snga ma 'gags pa ni bdag dang bdag gir rlom sems pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pas dngos su de la yid ces mi bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag dang bdag gir rlom sems pa de la dngos su yid ces bya bas rnam par shes pa snga ma 'gags pa ni bdag dang bdag gir rlom sems pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pas dngos su de la yid ces mi bya'o //
translated: Since the former ceased consciousness is not by nature the conceit of I and mine, it is not actually called mind.

original: de la kun gzhi bdag med pa la bdag med par khong du ma chud pa ni bdag tu gti mug pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la kun gzhi bdag med pa la bdag med par khong du ma chud pa ni bdag tu gti mug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Not understanding the selflessness of the foundation consciousness to be the selflessness of all phenomena is called delusion about the self.

original: de ltar bdag med par khong du ma chud pas kun gzhi la brtag pa ni 'di yin no snyam du 'dzin pa ni bdag tu lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bdag med par khong du ma chud pas kun gzhi la brtag pa ni 'di yin no snyam du 'dzin pa ni bdag tu lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the apprehension that the foundation consciousness is the self, which is due to the non-comprehension of selflessness, is called the view of self.

original: bdag tu bltas pa'i rgyu des sems mtho ba dang khengs par gyur pa ni bdag tu nga rgyal ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag tu bltas pa'i rgyu des sems mtho ba dang khengs par gyur pa ni bdag tu nga rgyal ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The cause of the view of self is the pride of self, which is the inflated and haughty state of mind that occurs due to the view of self.

original: bdag tu gti mug pa dang / bdag tu lta ba dang / bdag tu nga rgyal ba gsum las /
analyzed: bdag tu gti mug pa dang / bdag tu lta ba dang / bdag tu nga rgyal ba gsum las /
translated: From among the three‚Äîthe delusion of self, the view of self, and the pride of self‚Äî

original: bdag de la chags shing phangs par 'dzin pa ni bdag la chags pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bdag de la chags shing phangs par 'dzin pa ni bdag la chags pa zhes bya ste /
translated: the attachment to the self is called the attachment to the self, which is the desire and affection for that self.

original: nyon mongs pa'i yid de sems las byung ba'i nyon mongs pa can bzhi dang ldan no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i yid de sems las byung ba'i nyon mongs pa can bzhi dang ldan no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The afflicted mind is associated with four afflicted mental states.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni sems las byung ba bzhi po de 'ba' zhig 'byung bar ma zad kyi rig pa dang yid la byed pa la sogs pa lnga kun tu @115b 'gro ba yang ldan par ston to //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni sems las byung ba bzhi po de 'ba' zhig 'byung bar ma zad kyi rig pa dang yid la byed pa la sogs pa lnga kun tu @115b 'gro ba yang ldan par ston to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù indicates that not only do these four mental states occur, but also that it is associated with the five omnipresent mental states of feeling, contact, conceptualization, volition, and attention.

original: de bas na nyon mongs pa'i yid de sems las 'byung ba'i nyon mongs pa can bzhi dang / lnga kun tu 'gro bas bsnan te sems las byung bas dgu dang ldan no //
analyzed: de bas na nyon mongs pa'i yid de sems las 'byung ba'i nyon mongs pa can bzhi dang / lnga kun tu 'gro bas bsnan te sems las byung bas dgu dang ldan no //
translated: Therefore, the afflicted mental consciousness is associated with nine mental factors: four afflicted mental factors and five omnipresent mental factors.

original: nyon mongs pa'i yid de yod par nyan thos rnam par smra ba pa rnams la ma grags te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i yid de yod par nyan thos rnam par smra ba pa rnams la ma grags te /
translated: The afflicted mental consciousness is not well known to the ≈õrƒÅvakas who are proponents of consciousness.

original: de bas na de dag la yod do zhes bstan pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i yid de yang sems kyi rang bzhin gyi yin gyi sems las byung ba'i rang bzhi na ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na de dag la yod do zhes bstan pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i yid de yang sems kyi rang bzhin gyi yin gyi sems las byung ba'i rang bzhi na ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, the root text states, ‚Äúconsciousness,‚Äù in order to demonstrate that it exists and to demonstrate that the afflicted mental consciousness is of the nature of mind and not of the nature of mental factors.

original: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The root text states, ‚Äúconsciousness.‚Äù

original: nyon mongs pa'i yid de rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin yin pas sems kyi rang bzhin yin gyi sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i yid de rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin yin pas sems kyi rang bzhin yin gyi sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of this is that the afflicted mental consciousness is of the nature of consciousness and therefore of the nature of mind and not of the nature of mental factors.

original: nyon mongs pa'i yid de sems kyi rang bzhin yin na chos rnam pa bzhi la dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa las chos de bzhi gang gi rang bzhin yin zhe na ;
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i yid de sems kyi rang bzhin yin na chos rnam pa bzhi la dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa las chos de bzhi gang gi rang bzhin yin zhe na ;
translated: If that afflicted mind is the nature of mind, then from among the four dharmas‚Äîvirtuous, nonvirtuous, unobscured neutral, and obscured neutral‚Äîwhat is its nature?

original: de'i phyir / rigs gcig pa dang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / rigs gcig pa dang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said, ‚ÄúIt is of one type.‚Äù

original: chos rnam pa bzhi las nyon mongs pa'i yid de ni bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i rang bzhin yin gyi dge ba'i rang bzhin yang ma yin /
analyzed: chos rnam pa bzhi las nyon mongs pa'i yid de ni bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i rang bzhin yin gyi dge ba'i rang bzhin yang ma yin /
translated: From among the four dharmas, that afflicted mind is of the nature of obscured neutral, not virtuous,

original: mi dge ba'i rang bzhin yang ma yin /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i rang bzhin yang ma yin /
translated: not nonvirtuous,

original: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i rang bzhin yang ma yin pas rigs gcig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i rang bzhin yang ma yin pas rigs gcig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and not unobscured neutral.

original: nyon mongs pa'i yid de bdag tu gti mug pa la sogs pa sems las byung ba nyon mongs pa can bzhi dang ldan pas na bsgribs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i yid de bdag tu gti mug pa la sogs pa sems las byung ba nyon mongs pa can bzhi dang ldan pas na bsgribs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That afflicted mind is said to be obscured because it is concomitant with the four afflicted mental factors of delusion regarding the self and so on.

original: dge ba'i rang bzhin yang ma yin mi dge ba'i rang bzhin yang ma yin pas na lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rang bzhin yang ma yin mi dge ba'i rang bzhin yang ma yin pas na lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it is neither virtuous nor nonvirtuous by nature, it is called indeterminate.

original: ci'i phyir dge ba dang mi dge pa'i rang bzhin ma yin zhe na /üîΩgal te nyon mongs pa'i yid de dge ba'i rang bzhin zhig yin par gyur na ni mi dge ba'i rang bzhin byed pa rnams la dge ba med pas nga mi dge ba byed do snyam du ngar 'dzin pa'i nyon mongs pa'i yid de med par 'gyur ba'i rigs
analyzed: ci'i phyir dge ba dang mi dge pa'i rang bzhin ma yin zhe na / gal te nyon mongs pa'i yid de dge ba'i rang bzhin zhig yin par gyur na ni mi dge ba'i rang bzhin byed pa rnams la dge ba med pas nga mi dge ba byed do snyam du ngar 'dzin pa'i nyon mongs pa'i yid de med par 'gyur ba'i rigs
translated: Why is it neither virtuous nor nonvirtuous by nature?üîΩIf the afflicted mind were virtuous by nature, then those who engage in nonvirtuous actions would not have nonvirtue, and it would be logical that the afflicted mind that thinks I am engaging in nonvirtue would not exist.

original: na / mi dge ba byed pa rnams la yang nga mi dge ba byed do snyam du 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin yod pas na nyon mongs pa'i yid de dge ba'i rang bzhin yang ma yin no //
analyzed: na / mi dge ba byed pa rnams la yang nga mi dge ba byed do snyam du 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin yod pas na nyon mongs pa'i yid de dge ba'i rang bzhin yang ma yin no //
translated: However, since those who engage in nonvirtuous actions have the thought I am engaging in nonvirtue, the afflicted mind is not virtuous by nature.

original: gal te nyon mongs pa'i yid de mi dge ba'i rang bzhin yin na ni dge ba byed pa rnams la mi dge ba byed pas nyon mongs pa'i yid med pa'i phyir bdag dge @116a * //
analyzed: gal te nyon mongs pa'i yid de mi dge ba'i rang bzhin yin na ni dge ba byed pa rnams la mi dge ba byed pas nyon mongs pa'i yid med pa'i phyir bdag dge @116a * //
translated: If that afflicted mind is by nature nonvirtuous, then when those who perform virtuous actions are performing virtuous actions, they would not have an afflicted mind, because they are performing virtuous actions, not nonvirtuous actions.

original: ba spyod do snyam du bdag tu sems pa med pa'i rigs na /
analyzed: ba spyod do snyam du bdag tu sems pa med pa'i rigs na /
translated: If that were so, it would be logical that they would not think i am performing virtuous actions, because they would not have a mind that thinks i.

original: dge ba byed pa rnams kyang bdag dge ba byed do snyam du bdag tu 'dzin pa yod pas nyon mongs pa'i yid de mi dag ba'i rang bzhin yang ma yin no //
analyzed: dge ba byed pa rnams kyang bdag dge ba byed do snyam du bdag tu 'dzin pa yod pas nyon mongs pa'i yid de mi dag ba'i rang bzhin yang ma yin no //
translated: But since those who perform virtuous actions do think i am performing virtuous actions, the afflicted mind is not by nature nonvirtuous.

original: yang na nyon mongs pa'i yid de nyon mongs par rigs gcig par yin gyi dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / ma bsgribs la lung du mi ston pa'i rang bzhin ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na nyon mongs pa'i yid de nyon mongs par rigs gcig par yin gyi dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / ma bsgribs la lung du mi ston pa'i rang bzhin ni ma yin te /
translated: Or else, that afflicted mind is of the same class as the afflictions, but it is not by nature virtuous, nonvirtuous, or unobscured neutral.

original: ci'i phyir nyon mongs par rigs gcig ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir nyon mongs par rigs gcig ce na /
translated: Why is it of the same class as the afflictions?

original: rtag par bdag tu gti mug pa la sogs pa nyon mongs pa bzhi dang ldan pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa rigs gcig go //
analyzed: rtag par bdag tu gti mug pa la sogs pa nyon mongs pa bzhi dang ldan pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa rigs gcig go //
translated: It is of the same class as the afflictions because it is always concomitant with the four afflictions such as delusion about the self and so on.

original: smras pa / de ltar na nyon mongs pa'i yid de rtag gam mi rtag pa zhig yin snyam pa la /
analyzed: smras pa / de ltar na nyon mongs pa'i yid de rtag gam mi rtag pa zhig yin snyam pa la /
translated: Objection: In that case, is that afflicted mind permanent or impermanent?

original: rgyun tu 'jug pa ste zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rgyun tu 'jug pa ste zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Reply: It is said, ‚ÄúIt is continuous.‚Äù

original: skad cig ma'i rgyun gyis rgyun mi 'chad par 'jug pas rgyun du 'jug pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: skad cig ma'i rgyun gyis rgyun mi 'chad par 'jug pas rgyun du 'jug pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Since it engages in a continuum of moments without interruption, it is called continuous.

original: de ni mi rtag par bstan to //
analyzed: de ni mi rtag par bstan to //
translated: It is taught to be impermanent.

original: de ltar 'jug pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar 'jug pa bstan nas /
translated: Having taught its engagement,

original: de 'gog pa ston te /
analyzed: de 'gog pa ston te /
translated: its cessation is taught.

original: nyon mongs pa'i skad cig ma'i rgyun gyis rgyun mi 'chad par 'jug na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i skad cig ma'i rgyun gyis rgyun mi 'chad par 'jug na /
translated: If it engages in a continuum without interruption by the continuum of moments of affliction,

original: gang gi dus kyi tshe nyon mongs pa'i yid med par 'gyur snyam pa la /
analyzed: gang gi dus kyi tshe nyon mongs pa'i yid med par 'gyur snyam pa la /
translated: at what time does the afflicted mind become nonexistent?

original: de'i phyir dgra bcom pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i dus ma gtogs so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dgra bcom pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i dus ma gtogs so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said, ‚ÄúExcept for the time of arhats, the ƒÅrya path, and the meditative attainment of cessation.‚Äù

original: dgra bcom pas ni khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa'i chos kun ma lus par spangs pas nyon mongs pa'i yid kyang spangs pa'i phyir dgra bcom pa'i dus na nyon mongs pa'i yid med do //
analyzed: dgra bcom pas ni khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa'i chos kun ma lus par spangs pas nyon mongs pa'i yid kyang spangs pa'i phyir dgra bcom pa'i dus na nyon mongs pa'i yid med do //
translated: Since arhats have completely abandoned all phenomena of the mental afflictions of the three realms, they have also abandoned the afflicted mind.

original: 'phags pa'i lam ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med par bsgoms pa ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med par bsgoms pa ste /
translated: The ƒÅrya path is the meditation on the selflessness of persons and phenomena.

original: don dam par bsgom pa de bdag tu lta ba dang mi mthun pa yin la /
analyzed: don dam par bsgom pa de bdag tu lta ba dang mi mthun pa yin la /
translated: That meditation on the ultimate is incompatible with the view of self.

original: bdag tu lta ba'i gnyen po yin pas 'phags pa'i lam la snyoms par zhugs pa'i tshe nyon mongs pa'i yid med de /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba'i gnyen po yin pas 'phags pa'i lam la snyoms par zhugs pa'i tshe nyon mongs pa'i yid med de /
translated: Since it is the antidote to the view of self, the afflicted mind does not exist when one enters into meditative equipoise on the ƒÅrya path.

original: lam las langs nas ni nyon mongs pa'i yid kyang 'byung ngo //
analyzed: lam las langs nas ni nyon mongs pa'i yid kyang 'byung ngo //
translated: When one rises from the path, the afflicted mind also arises.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'phags pa slob pa'i gang zag rnams lam la snyoms par 'jug ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa slob pa'i gang zag rnams lam la snyoms par 'jug ste /
translated: ƒÄrya persons in training enter into meditative equipoise on the path.

original: slob pa rnams kyi ni nyon mongs pa kun ma lus par ma spangs pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i yid kyi bag chags kyang bag chags da dung ma byang bas langs pa'i tshe kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las kyang 'byung ngo //
analyzed: slob pa rnams kyi ni nyon mongs pa kun ma lus par ma spangs pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i yid kyi bag chags kyang bag chags da dung ma byang bas langs pa'i tshe kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las kyang 'byung ngo //
translated: Because learners have not abandoned all afflictions without exception, the latent tendencies of the afflicted mind are also not purified. Therefore, at the time of arising, it also arises from the foundation consciousness.

original: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i dus na ni nyon mongs pa'i @116b yid yod pas zhib ma yin gyi 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i dus na nyon mongs pa'i yid med pas tshes zhi ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i dus na ni nyon mongs pa'i @116b yid yod pas zhib ma yin gyi 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i dus na nyon mongs pa'i yid med pas tshes zhi ba zhes bya ste /
translated: At the time of the meditative attainment of nonperception, the afflicted mind exists, so it is not peaceful. But at the time of the meditative attainment of cessation, the afflicted mind does not exist, so it is called peaceful.

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa de ches zhi bar gyur pa'i phyir 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i dus na nyon mongs pa'i yid med do //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa de ches zhi bar gyur pa'i phyir 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i dus na nyon mongs pa'i yid med do //
translated: Because that meditative attainment of cessation is very peaceful, the afflicted mind does not exist at the time of the meditative attainment of cessation.

original: de gsum gyi dus las ma gtogs par dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i dus dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa pa dang / sems med pa'i gnyid dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa'i dus na rtag tu yod do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de gsum gyi dus las ma gtogs par dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i dus dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa pa dang / sems med pa'i gnyid dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa'i dus na rtag tu yod do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Except for the times of these three, it exists at all times of virtue, nonvirtue, and nonrevelation, and at times of the meditative attainment of nonperception, the state of nonperception, sleep without mind, fainting, and so on.

original: mdor na nyon mongs pa'i yid kyi skabs su don bzhi sa bstan te /
analyzed: mdor na nyon mongs pa'i yid kyi skabs su don bzhi sa bstan te /
translated: In brief, four topics are explained in the context of afflicted intellect.

original: yid kyi nges pa'i tshig dang / dmigs pa dang / ldan pa dang / dus ji srid du yod pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyi nges pa'i tshig dang / dmigs pa dang / ldan pa dang / dus ji srid du yod pa'o //
translated: They are the definition of intellect, its focal object, its associates and the duration of its existence.

original: de la bdag dang bdag gir sems pa zhes bya bas yid kyi nges pa'i tshig bstan /
analyzed: de la bdag dang bdag gir sems pa zhes bya bas yid kyi nges pa'i tshig bstan /
translated: The definition of intellect is taught by the phrase ‚Äúthe mind that thinks of I and mine.‚Äù

original: kun gzhil dmigs pa zhes bya bas dmigs pa bstan /
analyzed: kun gzhil dmigs pa zhes bya bas dmigs pa bstan /
translated: Its focal object is taught by the phrase ‚Äúthe foundation consciousness is its object.‚Äù

original: sems las byung ba'i nyon mongs pa bzhi dang / lnga kun tu 'gro ba dang ldan pas zhes bya bas ldan pa bstan /
analyzed: sems las byung ba'i nyon mongs pa bzhi dang / lnga kun tu 'gro ba dang ldan pas zhes bya bas ldan pa bstan /
translated: Its associates are taught by the phrase ‚Äúit is associated with the four or five root afflictions that are omnipresent.‚Äù

original: dgra bcom pa la sogs pa'i dus gsum las ma gtogs par dus gzhan du 'jug ces bya bas dus ci srid du gnas pa bstan no //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa la sogs pa'i dus gsum las ma gtogs par dus gzhan du 'jug ces bya bas dus ci srid du gnas pa bstan no //
translated: The phrase it engages in other times apart from the three times of arhats and so on indicates how long it endures.

original: nyon mongs pa'i yid bstan pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i yid bstan pa rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the afflicted mind is complete.

original: // / gzugs la sogs pa la phung po zhes btags pa la phung po zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa yang /
analyzed: // / gzugs la sogs pa la phung po zhes btags pa la phung po zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa yang /
translated: The meaning of the term aggregate is taught in relation to the designation of form and so on as aggregates.

original: gong du gzugs la sogs pa ni je bshad kyi phung po'i don phyis bstan to zhes glengs pa de yang bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gong du gzugs la sogs pa ni je bshad kyi phung po'i don phyis bstan to zhes glengs pa de yang bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The above statement that the meaning of the term aggregate will be taught later is also taught here.

original: ci'i phyir phung po zhes bya zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir phung po zhes bya zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: Why are they called aggregates?

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos la ci'i phyir phung po zhes gdags zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos la ci'i phyir phung po zhes gdags zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the question is why are phenomena such as form designated as aggregates?

original: de'i lan du /
analyzed: de'i lan du /
translated: The answer is

original: spungs pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: spungs pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because they are heaps.

original: gang cung zad gzugs su bgrang ba 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba dang / nang gi dang / phyi'i dang / chen po dang / chung du dang / ngan pa dang / bzang po dang / nye ba dang /
analyzed: gang cung zad gzugs su bgrang ba 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba dang / nang gi dang / phyi'i dang / chen po dang / chung du dang / ngan pa dang / bzang po dang / nye ba dang /
translated: Whatever is counted as form, whether past, future, or present, internal or external, gross or subtle, inferior or superior, far or near,

original: ring pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad dngos por bsdur mi rung yang tshig gis bsdus te /
analyzed: ring pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad dngos por bsdur mi rung yang tshig gis bsdus te /
translated: all of that is not suitable to be subsumed in substance, but is subsumed in words.

original: chos mang po de dag gcig tu bsdus te spungs pa la /
analyzed: chos mang po de dag gcig tu bsdus te spungs pa la /
translated: Those many phenomena are subsumed and heaped into one.üîΩThat is called the form aggregate.

original: gzugs kyi phung po zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du gang cung zad rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid du bgrang ba /
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du gang cung zad rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid du bgrang ba /
translated: Similarly, whatever is counted as the characteristic of consciousness,

original: 'das pa dang ma @117a * //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma @117a * //
translated: whether past or future,

original: 'ongs pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'ongs pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: up to whatever is near or far,üîΩthat is not suitable to be subsumed in substance, but is subsumed in words and heaped together.

original: nye ba dang ring ba gang yin pa de dag dngos por bsdur mi rung yang tshig gis bsdus te spungs ba la rnam par shes pa'i phung po zhes bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: nye ba dang ring ba gang yin pa de dag dngos por bsdur mi rung yang tshig gis bsdus te spungs ba la rnam par shes pa'i phung po zhes bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: That is called the consciousness aggregate.

original: don de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just that meaning, it is said:

original: dus dang / rgyud dang / rnam pa dang / 'gro ba dang / yul tha dad pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i mdor bsdus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dus dang / rgyud dang / rnam pa dang / 'gro ba dang / yul tha dad pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i mdor bsdus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: because it is a collection of forms, etc. that are different in terms of time, continuum, aspect, life-stream, and location.

analyzed: tha dad pa zhes bya ba'i tshig kun dang yang sbyar te /
