translated: These eleven are called the tactile base.

original: skye mched bcu'i mtshan nyid bshad nas /
analyzed: skye mched bcu'i mtshan nyid bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the characteristics of the ten bases,

original: yid kyi skye mched gang la bya ba bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yid kyi skye mched gang la bya ba bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to explain what is meant by the mental base,

original: yid kyi skye mched ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: yid kyi skye mched ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it says, the mental base is the consciousness aggregate.

original: rnam par shes pa'i phung po bshad pa'i skabs su rnam par shes pa brgyad la rnam par shes pa'i phung po zhes bya'o zhes bshad pa'i rnam par shes pa brgyad la yid kyi skye mched ces bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phung po bshad pa'i skabs su rnam par shes pa brgyad la rnam par shes pa'i phung po zhes bya'o zhes bshad pa'i rnam par shes pa brgyad la yid kyi skye mched ces bya'o //
translated: In the explanation of the consciousness aggregate, the eight consciousnesses are called the consciousness aggregate. The eight consciousnesses are called the mental base.

original: rnam par shes pa brgyad kyang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug gi steng du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i yid kyis bsnan te brgyad do ;
analyzed: rnam par shes pa brgyad kyang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug gi steng du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i yid kyis bsnan te brgyad do ;
translated: The eight consciousnesses are the six active consciousnesses plus the store consciousness and the afflicted mentality.

original: / de bas na skye mched bshad pa'i skabs su ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po la yid kyi skye mched ces bya'o //
analyzed: / de bas na skye mched bshad pa'i skabs su ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po la yid kyi skye mched ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, in the context of the explanation of the bases, the aggregate of consciousness is called the mental base.

original: chos rnam pa brgyad la chos kyi skye mched ces bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos rnam pa brgyad la chos kyi skye mched ces bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that the eight categories of dharmas are called the dharma base,

original: chos kyi skye mched ni gang tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang / 'dus ma byas so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: chos kyi skye mched ni gang tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang / 'dus ma byas so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: the root text says, ‚ÄúThe dharma base is feeling, conception, the karmic forces, and noninformative form, as well as the unconditioned.‚Äù

original: chos kyi skye mched ni rnam pa brgyad yod de //
analyzed: chos kyi skye mched ni rnam pa brgyad yod de //
translated: The dharma base has eight categories.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang / 'dus ma byas bzhi ste brgyad do //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang / 'dus ma byas bzhi ste brgyad do //
translated: The eight categories are feeling, conception, the karmic forces, and the four types of unconditioned dharmas.

original: de la tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed kyi phung po dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ni gong du phung po bshad pa'i skabs su bshad zin pas da mi bshad kyi phung po'i skabs su 'dus ma byas ma bshad pas da 'dus ma byas kyi rang bzhin bstan par bya ba dang /üîΩ'dus ma byas bzhi po gang dang gang yin pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed kyi phung po dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ni gong du phung po bshad pa'i skabs su bshad zin pas da mi bshad kyi phung po'i skabs su 'dus ma byas ma bshad pas da 'dus ma byas kyi rang bzhin bstan par bya ba dang / 'dus ma byas bzhi po gang dang gang yin pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The nature of feeling, discernment, formation and the nonindicative form and so on was already explained above in the section on the aggregates, so it will not be explained here. Since unconditioned states were not explained in the section on the aggregates, their nature will be taught here and the four unconditioned states will be identified.üîΩüîΩ

original: 'dus ma byas @119a * //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas @119a * //
translated: The nature of the aggregates of feeling, discernment, formation and the non-revealing form and so on have already been explained above in the section on the aggregates, so they will not be explained here. Since unconditioned states were not explained in the section on the aggregates, their nature will be taught here and the four unconditioned states will be identified.

original: gang zhe na zhes dris nas /
analyzed: gang zhe na zhes dris nas /
translated: What is unconditioned?

original: nam mkha' dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa dang / so sor brtags pas 'gog pa dang / de bzhin nyid do zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa dang / so sor brtags pas 'gog pa dang / de bzhin nyid do zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Space, nonanalytical cessation, analytical cessation and suchness.

original: de la las dang nyon mongs pa'i rgyu dang rkyen gyi mthu las skyas pa'i rang bzhin ni 'dus byas zhes bya'i las dang nyon mongs pa'i rgyu rkyen la brten nas skye ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa la ni 'dus ma byas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la las dang nyon mongs pa'i rgyu dang rkyen gyi mthu las skyas pa'i rang bzhin ni 'dus byas zhes bya'i las dang nyon mongs pa'i rgyu rkyen la brten nas skye ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa la ni 'dus ma byas zhes bya ste /
translated: That which is produced by the power of causes and conditions of karma and affliction is called ‚Äúconditioned.‚Äù That which is not produced in dependence on causes and conditions of karma and affliction is called ‚Äúunconditioned.‚Äù

original: de yang nam mkha' la sogs pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: de yang nam mkha' la sogs pa bzhi'o //
translated: Moreover, there are four types: space and so on.

original: de la nam mkha'i rang bzhin ji lta bu yin pa mi shes nas de'i rang bzhin shes par 'dod nas /
analyzed: de la nam mkha'i rang bzhin ji lta bu yin pa mi shes nas de'i rang bzhin shes par 'dod nas /
translated: If one does not know the nature of space, then desiring to know its nature,

original: nam mkha' gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: nam mkha' gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: one asks, ‚ÄúWhat is space?‚Äù

original: nam mkha'i rang bzhin gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: nam mkha'i rang bzhin gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the question is, ‚ÄúWhat is the nature of space?‚Äù

original: de'i lan du /
analyzed: de'i lan du /
translated: In response to that,

original: gzugs kyi go 'byed pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi go 'byed pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúIt is the opening of form.‚Äù

original: thogs pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs rnams gnas pa dang / yul gang du thogs par mi byed pa'i gnas dang / yul de ni thogs pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs gzhan gyi go 'byed pa yin te /
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs rnams gnas pa dang / yul gang du thogs par mi byed pa'i gnas dang / yul de ni thogs pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs gzhan gyi go 'byed pa yin te /
translated: The space that is the opening of form is the place where obstructed form does not obstruct and is not obstructed by other obstructed form.

original: de bas na gzugs rnams phan tshun 'gro ba'i go 'byed pa la nam mkha' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na gzugs rnams phan tshun 'gro ba'i go 'byed pa la nam mkha' zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, space is said to be the non-obstruction of form, i.e., the opportunity for the movement of forms.

original: yang na gzugs rnams skye ba la bgegs mi byed pa ni nam mkha' zhas bya'o //
analyzed: yang na gzugs rnams skye ba la bgegs mi byed pa ni nam mkha' zhas bya'o //
translated: Or, space is said to be the non-obstruction of the arising of forms.

original: yang na nam mkha' 'di'i bar na dngos po rnams shin tu snang bas na nam mkha' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na nam mkha' 'di'i bar na dngos po rnams shin tu snang bas na nam mkha' zhes bya'o //
translated: Or, space is said to be the space between things, since things appear in space.üîΩIf non-analytical cessation were mentioned after space, one would understand that it has the nature of space.

original: nam mkha'i 'og tu so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa smos na so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa'i rang bzhin rtogs par 'dod nas /üîΩso sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: nam mkha'i 'og tu so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa smos na so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa'i rang bzhin rtogs par 'dod nas / so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: Therefore, in order to understand that non-analytical cessation has a different nature, it is asked:üîΩ‚ÄúWhat is non-analytical cessation?‚Äù

original: so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa'i rang bzhin gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa'i rang bzhin gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the question is: ‚ÄúWhat is the nature of non-analytical cessation?‚Äù

original: de la so sor brtags pa zhes bya ba la brtags pa zhes bya ba dang / 'jal ba zhes bya ba dang / rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya ba dang / shes rab ces bya ba dag ni tshig gi rnam grangs su zad kyi don gcig go //
analyzed: de la so sor brtags pa zhes bya ba la brtags pa zhes bya ba dang / 'jal ba zhes bya ba dang / rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya ba dang / shes rab ces bya ba dag ni tshig gi rnam grangs su zad kyi don gcig go //
translated: Here, individually investigating is a synonym for investigating, weighing, differentiating, and wisdom, but they have the same meaning.

original: so sor zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang / lam gyi bden pa bzhi po so so la ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la ni shes rab kyis mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang /
analyzed: so sor zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang / lam gyi bden pa bzhi po so so la ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la ni shes rab kyis mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang /
translated: Individually means that the four noble truths of suffering, origin, cessation, and path are individually investigated, understood, and known by wisdom as impermanent, suffering,

original: stong pa dang / bdag med pa yin no zhes brtags shing shes par byas /
analyzed: stong pa dang / bdag med pa yin no zhes brtags shing shes par byas /
translated: empty, and selfless with regard to the truth of suffering.

original: kun 'byung gi bden pa la ni rgyu dang / rkyen dang / kun 'byung ba dang / rab tu 'byung ba zhes brtags shing shes par byas /
analyzed: kun 'byung gi bden pa la ni rgyu dang / rkyen dang / kun 'byung ba dang / rab tu 'byung ba zhes brtags shing shes par byas /
translated: The truth of origin is investigated, understood, and known as cause, condition, origin, and appearance.

original: 'gog pa'i @119b bden pa la ni 'gog pa dang / zhi ba dang / gya nom pa dang / byung ba zhes brtags shing shes par byas /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i @119b bden pa la ni 'gog pa dang / zhi ba dang / gya nom pa dang / byung ba zhes brtags shing shes par byas /
translated: peace, excellence, and definitive emergence.üîΩThe truth of the path is investigated and understood as the path,

original: lam gyi bden pa la ni lam dang / rigs pa dang / bsgrub par bya ba dang 'byung bar byed par brtags shing shes par byas te /
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa la ni lam dang / rigs pa dang / bsgrub par bya ba dang 'byung bar byed par brtags shing shes par byas te /
translated: reasoning, accomplishment, and that which brings about emergence.

original: bden pa bzhi po so so la brtags gzhal nas nyon mongs pa spangs te phung po mi skye par 'gag pa ni so sor brtags te 'gog pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bden pa bzhi po so so la brtags gzhal nas nyon mongs pa spangs te phung po mi skye par 'gag pa ni so sor brtags te 'gog pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Having investigated and assessed each of the four truths, the aggregates cease without being produced due to the elimination of the afflictions. This is called ‚Äúcessation through analysis.‚Äù

original: don du na /
analyzed: don du na /
translated: In fact,

original: bden pa bzhi shes pa'i shes rab kyi khyad par la so sor brtags pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bden pa bzhi shes pa'i shes rab kyi khyad par la so sor brtags pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the specific wisdom that knows the four truths is called ‚Äúanalysis.‚Äù

original: so sor brtags pa med par 'gag pa ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: so sor brtags pa med par 'gag pa ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Cessation without analysis is called ‚Äúcessation not through analysis.‚Äù

original: don du na shes rab med par phung po la sogs pa'i chos mi skye bar gyur pa ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gag pa zhas bya'o //
analyzed: don du na shes rab med par phung po la sogs pa'i chos mi skye bar gyur pa ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gag pa zhas bya'o //
translated: In fact, the non-production of the aggregates and other phenomena without wisdom is called ‚Äúcessation not through analysis.‚Äù

original: de yang rkyen dang mi ldan pa ste /üîΩgang ma 'ongs pa'i chos skye bar 'gyur ba de skye bar 'gyur ba'i chos rgyu dang rkyen dang mi ldan zhing rkyen med pas ma skyes te ma 'ongs pa'i dus su lus nas nams kyang mi skye bar 'gyur ba ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gag
analyzed: de yang rkyen dang mi ldan pa ste / gang ma 'ongs pa'i chos skye bar 'gyur ba de skye bar 'gyur ba'i chos rgyu dang rkyen dang mi ldan zhing rkyen med pas ma skyes te ma 'ongs pa'i dus su lus nas nams kyang mi skye bar 'gyur ba ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gag
translated: Moreover, it is not endowed with conditions.üîΩThat which is a future phenomenon that will arise does not arise due to not being endowed with the cause and conditions of arising and due to lacking conditions.

original: pa zhes bya'o //üîΩde'i lan du /
analyzed: pa zhes bya'o // de'i lan du /
translated: It is called ‚Äúcessation not attained through mental application‚Äù because it does not arise at any time in the future due to remaining in the future.

original: gang 'gog pa mi 'bral ba ste zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gang 'gog pa mi 'bral ba ste zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In response to that, the root text states, ‚ÄúThat which is cessation is not separation.‚Äù

original: yang nyon mongs pa ma skyes la mi 'bral ba dang / nyon mongs pa skyes la 'bral ba gnyis yod pa las /
analyzed: yang nyon mongs pa ma skyes la mi 'bral ba dang / nyon mongs pa skyes la 'bral ba gnyis yod pa las /
translated: There are two types of cessation: that which is not separation from the nonarising of affliction and that which is separation from the arising of affliction.

original: so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa ni phung po mi skye bar 'dod pa ni yin gyi rnam par bral ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa ni phung po mi skye bar 'dod pa ni yin gyi rnam par bral ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the statement ‚Äúcessation not attained through mental application is asserted to be the nonarising of the aggregates, but it is not separation‚Äù is as follows.

original: don du na so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa de phung po shin tu mi skye ba'i rang bzhin yin gyi nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i rang bzhin ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: don du na so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa de phung po shin tu mi skye ba'i rang bzhin yin gyi nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i rang bzhin ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: In fact, that cessation is not by analysis, and it is the nature of the aggregates not to arise, but it is not the nature of the abandonment of defilements.

original: de la 'gog pa'i sgra so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa 'ba' zhig la 'gog pa zhes bya bar ma zad kyi gsung rab la so sor brtags te 'gog pa la yang 'gog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'gog pa'i sgra so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa 'ba' zhig la 'gog pa zhes bya bar ma zad kyi gsung rab la so sor brtags te 'gog pa la yang 'gog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: In this regard, the word ‚Äúcessation‚Äù is not only used for cessation that is not by analysis, but in the scriptures, cessation that is by analysis is also called ‚Äúcessation.‚Äù

original: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la yang 'gog pa zhes bya /
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la yang 'gog pa zhes bya /
translated: The attainment of non-perception is also called ‚Äúcessation.‚Äù

original: 'du shes med pa la yang 'gog pa zhes bya /
analyzed: 'du shes med pa la yang 'gog pa zhes bya /
translated: The state of non-perception is also called ‚Äúcessation.‚Äù

original: chos rnams mi rtag ste skyes nas 'gags pa mi rtag pa la yang 'gog pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: chos rnams mi rtag ste skyes nas 'gags pa mi rtag pa la yang 'gog pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The impermanence of phenomena, that is, their cessation after arising, is also called ‚Äúcessation.‚Äù

original: de las kyang 'dir so sor brtags te 'gog pa mi 'chad do zhes bsal bar bya ba'i phyir mi 'bral ba zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de las kyang 'dir so sor brtags te 'gog pa mi 'chad do zhes bsal bar bya ba'i phyir mi 'bral ba zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Here, in order to exclude cessation that is by analysis, ‚Äúnon-separation‚Äù is mentioned.

original: so sor brtags te 'gog pa ni 'bral ba'i rang bzhin yin la so sor ma brtags pa'i rang bzhin ni mi @120a * //
analyzed: so sor brtags te 'gog pa ni 'bral ba'i rang bzhin yin la so sor ma brtags pa'i rang bzhin ni mi @120a * //
translated: Cessation through analysis is by nature separation, and cessation not through analysis is by nature non-separation.

original: 'bral ba yin pas mi 'bral ba zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so sor brtags te 'gog pa bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'bral ba yin pas mi 'bral ba zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so sor brtags te 'gog pa bsal ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the word ‚Äúnon-separation‚Äù excludes cessation through analysis.

original: de la mi 'bral ba zhes bya ba la 'bral ba'i don je bstan to //
analyzed: de la mi 'bral ba zhes bya ba la 'bral ba'i don je bstan to //
translated: In this regard, the meaning of ‚Äúseparation‚Äù is taught in the phrase ‚Äúnon-separation.‚Äù

original: nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po shes rab kyis sems kyi rgyud la nyon mongs pa'i sa bon rtsa ba nas bton pas nyon mongs pa dang phung po phyis rab tu mi skye bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni 'bral ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po shes rab kyis sems kyi rgyud la nyon mongs pa'i sa bon rtsa ba nas bton pas nyon mongs pa dang phung po phyis rab tu mi skye bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni 'bral ba zhes bya'o //
translated: That is to say, separation is the non-arising of the afflictions and the aggregates in the future, due to the removal of the seeds of the afflictions from the continuum of the mind by the wisdom that is the antidote to the afflictions.

original: sems kyi rgyud la nyon mongs pa'i sa bon yod pa de dag shes rab kyis ma bton ma bsal kyang chos de dag skye ba'i rkyen dang mi ldan te /
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud la nyon mongs pa'i sa bon yod pa de dag shes rab kyis ma bton ma bsal kyang chos de dag skye ba'i rkyen dang mi ldan te /
translated: Even though the seeds of the afflictions are not removed and eliminated from the continuum of the mind by wisdom, those phenomena that are not endowed with the conditions for arising are not separated from the seeds of the afflictions.

original: rkyen med pas ma 'ongs pa'i chos rnams rab tu mi skye ste de rnams kyang skye bar mi 'gyur ba de ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rkyen med pas ma 'ongs pa'i chos rnams rab tu mi skye ste de rnams kyang skye bar mi 'gyur ba de ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called ‚Äúcessation not attained by analysis.‚Äù

original: de ltar bshad pa dang / brgal ba /
analyzed: de ltar bshad pa dang / brgal ba /
translated: This is the explanation and the objection.

original: 'di ltar 'phags pa dgra bcom pa dag la lha'am mi'am sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i ris mthun pa'i gnas su phung po skye bar 'gyur ba'i las ma nges pa'i sa bon sems kyi rgyud la yod pa 'phags pa dgra bcom pa de dag gi phung po
analyzed: 'di ltar 'phags pa dgra bcom pa dag la lha'am mi'am sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i ris mthun pa'i gnas su phung po skye bar 'gyur ba'i las ma nges pa'i sa bon sems kyi rgyud la yod pa 'phags pa dgra bcom pa de dag gi phung po
translated: The objection is that in the mindstreams of arhats, there exist seeds of karma that are not definite in their ripening, which, if they were to take birth in the realms of gods, humans, hell beings, and so on, would give rise to their aggregates.

original: de ma 'ongs pa ni mi skye ste /üîΩnams kyang mi skye ba thob pa de yang so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa ma yin pa'i skyon du 'gyur bar dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ma 'ongs pa ni mi skye ste / nams kyang mi skye ba thob pa de yang so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa ma yin pa'i skyon du 'gyur bar dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: The future aggregates of arhats do not arise.üîΩThis is because they have attained a state in which they will never arise.

original: de la gang nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po med par phung po rnams rab tu mi skyed pa'o zhes bya ba smos te ;
analyzed: de la gang nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po med par phung po rnams rab tu mi skyed pa'o zhes bya ba smos te ;
translated: To dispel the doubt that this is the fault of cessation not attained by analysis, the text says, ‚ÄúThe future aggregates of arhats do not arise because there is no antidote to the afflictions.‚Äù

original: 'phags pa dgra bcom pa'i phung po mi skye ba de las dge ba byas pas las des ma 'ongs pa'i phung po 'phen par 'gyur ba'i las kyi sa bon yod pa dang / las lung du ma bstan pa byas pas ma 'ongs pa na bzo shes pa'i lus skye bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu mthun pa'i las kyi sa bon yod pa 'phags pa dgra bcom pa des sa bon ma spangs te /
analyzed: 'phags pa dgra bcom pa'i phung po mi skye ba de las dge ba byas pas las des ma 'ongs pa'i phung po 'phen par 'gyur ba'i las kyi sa bon yod pa dang / las lung du ma bstan pa byas pas ma 'ongs pa na bzo shes pa'i lus skye bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu mthun pa'i las kyi sa bon yod pa 'phags pa dgra bcom pa des sa bon ma spangs te /
translated: That arya foe destroyer does not abandon those seeds.

original: yod kyang ma 'ongs pa na phung po mi skye ba dang / nyon mongs pa mi skye ba de nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po med par mi skye ba mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: yod kyang ma 'ongs pa na phung po mi skye ba dang / nyon mongs pa mi skye ba de nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po med par mi skye ba mi 'grub ste /
translated: Even though they exist, the nonarising of future aggregates and the nonarising of affliction are not established as nonarising without the antidote to affliction.

original: de bas na phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings dang / phung po'i lhag ma ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa yin par bshad do //

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po zhes bya ba ni 'di'i skabs su zag pa med pa 'phags pa'i lam la ni mi bya ste /

analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po'i 'phags pa'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa spangs nas phung po mi skye bar byas pa lta bu ni ma yin gyi /

analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po med par ma 'ongs pa'i chos rgyu rkyen dang mi ldan pas phung po de rab tu mi skyed de /

analyzed: nams kyang skye bar mi 'gyur ba ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa zhes bya'o //

original: de la dngos su 'di ltar gzugs kyi rnam pa gcig la mig gi rnam par shes pa zhen nas yengs pa na gzugs kyi rnam pa dkar po dang dmar po dang ser po la sogs pa dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang /

analyzed: de ltar 'dod pa'i khams kyi mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs bsdoms na nyon mongs ba sum cu rtsa gnyis so //
translated: The afflictions to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering in the form realm are seven in number.üîΩThe

analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa bzhi la ni dgur dbye ste /

original: chen po'i chen po dang / chen po'i 'bring po dang / chen po'i chung du dang / 'bring bo'i chen po dang / 'bring bo'i 'bring po dang / 'bring bo'i chung du dang / chung du'i chen po dang / chung du'i 'bring bo dang / chung du'i chung du'o //
analyzed: chen po'i chen po dang / chen po'i 'bring po dang / chen po'i chung du dang / 'bring bo'i chen po dang / 'bring bo'i 'bring po dang / 'bring bo'i chung du dang / chung du'i chen po dang / chung du'i 'bring bo dang / chung du'i chung du'o //

analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po la yang bzhi ste /
translated: The antidote to the afflictions of the desire realm that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing is also fourfold.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'o //

analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'o zhes bya'o //

analyzed: kun 'byung ba la kun 'byung ba la sogs pa rnam pa bzhir shes pa'i kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod pa zhes bya'o //

original: 'gog pa la 'gog pa la sogs pa rnam ba bzhir shes pa ni 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa la 'gog pa la sogs pa rnam ba bzhir shes pa ni 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of the four aspects such as cessation with regard to cessation is called the receptivity to the knowledge of the doctrine with regard to cessation.

original: lam la lam la sogs pa rnam pa bzhir shes pa ni lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lam la lam la sogs pa rnam pa bzhir shes pa ni lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa zhes bya'o //

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgur phye ba'i gnyen por ye shes kyang dgu yod de /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgur phye ba'i gnyen por ye shes kyang dgu yod de /

original: ye shes chen po'i yang chen po dang / ye shes chen po'i 'bring po dang / ye shes chen po'i chung du dang / ye shes 'bring po'i chen po dang / ye shes 'bring po'i 'bring bo dang / ye shes 'bring po'i chung du dang /
analyzed: ye shes chen po'i yang chen po dang / ye shes chen po'i 'bring po dang / ye shes chen po'i chung du dang / ye shes 'bring po'i chen po dang / ye shes 'bring po'i 'bring bo dang / ye shes 'bring po'i chung du dang /
translated: the great of the great of great pristine wisdom, the middling of the great of great pristine wisdom, the small of the great of great pristine wisdom, the great of the great of middling pristine wisdom, the middling of the great of middling pristine wisdom, the small of the great of middling pristine wisdom,

original: ye shes chung du'i chen po dang / ye shes chung du'i 'bring po dang / ye shes chung du'i chung du'o //
analyzed: ye shes chung du'i chen po dang / ye shes chung du'i 'bring po dang / ye shes chung du'i chung du'o //
translated: the great of the great of small pristine wisdom, the middling of the great of small pristine wisdom, and the small of the great of small pristine wisdom.

original: de la mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam de dag la ming du de ma thag pa'i lam zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam de dag la ming du de ma thag pa'i lam zhes bya'o //
translated: On the paths of seeing and cultivation, those are called the ‚Äúname-immediately subsequent paths.‚Äù

analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i khams kyi gnas la mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa gang dang gang yod pa de dag de'i gnyen po de ma thag pa'i lam gyi skad cig ma gang dang gang skyes shing byung bar gyur na gnyen po des
translated: Whatever afflictions are to be abandoned by seeing and cultivation exist in the abodes of the desire realm. Whatever instances of the antidote, the immediately subsequent path, arise and occur,

original: nyon mongs pa de dang de @122b dag spang zhing de dang bral bar byed do /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa de dang de @122b dag spang zhing de dang bral bar byed do /
translated: One abandons and is separated from these and those afflictions.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skyes nas sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa bcu spangs shing de dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skyes nas sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa bcu spangs shing de dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering arises, one abandons and is separated from the ten afflictions to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering.

original: kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skyes nas kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa bdun dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skyes nas kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa bdun dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of origin arises, one is separated from the seven afflictions to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin.

original: 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skyes nas 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa bdun dang bral bar 'gyur ro /
analyzed: 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skyes nas 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa bdun dang bral bar 'gyur ro /
translated: When perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of cessation arises, one is separated from the seven afflictions to be abandoned by seeing the truth of cessation.

original: lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skyes nas lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa brgyad dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skyes nas lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa brgyad dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of path arises, one is separated from the eight afflictions to be abandoned by seeing the truth of path.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa dgu dang / ye shes dgu yang de ma thag pa'i lam ye shes chung ngu'i chung dus ni nyon mongs pa chen po'i chen po spong bar byed pas na de ma thag pa'i lam ye shes chen po'i yang chen pos ni nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i yang chung ngu spong bar
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa dgu dang / ye shes dgu yang de ma thag pa'i lam ye shes chung ngu'i chung dus ni nyon mongs pa chen po'i chen po spong bar byed pas na de ma thag pa'i lam ye shes chen po'i yang chen pos ni nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i yang chung ngu spong bar
translated: The greatest of the great transcendent wisdom of the uninterrupted path abandons the smallest of the small afflictions.

original: byed do // de ltar skad cig ma dang po la nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po lam dang bcas pa'i lus skyes pas nyon mongs pa spangs nas skad cig ma phyi ma phan chad mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pas bon 'brel ba'i lus gzhan skyed parüîΩbyed par mi nus te /
analyzed: byed do // de ltar skad cig ma dang po la nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po lam dang bcas pa'i lus skyes pas nyon mongs pa spangs nas skad cig ma phyi ma phan chad mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pas bon 'brel ba'i lus gzhan skyed parüîΩbyed par mi nus te /
translated: Thus, since the body of the antidote to the afflictions and the path is generated in the first moment, the afflictions are abandoned and it is not possible to generate another body related to the seeds of the afflictions to be abandoned by the path of seeing and the path of meditation in subsequent moments.

original: gnyen po dang bcas pa'i lus skad cig ma phyi ma mi skyed cing nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i lus phyi ma'i rgyu mi byed pas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen pos phung po rnams rab tu mi skyed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnyen po dang bcas pa'i lus skad cig ma phyi ma mi skyed cing nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i lus phyi ma'i rgyu mi byed pas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen pos phung po rnams rab tu mi skyed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The body with its antidote does not produce a subsequent moment of body, and it does not cause a subsequent body with afflictions. Therefore, it is said that the body with its antidote does not produce the aggregates.

original: 'phags pa'i lam dang bcas pa'i lus nyon mongs pa med pa snga ma des nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i lus phyi ma ci'i phyir mi skyed ce na /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam dang bcas pa'i lus nyon mongs pa med pa snga ma des nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i lus phyi ma ci'i phyir mi skyed ce na /
translated: Why does the body with the noble path, which is without afflictions, not cause a subsequent body with afflictions?

original: 'phags pa'i lam dang 'grogs pa'i lus nyon mongs pa med pa lus skad cig ma snga ma la byung ba de lus nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa phyis 'byung ba dang 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam dang 'grogs pa'i lus nyon mongs pa med pa lus skad cig ma snga ma la byung ba de lus nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa phyis 'byung ba dang 'gal ba yin te /
translated: The body without afflictions, which is associated with the noble path, and which occurs in a previous moment of body, is incompatible with the subsequent occurrence of a body with afflictions.

original: de bas na lus snga ma de nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i lus phyi ma skye ba'i rgyu mi byed cing phyi ma skyed par mi byed do //
analyzed: de bas na lus snga ma de nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i lus phyi ma skye ba'i rgyu mi byed cing phyi ma skyed par mi byed do //
translated: Therefore, that previous body does not cause a subsequent body with afflictions, and it does not produce a subsequent body.

original: lus nyon mongs pa med pa snga ma de nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i lus phyi ma skyed pa'i rgyu mi byed na /
analyzed: lus nyon mongs pa med pa snga ma de nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i lus phyi ma skyed pa'i rgyu mi byed na /
translated: If the former body free from affliction does not act as the cause for generating the latter body with affliction,

original: lus gang gis rkyen byed ce na /
analyzed: lus gang gis rkyen byed ce na /
translated: by what body does it act as a condition?

original: de ni mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sa bon dang bral ba'i lus phyi ma skye ba'i rgyu ni med do /
analyzed: de ni mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sa bon dang bral ba'i lus phyi ma skye ba'i rgyu ni med do /
translated: There is no cause for generating the latter body free from the seeds of affliction eliminated by the paths of seeing and cultivation.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa'i lus snga ma de nyon mongs pa med pa'i lus phyi ma de skyed pa dang mthun pa'i rkyen yin pas na nyon @123a * //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa'i lus snga ma de nyon mongs pa med pa'i lus phyi ma de skyed pa dang mthun pa'i rkyen yin pas na nyon @123a * //
translated: The former body free from affliction is the condition that accords with the generation of the latter body free from affliction.

original: mongs pa med pa'i lus phyi ma ni skyed pa'o //
analyzed: mongs pa med pa'i lus phyi ma ni skyed pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the latter body free from affliction is generated.

original: de bas na gnyen pos nyon mongs pa bsal na nyon mongs pa med pa'i lus phyi ma ni skyed kyi nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i lus phyi ma ni mi skyed pas na gnyen pos phung po rab tu mi skyed pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de bas na gnyen pos nyon mongs pa bsal na nyon mongs pa med pa'i lus phyi ma ni skyed kyi nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i lus phyi ma ni mi skyed pas na gnyen pos phung po rab tu mi skyed pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Thus, if affliction is eliminated by the antidote, the latter body free from affliction is generated, but the latter body with affliction is not generated. Therefore, it is called the non-generation of the aggregates by the antidote.

original: de la so sor brtags pas 'gog pa zhes gdags so //
analyzed: de la so sor brtags pas 'gog pa zhes gdags so //
translated: In that case, it is designated as analytical cessation.

original: da ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams na nyon mongs pa'i gnyen pos nyon mongs pa spangs nas phung po mi skyed par bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: da ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams na nyon mongs pa'i gnyen pos nyon mongs pa spangs nas phung po mi skyed par bshad par bya'o //
translated: Now, it should be explained that in the form and formless realms, afflictions are abandoned by the antidote of the afflictions, without generating the aggregates.

original: de la snga ma gzugs kyi khams na sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa dgu ste /
analyzed: de la snga ma gzugs kyi khams na sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa dgu ste /
translated: In the form realm, there are nine afflictions to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering.

original: snga ma bcu las khong khro ba phri nas 'jig tshogs su lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang / lta ba snyems pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs snyems pa dang / the tshom dang / 'dod chags dang /
analyzed: snga ma bcu las khong khro ba phri nas 'jig tshogs su lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang / lta ba snyems pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs snyems pa dang / the tshom dang / 'dod chags dang /
translated: Excluding anger, the remaining ten are the afflicted view of the self, extreme view, wrong view, esteeming bad views, esteeming morality and asceticism, doubt, attachment,

original: nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa'o //
translated: pride, and ignorance.

original: kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba drug ste /
analyzed: kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba drug ste /
translated: There are six to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin.

original: 'jig tshogs su lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs snyems pa dang / khong khro ba bzhi bkol te /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs su lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs snyems pa dang / khong khro ba bzhi bkol te /
translated: Excluding the four‚Äîthe afflicted view of the self, extreme view, esteeming morality and asceticism, and anger‚Äî

original: log par lta ba dang / lta ba snyems pa dang / the tshom dang / 'dod chags dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: log par lta ba dang / lta ba snyems pa dang / the tshom dang / 'dod chags dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa'o //
translated: Wrong views, esteeming of views, doubt, desire, pride, and ignorance.

original: 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa drug ste sngar bshad pa'i drug po nyid do //
analyzed: 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa drug ste sngar bshad pa'i drug po nyid do //
translated: Six are to be abandoned by seeing cessation, the same six as above.

original: lam mthong bas spang par bya ba'i nyon mongs pa bdun te /
analyzed: lam mthong bas spang par bya ba'i nyon mongs pa bdun te /
translated: Seven are to be abandoned by seeing the path:

original: log par lta ba dang / lta ba snyems pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs snyems pa dang / the tshom dang / 'dod chags dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: log par lta ba dang / lta ba snyems pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs snyems pa dang / the tshom dang / 'dod chags dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa'o //
translated: wrong views, esteeming of views, esteeming of morality and asceticism, doubt, desire, pride, and ignorance.

original: gzugs kyi khams kyi mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa bsdoms nas nyon mongs pa nyi shu rtsa brgyad yod do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams kyi mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa bsdoms nas nyon mongs pa nyi shu rtsa brgyad yod do //
translated: In the form realm, there are twenty-eight afflictions in total that are to be abandoned by seeing.

original: gzugs kyi khams kyi bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa 'dod chags dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa gsum chen po'i chen po la sogs pa rnam pa dgur dbye'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams kyi bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa 'dod chags dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa gsum chen po'i chen po la sogs pa rnam pa dgur dbye'o //
translated: They are the three afflictions of attachment, pride, and ignorance.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na yang bden pa bzhi mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa la yang gzugs kyi khams dang 'dra ste nyon mongs pa nyi shu rtsa brgyad do //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na yang bden pa bzhi mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa la yang gzugs kyi khams dang 'dra ste nyon mongs pa nyi shu rtsa brgyad do //
translated: In the formless realm, there are also twenty-eight afflictions that are objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing, just as in the form realm.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa yang gzugs kyi khams dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa yang gzugs kyi khams dang 'dra ste /
translated: In the formless realm, there are also afflictions that are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation, just as in the form realm.

original: 'dod chags dang / nga rgyal dang / @123b ma rig pa gsum las rnam pa dgur dbye'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / nga rgyal dang / @123b ma rig pa gsum las rnam pa dgur dbye'o //
translated: They are the three afflictions of attachment, pride, and ignorance, which are divided into nine degrees of strength.

original: khams gnyis kyi bsgom pas spad bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spang ba'i gnyen po yang bzhi ste /
analyzed: khams gnyis kyi bsgom pas spad bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spang ba'i gnyen po yang bzhi ste /
translated: The antidotes that abandon the afflictions that are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation in the two higher realms are also four.

original: sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: The acceptance of the cognition of the origin of the higher realms, the acceptance of the cognition of the cessation of the higher realms, and the acceptance of the cognition of the path of the higher realms.

original: de la khams gong ma gnyis kyi sdug bsngal mi rtag pa la sogs pa bzhir shes pa ni /
analyzed: de la khams gong ma gnyis kyi sdug bsngal mi rtag pa la sogs pa bzhir shes pa ni /
translated: The cognition of the four aspects of impermanence and so on of the suffering of the two higher realms

original: sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: is called the acceptance of the cognition of the truth of suffering.

original: khams gong ma gnyis kyi kun 'byung rnam pa bzhi ltar shes pa ni kun 'byung ba rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu 'gog pa la rnam pa bzhi ltar shes pa ni 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: khams gong ma gnyis kyi kun 'byung rnam pa bzhi ltar shes pa ni kun 'byung ba rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu 'gog pa la rnam pa bzhi ltar shes pa ni 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The cognition of the four aspects of the origin of the two higher realms is called the acceptance of the cognition of the truth of origin. The cognition of the four aspects of the cessation of the nine types of affliction is called the acceptance of the cognition of the truth of cessation.

original: khams gong ma gnyis kyi lam la rnam pa bzhi lta bur shes pa ni lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: khams gong ma gnyis kyi lam la rnam pa bzhi lta bur shes pa ni lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The cognition of the four aspects of the path of the two higher realms is called the acceptance of the cognition of the truth of the path.

original: khams gong ma gnyis kyi bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu dgur phye ba'i gnyen po ye shes kyang dgu dgu yod do //
analyzed: khams gong ma gnyis kyi bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu dgur phye ba'i gnyen po ye shes kyang dgu dgu yod do //
translated: The antidote-intuitive knowledge that distinguishes the nine categories of defilement to be abandoned by cultivation in the two higher realms also has nine categories.

original: chen po'i chen po la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: chen po'i chen po la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The great of the great, etc., are as before.

original: de la mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i lam de dag la ming du de ma thag pa'i lam zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i lam de dag la ming du de ma thag pa'i lam zhes bya'o //
translated: In that regard, those paths that are to be abandoned by the path of insight and cultivation are called the immediately antecedent path.

original: de la khams gnyis kyi gnas sam lus la mthong ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa gang dang gang yod pa de dang de dag de'i gnyen po de ma thag pa'i lam gyi skad cig ma gang dang gang skyes shing byung bar gyur na gnyen po des nyon mongs pa de dang de dag spong zhing
analyzed: de la khams gnyis kyi gnas sam lus la mthong ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa gang dang gang yod pa de dang de dag de'i gnyen po de ma thag pa'i lam gyi skad cig ma gang dang gang skyes shing byung bar gyur na gnyen po des nyon mongs pa de dang de dag spong zhing
translated: In that regard, whatever defilements to be abandoned by the path of insight and cultivation exist in the two realms, in the body or abode, when the antidote, the immediately antecedent path, is born and arises, that antidote abandons those defilements and

original: de dag bral bar byed do //
analyzed: de dag bral bar byed do //
translated: causes their separation.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa skyes nas khams gnyis kyi sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa dgu dgu yod pa spang bar 'gyur ro //üîΩkun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa skyes nas khams gnyis kyi kun 'byung mthong bas spang par bya ba'i nyon mongs pa drug drug yod pa dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa skyes nas khams gnyis kyi sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa dgu dgu yod pa spang bar 'gyur ro // kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa skyes nas khams gnyis kyi kun 'byung mthong bas spang par bya ba'i nyon mongs pa drug drug yod pa dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When the perseverance for subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering has arisen, one is free from the nine afflictions of the two higher realms that are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering.üîΩWhen the perseverance for subsequent knowledge of the truth of origin has arisen, one is free from the six afflictions of the two higher realms that are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin.

original: 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa skyes nas khams gnyis kyi 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa drug drug yod pa dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa skyes nas khams gnyis kyi 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa drug drug yod pa dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When the perseverance for subsequent knowledge of the truth of cessation has arisen, one is free from the six afflictions of the two higher realms that are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of cessation.

original: lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa skyes nas khams gnyis kyi lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa bdun bdun yod pa spong bar 'gyur @124a * //
analyzed: lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa skyes nas khams gnyis kyi lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa bdun bdun yod pa spong bar 'gyur @124a * //
translated: When the perseverance for subsequent knowledge of the truth of path has arisen, one is free from the seven afflictions of the two higher realms that are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of path.

original: ro ; / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa dgu yang de ma thag pa'i lam ye shes chung ngu'i yang chung dus ni nyon mongs pa chen po'i yang chen po spong bar byed pas na ye shes chen po'i yang chen pos ni nyon mongs pa chung du'iüîΩyang chung du spong bar byed do //
analyzed: ro ; / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa dgu yang de ma thag pa'i lam ye shes chung ngu'i yang chung dus ni nyon mongs pa chen po'i yang chen po spong bar byed pas na ye shes chen po'i yang chen pos ni nyon mongs pa chung du'i yang chung du spong bar byed do //
translated: The great of the great subsequent knowledge abandons the small of the small afflictions.

original: de ltar skad cig ma dang po la nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po'i lam dang bcas pa'i lus skyes pas nyon mongs pa spangs na skad cig ma phyi ma phan chad mthong ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sa bon dang 'brel pa'i lus gzhan skyed par mi nus te /
analyzed: de ltar skad cig ma dang po la nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po'i lam dang bcas pa'i lus skyes pas nyon mongs pa spangs na skad cig ma phyi ma phan chad mthong ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sa bon dang 'brel pa'i lus gzhan skyed par mi nus te /
translated: Thus, if afflictions are abandoned by generating the body of the path that is the antidote to the afflictions in the first moment, then in the second moment and so on, it is impossible to generate another body related to the seeds of the afflictions to be abandoned by the path of seeing and the path of meditation.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa'i lus kyi skad cig ma snga ma des nyon mongs pa med pa'i lus phyi ma'i skad cig ma ni skyed kyi nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i lus phyi ma ni mi skyed pas na nyon mongs pa'i gnyen pos phung po rab tu mi
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa'i lus kyi skad cig ma snga ma des nyon mongs pa med pa'i lus phyi ma'i skad cig ma ni skyed kyi nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i lus phyi ma ni mi skyed pas na nyon mongs pa'i gnyen pos phung po rab tu mi
translated: The previous moment of the body free from defilements produces the subsequent moment of the body free from defilements, but not the subsequent moment of the body with defilements.

original: skyed pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: skyed pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it is called ‚Äúthe non-production of the aggregates by the antidote to defilements.‚Äù

original: de la so sor brtags pas 'gog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la so sor brtags pas 'gog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called ‚Äúcessation through analysis.‚Äù

original: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa'i 'gog tu de bzhin nyid smos te /
analyzed: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa'i 'gog tu de bzhin nyid smos te /
translated: In the cessation of cessation through analysis, suchness is mentioned.

original: de bas na de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to understand the nature of suchness,

original: de bzhin nyid gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: it is asked, ‚ÄúWhat is suchness?‚Äù

original: de bzhin nyid kyang rang bzhin gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyang rang bzhin gang zhe na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the question is, ‚ÄúWhat is the nature of suchness?‚Äù

original: rtag tu stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin de bzhin du gnas te /
analyzed: rtag tu stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin de bzhin du gnas te /
translated: It is always the nature of emptiness, abiding thus.

original: rang bzhin gzhan du mi 'gyur bas na de bzhin nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gzhan du mi 'gyur bas na de bzhin nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Since its nature does not change, it is called ‚Äúsuchness.‚Äù

original: de'i lan du /
analyzed: de'i lan du /
translated: In response to that,üîΩit is said,

original: gang chos rnams kyi chos nyid dang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gang chos rnams kyi chos nyid dang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe reality of phenomena‚Äù is mentioned.

original: chos rnams zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa rnams la bya'o //
analyzed: chos rnams zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa rnams la bya'o //
translated: ‚Äú Phenomena‚Äù refers to form, feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness.

original: chos de dag gi chos nyid ni chos de dag gi rang bzhin na ma chos de dag gi ngo bo nyid la bya ste /
analyzed: chos de dag gi chos nyid ni chos de dag gi rang bzhin na ma chos de dag gi ngo bo nyid la bya ste /
translated: The reality of those phenomena is the intrinsic reality of those phenomena, or the intrinsic reality of those phenomena.

original: chos de dag gi ngo bo nyid ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pas stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: chos de dag gi ngo bo nyid ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pas stong pa nyid de /
translated: The intrinsic reality of those phenomena is emptiness, free from apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: gzung 'dzin dang bral ba'i stong pa nyid la chos nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: gzung 'dzin dang bral ba'i stong pa nyid la chos nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Emptiness, free from apprehended object and apprehending subject, is called ‚Äúreality.‚Äù

original: de la chos nyid ni gzhan yang yod do /
analyzed: de la chos nyid ni gzhan yang yod do /
translated: Reality is also other than that.

original: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la yang chos nyid ces bya bas mi rtag pa sdug bsngal ba'i chos nyid la bya'o snyam du 'dzin pa bzlog pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la yang chos nyid ces bya bas mi rtag pa sdug bsngal ba'i chos nyid la bya'o snyam du 'dzin pa bzlog pa'i phyir ;
translated: Since impermanence and suffering are also called ‚Äúreality,‚Äù one might think that the reality of impermanence and suffering is meant.

original: gang chos bdag med pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gang chos bdag med pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: To prevent that, ‚Äúthe selflessness of phenomena‚Äù is mentioned.

original: 'di ltar gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i chos rnams ni gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin yin pas shis pa dang brjod pa'i yul du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i chos rnams ni gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin yin pas shis pa dang brjod pa'i yul du gyur pa ste /
translated: Thus, phenomena such as form, sound and so forth are the objects of apprehension and expression because they are the nature of the apprehended and apprehender.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bor shes pa dang brjod pa'i yul du gyur pa la chos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bor shes pa dang brjod pa'i yul du gyur pa la chos zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called phenomena because they are the objects of consciousness and expression in the nature of the apprehended and apprehender.

original: @124b chos bdag med pa ni gzung 'dzin gyi dngos po dang bral ba shes pa dang brjod pa'i yul du ma gyur pa'i stong pa nyid la chos bdag med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: @124b chos bdag med pa ni gzung 'dzin gyi dngos po dang bral ba shes pa dang brjod pa'i yul du ma gyur pa'i stong pa nyid la chos bdag med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The selflessness of phenomena is the emptiness that is free from the entity of apprehended and apprehender and is not the object of consciousness and expression. It is called the selflessness of phenomena.

original: don du kun brtags kyi dngos po rnams rang bzhin gyis stong pa yin pa la chos bdag med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: don du kun brtags kyi dngos po rnams rang bzhin gyis stong pa yin pa la chos bdag med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: In fact, the emptiness of things imagined to be real is called the selflessness of phenomena.

original: de la chos zhes bya ba'i mi rtag pa la sogs pa la ni chos nyid ces mi bya'o //
analyzed: de la chos zhes bya ba'i mi rtag pa la sogs pa la ni chos nyid ces mi bya'o //
translated: Impermanence and so on, which are called phenomena, are not called the reality of phenomena.

original: yang na chos thams cad ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas gnyis su 'dus la /
analyzed: yang na chos thams cad ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas gnyis su 'dus la /
translated: Alternatively, all phenomena are included in the two, compounded and uncompounded.

original: de dag kyang mtshan nyid gsum du gzhag ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang mtshan nyid gsum du gzhag ste /
translated: They are also posited as the three natures.

original: kun tu brtags pa'i mtshan nyid dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: kun tu brtags pa'i mtshan nyid dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The imagined characteristic, the other-dependent characteristic, and the thoroughly established characteristic.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i chos rnams la gzung 'dzin gyi dngos po yod par brtags pa ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i chos rnams la gzung 'dzin gyi dngos po yod par brtags pa ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The imagined characteristic is the imputation of the existence of the entities of apprehendeds and apprehenders in phenomena that are apprehendeds and apprehenders.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni gzhan dbang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni gzhan dbang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The other-dependent characteristic is the consciousness of the ground-of-all.

original: kun gzhi gzung 'dzin gyi dri ma dag nas chos kyi skur grub pa ni yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: kun gzhi gzung 'dzin gyi dri ma dag nas chos kyi skur grub pa ni yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The thoroughly established characteristic is the establishment of the body of attributes after the stains of the apprehendeds and apprehenders of the ground-of-all have been purified.

original: de la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la gzung 'dzin gyi dri ma dag ste /
analyzed: de la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la gzung 'dzin gyi dri ma dag ste /
translated: With respect to that, the stains of the apprehendeds and apprehenders in the consciousness of the ground-of-all are purified.

original: med par gyur nas yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur te /
analyzed: med par gyur nas yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur te /
translated: Having become nonexistent, it becomes the thoroughly established characteristic.

original: chos kyi sku thob pa la chos bdag med pa zhes kyang de la bya ba de bzhin nyid ces kyang de la bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku thob pa la chos bdag med pa zhes kyang de la bya ba de bzhin nyid ces kyang de la bya'o //
translated: The attainment of the body of attributes is also called ‚Äúthe selflessness of phenomena‚Äù and is also called ‚Äúsuchness.‚Äù

original: skye mched kyi grangs dang dngos po gang yin pa bstan nas /
analyzed: skye mched kyi grangs dang dngos po gang yin pa bstan nas /
translated: Having explained the number of the sense powers and the things that are their objects,

original: mig dang rna ba la sogs pa dang gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa la ming du skye mched ces btags pa ci'i phyir skye mched ces bya ba mi shes nas /
analyzed: mig dang rna ba la sogs pa dang gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa la ming du skye mched ces btags pa ci'i phyir skye mched ces bya ba mi shes nas /
translated: Since one does not know why they are called name-bases, he asks,

original: ci'i phyir skye mched ces bya zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir skye mched ces bya zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: ‚ÄúWhy are they called name-bases?‚Äù

original: mig dang rna ba la sogs pa la ming du skye mched ces btags pa don gang gis skye mched ces btags she na zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: mig dang rna ba la sogs pa la ming du skye mched ces btags pa don gang gis skye mched ces btags she na zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the question is: ‚ÄúWhy are the eyes, ears, etc., called name-bases?‚Äù

original: de'i lan du /
analyzed: de'i lan du /
translated: In response to that, he says,

original: rnam par shes pa skye ba'i sgo'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa skye ba'i sgo'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause they are the doors for the arising of consciousness.‚Äù

original: rnam par shes pa'i sgo ni rnam par shes pa skye zhing 'byung ba'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i sgo ni rnam par shes pa skye zhing 'byung ba'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'o //
translated: The door of consciousness is the state of the arising and occurrence of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa skye ba'i sgo zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa skye ba rnams skye ba'i rgyu dang rkyen dang gnas byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa skye ba'i sgo zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa skye ba rnams skye ba'i rgyu dang rkyen dang gnas byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúdoors for the arising of consciousness‚Äù is that they are the causes, conditions, and bases for the arising of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa rnams skye bar bya ba'i phyir mig la sogs pa de dag rgyu dang rkyen dang gnas su gyur bas ni mig la sogs pa la skye mched ces bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rnams skye bar bya ba'i phyir mig la sogs pa de dag rgyu dang rkyen dang gnas su gyur bas ni mig la sogs pa la skye mched ces bya'o //
translated: Since those eyes, etc. are the cause, condition, and basis for the arising of the consciousnesses, they are called the sense bases of the eyes, etc.

original: de ltar yang ci mngon zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar yang ci mngon zhe na /
translated: Why is that so?üîΩBecause a sutra explains the verbal derivation of sense base as follows:

original: mdo las skye mched kyi nges pa'i tshig tu bshad pa sems dang sems las byung ba rnams skye zhing 'phel bar byed pa'i phyir skye mched @125a * //üîΩces bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mdo las skye mched kyi nges pa'i tshig tu bshad pa sems dang sems las byung ba rnams skye zhing 'phel bar byed pa'i phyir skye mched @125a * // ces bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because the mind and mental factors are born and grow, they are called sense bases.

original: de bas na mig dang gzugs ni mig gi rnam par shes pa sems las byung pa'i 'khor dang bcas pa skye ba'i sgo dang / rgyu byed pa'i phyir mig gi skye mched dang gzugs kyi skye mched ces bya ba nas /
analyzed: de bas na mig dang gzugs ni mig gi rnam par shes pa sems las byung pa'i 'khor dang bcas pa skye ba'i sgo dang / rgyu byed pa'i phyir mig gi skye mched dang gzugs kyi skye mched ces bya ba nas /
translated: Therefore, since the eyes and form are the door for the arising of eye consciousness and its retinue of mental factors and they act as its cause, they are called the sense base of the eyes and the sense base of form, respectively.

original: yid dang chos ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'khor dang bcas pa'i skye ba'i sgo dang rgyu byed pa'i phyir yid kyi skye mched dang / chos kyi skye mched ces bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: yid dang chos ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'khor dang bcas pa'i skye ba'i sgo dang rgyu byed pa'i phyir yid kyi skye mched dang / chos kyi skye mched ces bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: The mental faculty and mental objects are the mental faculty base and the mental object base, respectively, because they are the door for the arising of mental consciousness and its concomitant states and because they act as the cause of their arising.

original: skye mched bcu gnyis bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: skye mched bcu gnyis bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the twelve bases is complete.

original: // / mdo sde las skye mched bcu gnyis kyi 'og tu khams bco brgyad bshad de /
analyzed: // / mdo sde las skye mched bcu gnyis kyi 'og tu khams bco brgyad bshad de /
translated: The eighteen elements are explained in the sutras immediately following the twelve bases.

original: de bas na mdo dang mthun par 'dir yang skye mched kyi 'og tu khams bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na mdo dang mthun par 'dir yang skye mched kyi 'og tu khams bshad par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, in this treatise, the elements should be explained immediately following the bases, in accordance with the sutras.

original: de la khams la grangs ni du yod /
analyzed: de la khams la grangs ni du yod /
translated: How many elements are there?üîΩWhat are their actual entities?

original: de dag dngos su gang dang gang yin pa bstan pa dang / ci'i phyir khams zhes pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag dngos su gang dang gang yin pa bstan pa dang / ci'i phyir khams zhes pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: And what is the meaning of the term element?

original: khams bco brgyad ni zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩkhams la grangs ni bco brgyad yod //
analyzed: khams bco brgyad ni zhes bya ba smos te / khams la grangs ni bco brgyad yod //
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúThe elements are eighteen.‚Äù

original: ces bya ba'i don to ;üîΩ/ de dag dngos gad yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ces bya ba'i don to ;üîΩ/ de dag dngos gad yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The meaning of the root text is that there are eighteen elements.üîΩThe root text states, ‚ÄúThe eye element, the form element, and the eye-consciousness element.‚Äù

original: mig gi khams dang zhes bya ba nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang zhes bya ba'i bar du smos so //
analyzed: mig gi khams dang zhes bya ba nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang zhes bya ba'i bar du smos so //
translated: The eye element and so on up to the mind consciousness element.

original: de la mig gi khams dang / rna ba'i khams dang / sna'i khams dang / lce'i khams dang / lus kyi khams lnga dang / gzugs kyi khams dang ; sgra'i khams dang / dri'i khams dang / ro'i khams dang / reg bya'i khams te /
analyzed: de la mig gi khams dang / rna ba'i khams dang / sna'i khams dang / lce'i khams dang / lus kyi khams lnga dang / gzugs kyi khams dang ; sgra'i khams dang / dri'i khams dang / ro'i khams dang / reg bya'i khams te /
translated: The five elements of the eye faculty and so on, the form element, the sound element, the smell element, the taste element and the tangible object element.

original: khams bcu po de dag gang la bya dngos gang yin bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: khams bcu po de dag gang la bya dngos gang yin bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To indicate which of these ten elements are which,

original: mig la sogs pa'i khams dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i khams ni skye mched ji lta ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i khams dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i khams ni skye mched ji lta ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: the Abhidharmakosa states, The elements of the eye and so on and the form and so on are the sense bases.

original: gzugs kyi phung po bshad ba'i skabs su rgyur byas pa'i gzugs bcu gcig las mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus rnams ni dbang po yin par bshad la /
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po bshad ba'i skabs su rgyur byas pa'i gzugs bcu gcig las mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus rnams ni dbang po yin par bshad la /
translated: In the section on the form aggregate, it explains that from the eleven types of derivative form, the eye, ear, nose, tongue and body are faculties.

original: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya rnams ni yul lnga yin par bshad pa las skye mched bshad pa'i skabs su yang mig la sogs pa'i dbang po nyid la mig gi skye mched nas lus kyi skye mched kyi bar du skye mched ldar bshad la /
analyzed: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya rnams ni yul lnga yin par bshad pa las skye mched bshad pa'i skabs su yang mig la sogs pa'i dbang po nyid la mig gi skye mched nas lus kyi skye mched kyi bar du skye mched ldar bshad la /
translated: The five objects are form, sound, smell, taste and tactility.üîΩIn the section on the sense bases, the five sense organs such as the eyes are explained as the five sense bases from the eye base to the body base.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul lnga ni skye mched kyi skabs su gzugs kyi skye mched nas reg bya'i skye mched ces skye mched lnga bshad do //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul lnga ni skye mched kyi skabs su gzugs kyi skye mched nas reg bya'i skye mched ces skye mched lnga bshad do //
translated: The five objects such as form are explained as the five sense bases from the form base to the tactility base.

original: khams bshad pa'i skabs su yang skye mched bcu po nyid la khams bcu zhes bya @125b ste ;
analyzed: khams bshad pa'i skabs su yang skye mched bcu po nyid la khams bcu zhes bya @125b ste ;
translated: In the section on the constituents, the ten sense bases are called the ten constituents.

original: mig gi skye mched la mig gi khams zhes bya ba dang / rna ba'i skye mched la rna ba'i khams zhes bya ba dang / sna'i skye mched la sna'i khams zhes bya ba dang / lce'i skye mched la lce'i khams zhes bya ba dang / lus kyi skye mched la lus kyi khams zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: mig gi skye mched la mig gi khams zhes bya ba dang / rna ba'i skye mched la rna ba'i khams zhes bya ba dang / sna'i skye mched la sna'i khams zhes bya ba dang / lce'i skye mched la lce'i khams zhes bya ba dang / lus kyi skye mched la lus kyi khams zhes bya ba dang /
translated: The eye sense base is called the eye element, the ear sense base is called the ear element, the nose sense base is called the nose element, the tongue sense base is called the tongue element, the body sense base is called the body element,

original: gzugs kyi skye mched la gzugs kyi khams zhes bya ba dang / sgra'i skye mched la sgra'i khams zhes bya ba nas reg bya'i skye mched la reg bya'i khams zhes bya bar zad pas na /
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye mched la gzugs kyi khams zhes bya ba dang / sgra'i skye mched la sgra'i khams zhes bya ba nas reg bya'i skye mched la reg bya'i khams zhes bya bar zad pas na /
translated: the form sense base is called the form element, the sound sense base is called the sound element and the tangible object sense base is called the tangible object element.

original: mig la sogs pa'i khams dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i khams ni skye mched ji lta ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i khams dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i khams ni skye mched ji lta ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Therefore the eye element and so on and the form element and so on are the same as the sense bases.

original: chos kyi khams zhes bya ba yang chos kyi skye mched kyi skabs su tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed de phung po gsum gyi steng du rnam par rig byed ma yin pas bsnan te bzhi dang / 'dus ma byas bzhi dang brgyad la chos kyi skye mched ces bya ba bshad pa'i chos brgyad po de nyid la chos kyi khams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi khams zhes bya ba yang chos kyi skye mched kyi skabs su tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed de phung po gsum gyi steng du rnam par rig byed ma yin pas bsnan te bzhi dang / 'dus ma byas bzhi dang brgyad la chos kyi skye mched ces bya ba bshad pa'i chos brgyad po de nyid la chos kyi khams zhes bya'o //
translated: The element of mental objects is the eight mental objects explained in the context of the mental object sense-field, namely, the three aggregates of feeling, perception and impulse, plus the four non-informative things, plus the four unconditioned things, making eight.

original: skye mched bshad pa'i skabs su rnam par shes pa'i phung po ste /
analyzed: skye mched bshad pa'i skabs su rnam par shes pa'i phung po ste /
translated: In the context of the explanation of the sense-fields, the aggregate of consciousness is the mental sense-field.

original: rnam par shes pa brgyad la yid kyi skye mched ces bshad pa /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa brgyad la yid kyi skye mched ces bshad pa /
translated: The eight consciousnesses are called the mental sense-field.

original: khams bshad pa'i skabs su ni yid kyi skye mched du bsdus pa'i chos brgyad la yid kyi khams zhes mi bya'i khams bshad pa'i tshe sems kyi khams bdun zhes bya ste /
analyzed: khams bshad pa'i skabs su ni yid kyi skye mched du bsdus pa'i chos brgyad la yid kyi khams zhes mi bya'i khams bshad pa'i tshe sems kyi khams bdun zhes bya ste /
translated: But in the context of the explanation of the elements, the eight mental objects included in the mental sense-field are not called the mental element. At the time of explaining the elements, the seven mental elements are explained.

original: de bas na de'i don bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na de'i don bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach its meaning,

original: rnam par shes pa drug gi khams ni mig la sogs pa la gnas te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa drug gi khams ni mig la sogs pa la gnas te /
translated: The six elements of consciousness are based on the eye, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs pa rnam par rig pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩde la mig la sogs pa la gnas te zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams nas /üîΩyid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar du drug po de dag ni mig gi skye mched nas yid kyi skye mched kyi bar du skye mched drug la brten te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs pa rnam par rig pa'o zhes bya ba smos te / de la mig la sogs pa la gnas te zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams nas / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar du drug po de dag ni mig gi skye mched nas yid kyi skye mched kyi bar du skye mched drug la brten te /
translated: They are the awarenesses that perceive form, etc.üîΩAmong them, ‚Äúbased on the eye, etc.‚Äù means that the six elements of consciousness, from the eye consciousness element up to the mind consciousness element, are based on the six sense bases, from the eye sense base up to the mind sense base.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa ni mig gi skye mched la brten pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni yid kyi skye mched la brten pas na rnam par shes pa drug gi khams ni mig la sogs pa gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa ni mig gi skye mched la brten pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni yid kyi skye mched la brten pas na rnam par shes pa drug gi khams ni mig la sogs pa gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since the eye consciousness is based on the eye sense base, up to the mind consciousness is based on the mind sense base, the six elements of consciousness are said to be based on the eye, etc.

original: gzhug la sogs pa la dmigs pa rnam par rig pa zhes bya ba la mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa drug gi yul ni gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang /
analyzed: gzhug la sogs pa la dmigs pa rnam par rig pa zhes bya ba la mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa drug gi yul ni gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang /
translated: The six consciousnesses that are the objects of the eye element and so on are called the six consciousness elements.

original: chos rnams so //üîΩdmigs pa @126a * //
analyzed: chos rnams so // dmigs pa @126a * //
translated: The objects of the six consciousnesses such as eye consciousness are form, sound, smell, taste, tactility, and phenomena.

original: zhes bya ba ni yul de dag gi rang bzhin shes par byed pa la bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yul de dag gi rang bzhin shes par byed pa la bya ste /
translated: The term object refers to the cause of knowing the nature of those objects.

original: gzugs kyi rang bzhin shes par byed pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa la mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gzugs kyi rang bzhin shes par byed pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa la mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Eye consciousness that causes one to know the nature of form is called the eye-consciousness element, and so on up to:

original: chos kyi rang bzhin shes par byed pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa la yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams zhes bya bar zad do //
analyzed: chos kyi rang bzhin shes par byed pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa la yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams zhes bya bar zad do //
translated: Mental consciousness that causes one to know the nature of phenomena is called the mental-consciousness element.

original: de ltar khams bcu bdun bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar khams bcu bdun bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the seventeen elements,

original: yid kyi khams zhes bya ba rnam par shes pa drug po nyid la bya'am 'on te de las ma gtogs pa'i yid kyi khams gzhan zhig yod snyam pa la /
analyzed: yid kyi khams zhes bya ba rnam par shes pa drug po nyid la bya'am 'on te de las ma gtogs pa'i yid kyi khams gzhan zhig yod snyam pa la /
translated: The mind element is called the six consciousnesses.

original: rnam par shes pa drug po nyid la yid kyi khams zhes bya bar zad kyi de las ma gtogs par yid kyi khams zhes bya ba med do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa drug po nyid la yid kyi khams zhes bya bar zad kyi de las ma gtogs par yid kyi khams zhes bya ba med do //
translated: The mind element is called the six consciousnesses alone. There is no mind element apart from them.

original: yid kyi khams ni de dag 'gags ma thag pa ste zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: yid kyi khams ni de dag 'gags ma thag pa ste zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The mind element is the immediately preceding cessation of those.

original: rnam par shes pa drug gi khams de dag sngar 'gags ma thag pa la yid kyi khams zhes bya bar zad kyi de ma gtogs par yid kyi khams zhes bya ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa drug gi khams de dag sngar 'gags ma thag pa la yid kyi khams zhes bya bar zad kyi de ma gtogs par yid kyi khams zhes bya ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The mind element is called the immediately preceding cessation of those six consciousnesses alone. Apart from that, there is no mind element called the mind element.
